nekr-w/sima, ta/, = neku/sia, Gloss.

ne/kr-wsis, ews, h(,
mortification, Aret.SA2.10, Gal.18(1).156; mh/tras Ep.Rom.4.19: metaph., nekrou\s o(rw=n ne/krwsin e(/ceis pragma/twn Astramps.Onir.p.6R.
death, th\n n. tou= *)ihsou= e)n tw=| sw/mati perife/rontes 2 Ep.Cor.4.10.

nekr-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
causing mortification, du/namis Gal.11.752.

ne/kta^r, a^ros, to/,
nectar, the specific nourishment of the gods; a)mbrosi/a (q.v.) and n. are differentiated in early Ep. as food and drink, Od. 5.93, h.Cer.49, h.Ap.10, cf. Pl.Phdr.247e: but conversely, n. e)/dmenai Alcm.100, cf. Anaxandr.57; ke/rasse de\ n. e)ruqro/n Od.l.c.; *(/hbh n. e)w|noxo/ei Il.4.3; ne/ktaros a)porrw/c, of choice wine, Od.9.359; n. a)mbrosi/hn te sta/con Il.19.347, cf. 38, Pi.P.9.63. later, of
wine, Call.Fr.115, Nic.Al.44, Eudem.Med. ap. Gal.14.185. called sarra/n and xalba/nh, 1 Enoch31.1. metaph., n. melissa=n, i.e. honey, E.Ba.143 (lyr.); ai)qeri/ou pthnai\ ne/ktaros e)rga/tides AP9.404 (Antiphil.), cf. 6.239 (Apollonid.); also, of
perfumed unguent, ib.6.275 (Noss.); of an ode, n. xuto/n, *moisa=n do/sin Pi.O.7.7, cf. Parth.2.76, AP4.1.36 (Mel.); n. e)narmo/nion ib.7.29 (Antip. Sid.).

nekta/reos [a^], e/a, Ion. e/h, eon,
nectarous, in Hom. of garments, i.e.
fragrant, n. e(ano/s, xitw/n, Il.3.385, 18.25; n. spondai/ Pi.I.6(5).37; ku/lic AP6.248 (Marc. Arg.); *bromi/ou nekta/reai propo/seis BMus.Inscr.1036 (Caria); to\ n. po/ma Luc.Herm.60: neut. as Adv., nekta/reon mei/dhse A.R.3.1009.
nekta/r-ion [a^], to/, = e(le/nion, Dsc.1.28. name of a medicine, Gal.13.282; of various eye-salves, Id.12.750,773.

nektar-i/ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, wine
flavoured with nekta/rion, Dsc.5.56, Plin.HN14.108.

nekta^ro-eidh/s, e/s,
like nectar, po/ma IGRom.4.682 (Phrygia, ii A.D.).

nekta^ro-sta^gh/s, e/s, (sta/zw)
dropping nectar, Ar.Fr.579, Eub.124.

nekta^rw/dhs, es,
like nectar, Gp.5.2.10.

neku^-a^gwgh/, h(,
calling up of spirits, necromancy, PMag.Par.1.222.
neku^-a^gwgo/s, o/n, = nekragwgo/s, of Hermes, Tab.Defix.Aud. 242.10 (Carthage, iii A.D.).

neku^-a/mba^tos, on, (a)nabai/nw) of Charon's boat,
embarked in by the dead, Epic. ap. Paus.10.28.2.

neku^-dai/mwn, onos, o(,
ghost of a dead man, PMag.Par.1.368, al., Tab.Defix.Aud. 234.1 (Carthage, ii/iii A.D.).

neku/da^los or neku^/-allos, o(, (ne/kus)
the nympha of the silkworm, Arist. HA551b12, Ath.8.352f.
neku^-hgo/s, o/n, （a)/gw） = nekragwgo/s, AP7.68 (Arch.), Epigr.in Berl.Sitzb.1894.908 (Avdjilar).

neku^-hdo/n, Adv.
corpse-like, Euph.88, Sch. D.T.p.276H.

neku^-hpo/los, on,
having to do with the dead, Man.1.330.

ne/kuia, h(, (ne/kus) a magical
rite by which ghosts were called up and questioned about the future, Plu.2.17b (pl.); nekui/a| xrh/sasqai Hdn. 4.12.4; name for the eleventh Book of the Odyssey, D.S.4.39, Plu. 2.740e.
funeral ceremony, tw=n a)mfi\ th\n n. te kai\ ta\s diaqh/kas kalindoume/nwn Luc.Nigr.30.
rabble, used contemptuously of Caesar's entourage, Cic.Att.9.18.2, cf. Attic. ap. eund.Att.9.10.7. . = flo/mos, so called because used in necromancy, Cyran. 30 (written neku/a).

neku-i+ko/s, h/, o/n,
of the dead, mantei=ai Cyran.30.
neku-i+smo/s, o(, = ne/kuia 1, Man.4.213.

neku^o-dai/mwn, onos, o(,
god of the dead, Sammelb.4947 (iii A.D.), Rev.Phil.1930.249.

neku^o-mantei/a, h(, sub-title of Luc.Menipp.; also of the eleventh Book of the Odyssey, Hermog.Prog.2, Eust.1670.23: pl. -ti/ai, =
defixiones, Gloss.

neku^o-mantei=on, Ion. neku^o-h/i+on, to/,
oracle of the dead, where ghosts were called up, Hdt.5.92. h/, Cic.Tusc.1.16.37, D.S.4.22, Plu.Cim.6, Paus.9.30.6: in pl., PMag.Lond.121.285.

neku^o-mantiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for evocation of the dead, yuxagwgi/ai Eust.1615.4.
neku^o/-mantis, ews, o(, h(, = nekro/mantis, Str.16.2.39, Ptol.Tetr. 181, Artem.2.69.
neku^o-pompo/s (sc. li/mnh), h(, name of a mythical lake, Sch.Od.p.5 Buttm. (cf. Jo. Malal.p.121).

neku^o-sto/los, on,
ferrying the dead over the Styx, of Charon, AP7.63,530 (Antip. Thess.); also n. *ai)=sa Man.4.405.
bearing the dead, of a bier, AP7.634 (Antiphil.).

ne/kus (Lacon. ne/kur Hsch.), u^os, o(, poet. dat. ne/kui+ Il.16.526, etc.; Ep. dat. pl. neku/essi Od.11.491, ne/kussi ib.569, 22.401, 23.45; acc. pl. ne/ku_s Il.7.420, 18.180, Od.24.417, E.Fr.176.4; also ne/kuas Il.7.418, al.:—
corpse, freq. in Il., less freq. in Od.; in Il.4.492,493, ne/kus and nekro/s are used of the same dead person; n. a)ndro/s Hdt.1.140, cf. 3.16, 24, S.Ant.26, E.Or.1585; n. teqnhw/s, katateqnhw/s, Il. 18.173, 16.526; ne/kues katateqnhw=tes, kta/menoi, katafqi/menoi, Od.10.530, 23.45, 11.491; a)ndro\s *pe/rsew o( n. Hdt.1.140, cf.3.16; o( katqanw\n n. S.Ant.515;
dead person, neku/wn sw/mata E.Supp.62 (lyr.). in pl.,
spirits of the dead, freq. in Od.11, less freq. in Il.; neku/wn a)menhna\ ka/rhna Od.11.29, cf.Il.15.251; ped' a)mau/rwn n. Sapph.68. as Adj.
dead, post-Hom., e)xqro\n w(=d' ai)dh=| ne/kun; S.Aj.1356; ki/xlai ai( ne/kues AP11.96 (Nicarch.); cf. however Il.24.35,423.—Poet. word, used also by Hdt., in IG22.1672.119 (iv B.C.), in Cretan, Kohler-Ziebarth
Stadtrecht von Gortyn p.35, and in late Prose, Plu.Crass.19, Hdn.4.8.5. [u_ of nom. and acc. sg. in Hom., Il.4.492, 22.386, etc.; u^ Simon.114.5, E.Supp.70 (lyr.), Or.1585, and in later Poets, A.R. 4.480, Bion 1.71, AP7.1 (Alc. Mess.).] (Cf. Avest.
nasu- 'corpse', Skt.
náśyati 'perish', 'disappear', Lat.
necare.）

neku/sia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival of the dead, PLond.ined.2309r.21 (iii B.C.), Bull.Soc.Alex.7.67 (iii B.C.), Artem.4.81, Eust.1615.2.
*neku/sios, o(, the eleventh month in Crete, SIG712.56 (ii B.C.), Hemerolog.Flor.

nekusso/os, on,
rousing the dead to life, Nonn.D.44.204.
neku^w/rion or neku/wron, to/, （w)/ra） = nekromantei=on, Hsch.

*neme/a, Ion. neku^o-e/h, Ep. neku^o-ei/h (Hes.Th.329, Epic.Alex.Adesp.8.1), h(, (ne/mos)
wooded district between Argos and Corinth, Pi.O.9.87: freq. in locative *neme/a|, ib.7.82, etc.; Dor. contr. *nemh=| SIG36 B19 (Olympia, v B.C.), etc.:—Adj. *ne/meios, a, on,
Nemean, to\n *n. qh=ra E.HF 153; o( *zeu\s o( *n. Th.3.96; *ne/meos, Theoc.25.169; tou= *n. le/ontos Luc.Philops.8; *nemeiai=os, Hes.Th.327; *nemeai=os, Pi.N.2.4, etc.; *nemea^ko/s, Sch.Pi.N.1.7; *nemeh/ths *zeu/s, St. Byz.; *nemeih/ths, Max. 102, 346:—poet. fem. Adj. *nemea/s, a/dos, Pi.N.3.2:—Adv. *neme/a_qen, poet. neku^o/-hqe,
from Nemea, Call.Fr.103. *ne/mea (sc. i(era/), ta/,
the Nemean games, Pi.O.13.34, SIG82.4 (Delph., iv B.C.), IG22.365, etc.; *ne/meia, ib.12.606, 3.129, etc. *ne/meion (sc. i(ero/n), to/,
temple of Nemean Zeus, in Locris, Plu.2.162c.

neme/qw, Ep. for ne/mw, neme/qwn Nic.Th.430:—in Med., once in Hom., neme/qonto, of doves,
were feeding, Il.11.635, cf. AP14.4, Keil-Premerstein
Erster Berichtp.9 (Troketta).
nemeni/an: noumhni/an, Hsch.; cf. nemonhi/+a.

*nemeoni/khs [i_], ou, o(,
victor in the Nemean games, Sch.Pi.N.7.118, CIG4359 (Pamphylia).

nemesa/w, used by Hom. and Hes. in contr. forms nemesw=, -w=si (v. infr.); Ep. 3sg. nemessa=| Hes.Op.756; imper. neme/ssa Od.23.213: impf. e)neme/swn Plu.Sull.6; Ep. e)neme/ssa Il.13.16, Ep. 3sg. neme/saske 11.543 (as cited by Arist.Rh.1387a35): fut. -h/sw Arist. ib.12: aor. e)neme/shsa D.45.71, etc.; poet. neme/shsa Od.21.285; Dor. -a_sa Pi.I.1.3:—Med. and Pass., Ep. nemessw=mai Il.13.119: fut. nemesh/somai 10.129: Ep. aor. opt. nemessh/saito Od.1.228: more freq. aor. Pass. nemessh/qh 1.119, 3pl. -qen Il.2.223, etc.:—
feel just resentment, to be wroth at undeserved good or
bad fortune (cf. ne/mesis) freq. of the gods, neme/shse de\ po/tnia *(/hrh Il.8.198; tw=| de\ qeoi\ nemesw=si Hes.Op.741, etc., cf. Arist.Rh.1386b16; also of men, sts. abs., mh\ neme/sa Il.10.145; to\ nemesa=n, opp. to\ fqonei=n, Cic.Att. 5.19.3; n. tini/
to be wroth with a person or
at a thing, Il.24.53, etc.: rarely in Prose, Pl.Lg.927c, D.20.161: c. part., ou) nemesw= *)agame/mnoni . . o)tru/nonti if he incites, ll.4.413; nemesa=| o( qeo/s, o(/tan . . Pl.Min.319a: c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, mh\ nu=n moi to/de xw/eo mhde\ neme/ssa Od.23.213, cf. Hes.Op.756, Arist.Rh.1384b4; n. e)pi/ tini ib. 1387a6, Onos.4.2: c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, Luc.Scyth.9, Porph.Abst. 2.7:—Pass., e)nemesh/qh (sc. by the gods) Plu.Cat.Mi.38.
grudge, ta\s eu)pragi/as h( tu/xh tisi\ e)neme/shse J.BJ1.22.1:—Pass., ei) nemeshqei/hn th=s e)pibolh=s ib.6.1.6. Med. and Pass., prop.
to be displeased with oneself, nemessa=tai d' e)ni\ qumw=| . . e)pes boli/as a)nafai/nein
is indignant, ashamed at the thought of . . , rejects it as unseemly, Od.4.158;
feel shame, nemessh/qhte kai\ au)toi/, a)/llous t' ai)de/sqhte 2.64; nemessh/qhte de\ qumw=| Il.16.544; pa=sin de\ nemesshqei=sa methu/da 15.103. Med. in act. sense, freq. in Hom., c. dat. pers., ei)/ pe/r moi nemesh/seai Il.10.115, cf. 129: c. part., nemessh/saito/ ken . . o(ro/wn Od. 1.228: c. inf., nemessw=mai/ ge me\n ou)de\n klai/ein 4.195: c. acc. et inf., ou)/ se nemessw=mai kexolw=sqai 18.227: c. acc. rei, nemessa=tai kaka\ e)/rga
is wroth at evil deeds, 14.284.—Poet. Verb, never in Trag., rare in good Prose (v. supr.).
*neme/s-eia, v. *neme/sia.

*nemes-ei=on, to/,
temple of Nemesis, St.Byz. s.v. *)isei=on, Theognost.Can.129; written *nemes-h=on Bull.Soc.Alex. No.4p.50.

nemes-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
disposed to indignation at any one's undeserved good or
ill fortune, Arist.EN1108b3, Rh.1387b4.

nemes-hto/s, h/, o/n, in Hom. always nemesshto/s, exc. Il.11.649:—
causing indignation or
wrath, worthy of it, nemesshto\n de/ ken ei)/h 3.410, etc.: c. inf., ou)/ ti nemesshto\n kexolw=sqai 9.523, Od.22.59; ou)/toi nemeshto/n S.Ph.1193 (lyr.), cf. Pl.Euthd.282b; ou) n. to\ diamarta/nein Phld.Sto.339.12; n.
i)dei=n Tyrt.10.26; yeu=dos de\ . . n. kata\ fu/sin Pl.Lg.943e; nemeshto\n e)a\n . .
it is matter for indignation that . . , Arist.Rh.1387a32, cf. IPE12.34.17 (Olbia).
retributive, e)/paqe pra=gma n.
retribution, Plu. Ages.22 ; so nemeshta\ paqei=n Id.Per.37; pa/qos n. e)/paqe Id.Pomp.38; to\ n. a)fosiou/menos ib.42.
deserving retribution, Nic.Dam.68.9J. Act.,
prone to wrath, ai)doi=os nemeshto/s Il.11.649; *ku/pri nemessata/ Theoc.1.101.

*neme/sia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival of Nemesis, also held in honour of the dead, D.41.11 (v.l. -eia), *(ellhnika/ 3.154 (Rhamnus, iii B.C.).

nemesi/zomai, Ep. Verb, only pres. and impf.,
feel righteous indignation, *zeu= pa/ter, ou) nemesi/zh| o(rw=n ta/de kartera\ e)/rga; Il.5.872, cf. Od. 2.138: c. dat. pers., *(/hrh| d' ou)/ ti to/son nemesi/zomai Il.8.407: c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, ou) nemesi/zh| *)/arh| ta/de kartera\ e)/rga; 5.757: c. acc. et inf.,
to be angry or
amazed that . . , ou) nemesi/zom' *)axaiou\s a)sxala/an 2.296; nemesize/sqw d' e)ni\ qumw=| *pa/t roklon . . me/lphqra gene/sqai 17.254.
stand in awe of, qeou/s Od.1.263.
neme/sion, to/, = w)kimoeide/s, Ps.-Dsc.4.28.
*neme/sion, to/, = *nemesei=on, IG22.1310, *(ellhnika/ 3.154 (Rhamnus, iii B.C.).

ne/mesis, ews, h(, Ep. dat. neme/ssi Il.6.335: (ne/mw):—prop., like ne/mhsis,
distribution of what is due; but in usage always
retribution, esp.
righteous anger aroused by injustice, not used of the gods in Hom.; n. de/ moi e)c a)nqrw/pwn e)/ssetai Od.2.136, cf. 22.40, Il.6.351; ai)dw= kai\ ne/mesin (where ai). is subjective, n. objective) 13.122 (the two personified, Hes.Op.200) : c. gen. obj., *trw/wn xo/lw| ou)de\ neme/ssi Il.6.335; esp. in phrase ou) ne/mesis it is no
cause for anger that . . , c. inf., ou) ga/r tis n. fuge/ein kako/n 14.80: c. acc. et inf., 3.156; penqei=n ou) xrh/: n. ga/r S.OC1753 (anap.); ti/s ta/de n. stugei=; A.Th.235 (lyr.); later, of the
wrath of the gods, e)k qeou= n. Hdt.1.34; qew=n n. S.Ph.518 (lyr.), 602, cf. OGI383.115 (Nemrud Dagh, i B.C.); also h( e)k tou= no/mou n. Ael.VH6.10;
indignation at undeserved good fortune, n. meso/ths fqo/nou kai\ e)pixairekaki/as Arist.EN1108a35. *ne/mesis, ews, h(, as pr. n., voc. *ne/mesi S.El.792:—
Nemesis, the impersonation of
divine Retribution, coupled with *ai)dw/s, Hes. Op.200 (v. supr.), cf. Th.223; u(pe/rdikos N. Pi.P.10.44; *)adra/steia kai\ N. SIG2940.16 (Cos): in Trag. and later writers freq.
avenger of the dead, A.Fr.266, etc.; e)/sti ga\r e)n fqime/nois N. me/ga Epigr.Gr.367.9; *ne/mesi tou= qano/ntos S.l.c.: in pl., ka/llous ei)si/ tines *neme/seis; AP11.326 (Autom.); two were worshipped at Smyrna, Paus.7.5.2, cf. CIG2663 (Halic.), IGRom.4.1431.5 (Smyrna), AP12.193 (Strat.), Supp.Epigr.4.277 (Panamara). Astrol., name of the seventh klh=ros (tou= *kro/nou) Paul.Al.K.3, Rhetor.in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.160, 168, cf. Vett.Val.2.22. Pythag. name for
five, Theol.Ar.31.

entryFree.sense: Nemesis-stone, a stone with magical properties, Cyran.30.

div0.entryFree:
neme/twr, oros, o(,
dispenser of justice, avenger, *zeu/s A.Th.485 (lyr.).
nemh/i+os, o(, epith. of Zeus, Archyt. ap. Stob.4.1.138 (expld. as from ne/mw).

ne/m-hsis, ews, h(, (ne/mw)
distribution, tou= xwri/ou Is.9.17; tw=n koinw=n Phld.Rh.2.125 S.; ou)si/as Poll.8.135; basilei/as J.AJ17.11.1; xrhma/twn Hld.1.19, cf. Charito 3.7. (ne/mw A.11)
land in occupation, area, territory, *mounixi/as IG12.894, cf.462 (prob.). (ne/mw B.1.2c)
spreading, Aret.CA1.9.

nem-hte/on,
one must assign, ti/ tini Adrast. ap. Theo Sm.p.65H.
nem-hth/s, ou=, o(, = neme/twr, Poll.8.136.
nem-hto/s, h/, o/n, dub. sens., to\n n. a)gw=na tw=n *(omolwi/+wn IG7.3196.23 (Orchom. Boeot.).
nem-h/tria, h(, fem. of nemhth/s, ib.14.956B5.
nemonhi/+a, h(, = noumhni/a, SIG527.146 (Crete, iii B.C.).

ne/mos, eos, to/, (ne/mw B)
wooded pasture, glade, e)n ne/mei+ skierw=| Il.11.480, AP7.55 (Alc.), cf. S.Aj.413 (lyr.), IG9(2).205.8 (Phthiotis, iii B.C.), BCH49.100 (Delph.).

ne/mw, fut. nemw= S.Aj.513, (a)po-) Pl.Phlb.65b, later nemh/sw Longus 2.23: aor. e)/neima, Ep. nei=ma Il.3.274: pf. nene/mhka (dia-) X.Cyr.4.5.45:—Med., ne/momai, fut. nemou=mai Th.4.64, D.21.203; Ion. neme/omai (a)na-) Hdt.1.173; later nemh/somai D.H.8.71, Plu.Crass.14, etc.: aor. e)neima/mhn Th.8.21, etc. (e)nemhsa/mhn is f.l. in Clearch.10, Hp.Oss.18 (u(po-)):—Pass., fut. nemhqh/somai Plu.Agis14 (also nemh/somai in pass. sense (dia-) App.BC4.3): aor. e)nemh/qhn Pl.Lg.849c, D.36.38 (also in med. sense (kat-) Plu.Per.34, Ath.15.677e): pf. nene/mhmai Pl.Prm. 144d, etc. (also in med. sense, D.47.35).—Hom. uses of the Act., only pres., impf., and aor.; of the Med., pres. and impf.
deal out, dispense, freq. in Hom., esp. of meat and drink, moi/ras, ku/pella, kre/a, me/qu n., Od.8.470, 10.357, Il.9.217, Od.7.179, cf. IG12.10.3, al.; oi( gewno/moi neima/ntwn th\n gh=n ib.45.7: then generally,
distribute, of the gods, *zeu\s . . ne/mei o)/lbon . . a)nqrw/poisin Od.6.188; *zeu\s ta/ te kai\ ta\ ne/mei Pi.I.5(4).52, cf. P.5.55; qew=n ta\ i)/s a nemo/ntwn Hdt.6.11, 109; *zeu\s ne/mwn ei)ko/tws a)/dika me\n kakoi=s, o(/sia d' e)nno/mois A.Supp.403 (lyr.); [*dii\] to\n u(peralgh= xo/lon n.
leave vengeance to Zeus, S.El.176 (lyr.); of men, n. deuterei=a/ tini Hdt.1.32; tri/ton me/ros tw=n sku/lwn tisi/ Th.3.114; moi=ran n. tini/
pay one
due honour, respect, A.Pr.294 (lyr.); mhtro\s tima\s n.
respect her privileges, Id.Eu.624 (but pro/sw n. tima/s
extend one's privileges, ib.747); *lu/kw| kh=pon *eu)boi/as ne/mei S.Fr.24; *polukra/ths mhte/ra ne/mei P.
allots a mother (to you), prov. in Duris63 J.; ei) patro\s ne/moi tin' w)/ran tou= kalw=s pra/ssein dokei=n S. Tr.57; to\ so\n ge/ras timh\n e)moi\ n. Id.Ph.1062; e)kei/nw| . . ai)ti/an ne/mei Id.Aj.28; n. ai(/resin
give one a choice, ib.265; nau/tais ou)ke/q' o(do\n ne/mei
affords, vouchsafes, E.Hipp.745 (lyr.); to\ pisto\n th=s a)lhqei/as n.
observe it, S.Tr.398; tw=| . . o)/xlw| ple/on n. E.Hec.868; mh/te oi)/ktw| ple/on n. mh/t' e)pieikei/a| Th.3.48; to\ h(=sson a)diki/a| E.Supp.380 (lyr.); tw=| fqo/nw| ple/on me/ros ib.241; to\ plei=ston h(me/ras tou/tw| me/ros Id.Fr.183; e)/lasso/n tini Antipho 5.10; xa/rin tini/ Ar.Av.384; peni/a| kai\ plou/tw| timh\n n. Pl.Lg.696a; of judges, kolasth\n . . qa/naton n. ib.863a; suggnw/mhn tisi/ Gal.6.753: c. inf., nei=men e)moi\ te/ryin o(milei=n S.Aj.1201 (lyr.):—Pass., ne/metai e)pi\ tou\s *(/ellhnas
is freely bestowed upon them, Hdt.9.7.a'; kre/a nenemhme/na
portions of meat, X.An.7.3.21; plei=sta me/rh h( ou)si/a nenemhme/nh
distributed into . . , Pl.Prm. 144d.
pay out, distribute a bandage, in Act. and Pass., Hp. Off.8,22, Fract.4,16, Sor.Fasc.4, al.
allot, distribute in groups, pro\s th\n lh=cin e(ka/sthn Arist.Ath.30.3, cf. 31.3 (Pass.); nei=mai/ tinas e)s ta\s fula\s de/kaxa IG22.1.33:—Pass., e)k th=s fulh=s e(ka/sths nenemhme/nai trittu/es trei=s Arist.Ath.8.3, cf. 63.4. Med.,
distribute among themselves: hence,
have and hold as one's portion, possess, patrw/i+a pa/nta ne/mesqai Od.20.336: mostly of land, teme/nea, te/menos, 11.185, Il.12.313; e)/rga 2.751, Hes.Op.119; pro\s to\n a)delfo\n e)neima/mhn (sc. ou)si/an) Lys.16.10, cf. 19.46; ta)/lla nemome/nh
administering . . , Hdt.4.165; ta\ me/talla, ta\ e)mpo/ria, Id.7.112, Th. 1.100; [ta\ lh/mmata] a(\ ne/mesqe which you
enjoy, D.3.33: abs., e)/m' oi)/esq' u(mi=n ei)soi/sein u(ma=s de\ nemei=sqai; that you
shall reap the fruit, Id.21.203.
reap the fruit of: hence,
dwell in, inhabit, a)/lsea ne/mesqai Il.20.8; freq. with names of places,
spread over, occupy a country, *)iqa/khn, *(uri/hn ne/mesqai, Od.2.167, Il.2.496; a)grou/s Pi.P.4.150; to\ pro\s th\n h)w= Hdt.4.19, etc.; nemo/menoi ta\ au(tw=n . . o(/son a)pozh=n Th.1.2. generally,
enjoy, proso/dous BGU256.9 (ii A.D.), etc. of cities,
to be situated upon, to\n *)/aqwn Hdt.7.23, cf. 123:— Pass., a)/xri th=s o(dou= th=sde to\ a)/stu th=|de nene/mhtai IG12.893; cf. ne/mhsis 11.1. in Pi., of Time,
spend, pass, ai)w=na, a(me/ran, O.2.66, N.10.56: abs.,
live, h(suxa=| nemo/menos P.11.55. from Pi. onwards, Act. is found in sense of Med.,
hold, possess, e(/dos *)olu/mpou n. O.2.12; e)/ndon n. plou=ton krufai=on I.1.67;
inhabit, gh=n n. Hdt.4.191; xwri/on koinh=| n. Th.5.42; po/lin S.OC879 (lyr.); o(/ti plei/stous n. a)/ndras
to have as many husbands as possible, Str.11.13.11: abs.,
hold land, occupy, dwell, n. peri\ th\n li/mnhn Hdt.4.188:—Pass., of places,
to be inhabited, pa/nta u(po\ barba/roisi ne/metai Id.7.158: abs., of a country,
maintain itself, be constituted, Th.1.5,6.
hold sway over, manage, po/lin Hdt. 1.59, 5.29; ta\s *)aqh/nas ib.71, etc.; lao/n Pi.O.13.27; pa/nta A.Pr.526 (lyr.); a)strapa=n kra/th n. S.OT201 (lyr.); kra/th kai\ qro/nous ib.237, cf.Aj.1016; su/nodon OGI50.3 (Ptolemais, iii B.C.); to\n me/gan *paktwlo\n eu)/xruson ne/meis S.Ph.393 (lyr.); oi)/aka n.
wield, manage it, A.Ag. 802 (anap.); a)spi/d' eu)/kuklon n. Id.Th.590; i)sxu\n n. e)pi\ skh/ptrois
support oneself on staves, Id.Ag.75 (anap.); n. glw=ssan
use the tongue, ib.685 (lyr.); n. po/da Pi.N.6.15: abs.,
hold sway, o(\s *surako/ssaisi n. Id.P.3.70.
hold, consider as . . , se\ ne/mw qeo/n S.El.150 (lyr.), cf. 598, Tr.483, Aj.1331 (so in Pass., ou)de/ moi e)mmele/ws to\ *pitta/keion ne/metai
seems not to me fitly said, Simon.5.9): in Prose, prosta/thn ne/mein tina/
register as one's patron, Isoc.8.53, Hyp.Fr.21, Arist.Pol.1275a12; h(gemo/na n. tina/ Agatharch.Fr.Hist.17J.; a)qlhtw=n tou\s mh\ nenemhme/nous h)\ seswmaskhko/tas
unproved athletes, Plb. 6.47.8.
call over, recite, S.Fr.144; = a)naginw/skw, Hsch. of herdsmen,
pasture, graze their flocks,
drive to pasture, abs., e)ph=lqe ne/mwn Od.9.233; [xw/ran] i(kanh\n ne/mein te kai\ a)rou=n both for
pasture and tillage, Pl.R.373d: c. acc., o( me\n i(/ppous ne/mwn, o( de\ bou=s Hdt.8.137; mh=la E.Cyc.28, etc.; kth/nh plhgh=| n.
drive them
afield with blows, Pl.Criti.109c, cf. Heraclit.11 (Pass.). more freq. in Med., of cattle,
feed, graze, Il.5.777, 15.631, Od.13.407, Hdt. 8.115, etc.: c. acc. loci,
range over, w(s le/aina . . dru/oxa nemome/na E.El. 1163 (lyr.); koloioi\ tapeina\ n. Pi.N.3.82: c. acc. cogn.,
feed on, ne/meai . . a)/nqea poi/hs Od.9.449; noma/s Hdt.1.78; xlo/hn E.Ba.735; ta\ leuka\ sh/sama Ar.Av.159; of men,
eat, S.Ph.709 (lyr.). metaph., of fire,
consume, devour, Il.23.177, Hdt.5.101; also to\ yeu=dos . . ne/metai th\n yuxh/n Plu.2.165a. Medic., abs., of ulcers,
spread, e)ne/meto pro/sw Hdt.3.133, cf. Thphr.HP9.9.5; of gangrene, prob. in D.S.17.103; of thrush, Asclep. ap. Gal.12.995; e)pi\ ma=llon n. Aret.CA1.9; e)s to\ ei)/sw n. ibid.; of a swelling, o)/gkos nemo/menos Philum.Ven.17.1. c. acc. loci, o)/rh ne/mein
graze the hills [with cattle], X.Cyr.3.2.20:—Pass., [to\ o)/ros] ne/metai ai)ci\ kai\ bousi/ Id.An. 4.6.17. metaph., puri\ ne/mein po/lin
waste a city by fire,
give it to the flames, Hdt.6.33:—Pass., puri\ xqw\n ne/moito
were being devoured, wasted by fire, Il.2.780; puri\ ne/metai . . h( fa/lagc Plu.Alex. 18. (Cf. OHG.
neman 'take', Avest.
n[schwa]mah- 'loan', Lith.
nuoma 'rent', 'usury'.)
ne/nasmai, pf. Pass. of nai/w (only poet.); also (in Prose) of na/ssw.

nenasme/nws: e)pieikw=s, Hsch. nene/atai, Ion. 3pl. pf. Pass. of ne/w,
to heap.

nenhfo/tws, Adv.
soberly, Thom.Mag.p.245 R.

neni/hlos [i^], on,
foolish, silly: or
weak-eyed, purblind, Call.Jov. 63, cf. Hsch.
ne/niptai, v. ni/zw.
nenna/zei: kakologei=, Hsch. (leg. denna/zei).

ne/nnos, o(,
mother's or
father's brother, uncle, Eust.971.26; but,
mother's brother, Poll.3.22, cf. IG12(3).1628 (Thera), cj. in Epigr. ap. Plu.2.1033e; or (in poetry),
mother's father, Poll.3.16 (v.l. no/nnos, q.v.); cf. na/nnas, ni/nnh.

nenomisme/nws, Adv.
in the established manner, Callistr.Stat.6.
neno/s: eu)h/qhs, Hsch. ne/nofen: nene/fwtai, Phot.; v. sunne/fw.
ne/nwmai, nenwme/nos, v. noe/w.
neo-aldh/s, e/s, = nealdh/s, v.l. for neoardh/s, Il.21.346, ap.Hsch.

neo-a^lh/s, e/s,
freshly salted, turo/s Dsc.2.71; cf. nealh/s.
neo-a/lwtos [a^], on, v.l. for nea/lwtos, Hdt.9.120.

neo-ardh/s, e/s,
newly, freshly watered, a)lwh/ Il.21.346; cf. neoaldh/s.

neo-auch/s, e/s, = neau/chtos.
Hsch. s.v. neoqro/tois:—also neo-au/chtos, on, Apollon.Lex.s.v. neoarde/a.

neo/-bdaltos, on,
newly milked, ga/la Nic.Th.606, Ruf.Fr.59, Paul.Aeg.1.72.
neo-blasth/s, e/s, = sq., Opp.H.1.735.

neo/-blastos, on,
sprouting afresh, Thphr.HP1.8.5, Nic.Al.484.

neo/-boros, on,
lately, newly devoured, Hsch.
neo-bro/xoi: e)/gkuoi, Id.

neo-brw/s, w=tos, o(, h(,
having just eaten, Hp.Acut.19.

neo-ga/lac [ga^], aktos, o(, h(,
just beginning to suck, Hdn.Gr.1.352.
neo-ga^mh/s, e/s, = neo/gamos, Phot.

neo-ga^mhth/, h(,
nova nupta, Gloss.

neo/-ga^mos, on,
newly married, of husband or wife, Hdt.1.36,37, D.H.8.56; n. nu/mfh, ko/rh, A.Ag.1179, E.Med.324; n. le/ktra ib.1348.
married early, Ptol.Tetr.183.

neo-genh/s, e/s,
new-born, A.Ch.530, Pl.Tht.160e, al., X.Cyn.10.23; poi/mnh Antiph.52.4, cf.1.5.
newly produced, khri/a Alciphr.3.23.
neo-ge/nnhtos, on, gloss on neogilo/s, Phot.
neo-ghlh/s, e/s, acc. sg. neoghle/a, nebro/n v.l. for neoqhle/a in Anacr.51 ap.Sch. Pi.O.3.52; fort. neogile/a from neogi_lh/s, e/s, = sq.

neo-gi_lo/s, h/, o/n,
new-born, young, sku/lac Od.12.86; bre/fos Is.Fr.12, Theoc. 17.58; e)/rifos Alciphr.1.27; o)dou\s n. one
of the first set of teeth, Opp.C.1.199; bi/ou xro/nos n. life
short as childhood, Luc.Halc.3. (In Od. l.c. glossed neognh=s, . . newsti\ gennhqei/shs by Hsch.; also ga/lakti trefome/nhs by Sch.Od.; spelling and etym. are doubtful, perh. cf. Lith.
žindù 'suckle'.)

neo-gla^gh/s, e/s, = neoga/lac, pw=loi Max.517.
newly yielding milk, mazoi/ Nonn.D.48.764.

neo-glu^fh/s, e/s,
newly carved, mhroi/ Tryph.332.

neo-gno/s, h/, o/n, = neo/gonos, pai=s h.Cer.141, cf. h.Merc.406, Hdt.2.2, Hp.Aph.3.24, A.Ag.1163 codd. (lyr.), E.Ion31: in Att. Prose, X.Oec.7.21: freq. of young beasts, poi/mnhs neogno\n qre/mma E.El.495; ta\ neogna/ X.Cyn.5.14, Arist.PA665b7.
neo/-gonos, on, = neogenh/s, E.Ion1001, Cyc.206, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.36.8.

neo/-graptos, on,
newly painted, qa/lamos Theoc.18.3.

neo/-gra^fos, on,
newly written, e)/rnea AP4.1.55 (Mel.).

neo/-guios, on,
with young limbs, fw=tes Pi.N.9.24; h(/ba Id.Fr.123.9.

neo-gu/nhs [u^], ou, o(,
just-wived, Amips.34.

neo-da/kru_tos, on,
weeping afresh, Hsch. s.v. neosta/luges.
neo-da/mastos [da^], on, = neo/dmhtos, Phot. s.v. neo/dmhton, Sch.Lyc.65.

neo-da_mw/dhs, es, a Spartan word,
lately made one of the people (da=mos = dh=mos),
newly enfranchised, du/natai de\ to\ n. e)leu/qeron h)/dh ei)=nai Th.7.58: applied to Helots freed by the state in reward for service in war, *ei(/lwsi kai\ n. kai\ toi=s perioi/kois X.HG3.3.6, cf. 5.2.24, Myro I J.

neo/-dartos, on,
newly stripped off, de/rmata Od.4.437, Arist.Pr.889b10, cf. Od.22.363; r(ino/s Epic. inArch.Pap.7.3; a)sko/s Aen.Tact.32.3.
newly flayed, bo/es X.An.4.5.14.

neo-di/daktos [i^], on, of dramas, poems, etc.,
newly produced, diqu/ramboi Luc.Tim.46.

neo-dmh/s, h=tos, o(, h(, = sq.,
newly tamed, pw=los h.Ap.231; n. ga/moi a
newly formed marriage, E.Med.1366.

neo/-dmhtos (A), on, (dama/w)
newly tamed: metaph., of young wives,
new-wedded, ko/rh ib.623; gunai=kes Q.S.3.405.
newly killed, E.Rh.887 (lyr., v.l. neo/kmhton), Lyc.65.
born of recent defeat, a)na/gkh Q.S.5.161.

neo/-dmhtos (B), Dor. neo/-dma_tos, on, (de/mw)
new-built, Pi. I.4(3).62, IG14.2508 (Nemausus), App.Mith.40.
neo/-doros, on, = neo/dartos I, Thphr.HP9.5.3, J.BJ3.7.10.

neo-douph/s, e/s,
newly fallen or
dead, parqenikai/ Nic.Fr.74.63.
neo-dreph/s, e/s, = sq., Ael.NA4.10, Aret.CA1.1.

neo/-dreptos, on,
fresh-plucked or
broken, kla/doi A. Supp.334, cf. Nic.Th.863 ; n. bwmoi/
wreathed with fresh-plucked leaves, Theoc.26.8.

neo/-dromos, on,
just having run, neodro/mw| labw\n qh/rh|, i.e. neoqh/reuton labw/n, Babr.106.15.
neo/-dropos, on, = neo/dreptos, kla/doi A.Supp.354.
neoei/a, h(, = neoi/h, Sch.Il.23.604.

neo-eidh/s, e/s,
fresh or
youthful in form, Poll.2.10.

neo-ergh/s, e/s,
just made or
newly wrought, Hsch.

neo/-zeuktos, on, = neo/zugos,
newly-married, AP9.514, Nonn.D.2.594.
neo-zu^gh/s, e/s, = sq., pw=los A.Pr.1009; neozuge/essi fala/roisin Tryph.155: metaph., neozuge/wn u(menai/wn Nonn.D.48.237.

neo/-zu^gos, on,
newly-yoked: metaph.,
newly-married, nu/mfh E.Med.804.

ne/o-zuc, u^gos, o(, h(, = foreg., pw=los Id.Fr.821. metaph.,
newly-married, A.R.4.1191.

neo-hlh/s, e/s, (a)le/w A)
fresh-ground, v.l. for neoqhlh/s, Nic.Al.412.

neo-h=lic, i^kos, o(, h(,
young in years, Orph.H.87.7.
*neoh/nia, ta/, festival of Dionysus, Hsch. (leg. neoi/nia).
neo-qalh/s, v. neoqhlh/s.

neo-qa^nh/s, e/s, (qanei=n)
just dead, Agath.2.31, Suid.

neo/-qaptos, on,
newly buried, Sch.Lyc.1097.

neo/qen, Adv.
newly, lately, S.OC1447 (lyr.). = neio/qen, Nic. Al.211,411.
neo-qhgh/s, e/s, = sq., A.R.3.1388, APl.4.124.

neo/-qhktos, on,
newly whetted, Suid.s.v. neo/smhktos.

neo-qhlh/s, Dor. neo-qa_lh/s, e/s, (qa/llw)
fresh-budding or
sprouting, neoqhle/a poi/hn Il.14.347, cf. Hes.Th.576; n. u(/lhs h.Merc.82. of animals,
new-born, nebro/s, mo/sxos, Anacr.51, AP9.274 (Phil.), cf. Gal.4.718. metaph.,
fresh, eu)frosu/nh h.Hom.30.13; n. au)/cetai nikafori/a grows
with youthful vigour, Pi.N.9.48; ai)sxu/na E.IA188 (lyr.). (qhlh/)
just giving milk, mazo/s Opp.C.1.437. [neoqa^lh/s is also cited by Theognost. Can.136.]
neo/-qhlos, on, = foreg.11, A.Eu.450.
neo-qh/c, h=gos, Aeol. a_gos, o(, h(, = neoqhgh/s, si/daros Sapph.119, AP7.181 (Andronic.), cf. Archestr.Fr.31.

neo-qh/ra_tos, on,
newly caught, Gal.14.307.
neo-qh/reutos, on, = foreg., i)xqu/s Zen.2.14, cf. Aët.12.67.
neo-qli^bh/s, e/s, = sq., pw=ma AP7.457 (Aristo); gleu=kos Heraclit.All.35.

neo/-qliptos, on,
newly pressed or
squeezed, gleu=kos Nic.Al.299, cf.Dsc.5.32.
neo-qnh/s, h=tos, o(, h(, = neoqanh/s, Pl.Lg.865e.

neo/-qreptos, on,
newly grown, A.R.3.1400, prob. in Diotog. ap. Stob.4.1.96.
fresh-curdled, of cheese, Hsch.

ne/o-qric, o(, h(, gen. trixos,
with young hair, pareia/ Nonn.D.3.414.

neoi/h, h(, Ep. for neo/ths,
youthful passion, no/on ni/khse neoi/h Il.23.604.

ne/oikos, on,
newly housed, a new denizen, Epich.12.
newly built, e(/dra Pi.O.5.8.

neo-ka/qartos [ka^], on,
newly cleaned, Suid.s.v. neo/smhktos.
neo-kaqi/dru_tos, on, gloss on neo/ktistos, Hsch.
neo-kaisarew/n, w=nos, o( (sc. mh/n), month at Tira, IGRom.4.1665.

neo-kata/gra^fos, on,
newly enlisted, App.Hisp.78.

neo-kataskeu/astos, on,
newly made, Sch.Ar. V.646, Sch.A.R.1.775, Sch.S.Tr.1277.

neo-kata/sta^tos, on,
newly settled, a)/nqrwpoi Th.3.93; bi/os D.Chr.30.27.

neo-kata/xristos, on,
just smeared, Dsc.4.43.
neo-ka/toikos, on, = ne/oikos I, Eup. 300.

neo-ka/ttu_tos, on,
freshly sewn, Stratt.47.8.

neo/-kaustos, on,
newly burnt, Arist.Pr.906b22:—also neo/-kautos, on, Thphr.CP6.17.7; i(era/ OGI229.48 (Smyrna, iii B.C.).

neo-ke/nthtos, on,
newly planted, of vines, Hero
*Geom.23.68.

neo-khdh/s, e/s,
whose grief is fresh, qumo/s Hes.Th.98.
neo-ki/nhsis [i_], ews, h(, gloss on neo/xmwsis, Hsch., EM 600.48.

neo-kla^dh/s, e/s,
with new branches, Hdn.Gr.2.683.

neo/-klwstos, on,
fresh-spun, telamw/n Theoc.24.44; xitw/n Nonn.D.48.691.

neo-kmh/s, h=tos, o(, h(, = sq., Nic.Th.707. metaph., of troops,
fresh, with unimpaired strength, Aen.Tact.16.14, 38.1.

neo/-kmhtos, on, (ka/mnw)
newly wrought, Nic.Th.498.
just slain, v.l. for neo/dmhtos, E.Rh.887 (lyr.).

neo-koni/a_tos, on,
newly whitewashed, tei=xos Gal.17(1).528.

neo/-kopos, on,
newly cut out, new, Eup.20.

neo/-koptos, on, (ko/ptw)
fresh-chiselled, mu/lh Ar.V. 648.

neo/-kotos, on,
new and strange, unheard of, A.Pers.257 (lyr.), Th.803; for the termination cf. a)llo/kotos.

neo/-kouros, on,
newly shorn, pro/bata PMasp.141 iii
a2, al. (vi A.D.).

neo/-koufon, to/,
new cask, PKlein.Form.968 (iv A.D.).

neo-kra/s, a=tos, o(, h(, (kera/nnumi)
newly mixed, spondai/ A.Fr.323: n. (sc. oi)=nos), o(, Eratosth. ap. Ath. 11.482b; n. tis poiei/tw Pl.Com.69.8. metaph.,
newly made, neokra=ta fi/lon komi/seien A.Ch.344 (anap.).
neo/-kra_tos, on, = foreg., Poll.6.24, Hsch.

*neo/krhtes, oi(,
Cretan recruits, Plb.5.3.1, al.

neo/-kri^tos, on,
newly distinguished, B.7Fr. (p.475 J.).

neo/-krotos, on,
greeted with fresh applause, ni/ka Id.5.48.

neo/-kthtos, on,
newly gained, App.Mith.16, D.C.49.44.

neo/-ktistos, on, also h, on Pi. N.9.2:—
newly founded or
built, Pi. l.c., P.4.206, Hdt.5.24, Th.3.100, Cic.Att.6.2.3;
newly created, LXXWi.11.18:—also neo/-kti^tos, on, B. 16.126, Nonn.D.18.294.

neo/-ktonos, on, (ktei/nw)
lately or
just killed, Pi.N.8.30.

neolai/a, h(, (lew/s, lao/s)
a band of youths, the youth of a nation, A. Pers.669, Supp.687; qh=lus n., of a band of maidens, Theoc.18.24: as Adj., n. xei\r gunaikw=n E.Alc.103.—Dor. word, used by Trag. only in lyr., also in Ar.Fr.67 and in late Prose, Luc.Phal.1.3, Hld.8.16, Hdn.4.9.4, Alciphr.1.6, Herm.in Phdr.p.101A.

neo-lamph/s, e/s,
shining anew, Man.4.510.

neo/-lektos, on, (le/gw (B) 1.2)
newly enlisted, recruit, Nic.Dam.130.31 J., Jul.Or.1.18b, Wilcken Chr.469.3 (iv A.D.), Hsch.

neo-leci/a, h(,
tirocinium, Gloss.

neo/-lhptos, on,
newly taken or
subdued, App.BC2.48.

neo/-loutos, on,
just bathed, Hp.Superf.29:—Ep. neo/lloutos h.Merc.241.

neo/-lu^tos, on,
resolved in a new fashion, me/lea Lyr.Adesp.112 = Trag.Adesp.136 (prob. referring to the pyrrhic metre of the line, but perh. with a play on me/los 'limb', with ref. to Pentheus; cf. neo/xutos).

neo-lw/fhtos, on,
having just left off, Hsch., Phot.

ne/omai, contr. neu=mai, Il.18.136: nei/omai v.l. in 23.76; 2 and 3sg. contr. nei=ai, nei=tai, Od.11.114, 14.152, etc.; 1pl. neu/meqa Theoc.18.56, A.R.2.1153; 2pl. ne/esqe Id.3.306, nei=sqe E.Alc.737; imper. nei=o AP7.472b (Leon.); subj. 2sg. ne/hai Il.1.32; 1pl. new/meqa 2.236; opt. neoi/mhn 14.335; inf. ne/esqai 2.84, al., contr. nei=sqai Od.15.88, Pi.P. 4.247, S.Ant.33; part. neo/menos E.El.722 (lyr.), neu/menos Call.Hec.1.1.6, AP9.96 (Antip. Thess.): Ep. impf. neo/mhn Theoc.25.207, ne/onto Il.5.907:—
go or
come (mostly with fut. sense, to which the inf. is the most freq. exception), pa/lin n.
go back, freq.
return, pa/lin oi)=ko/nde n. Il. 6.189, Od.6.110; ou) ne/ont' a)/neu stefa/nwn Pi.N.4.77; in Hom. always of persons, exc. potamou\s d' e)/treye ne/esqai ka\r r(o/on Il.12.32; a)/nemoi . . e)/ban oi)=ko/nde ne/esqai 23.229: metaph., of the path of song, makra/ moi nei=sqai kat' a)macito/n Pi.P.4.247:—Constr.: mostly folld. by ei)s, pro/s, e)pi/ c. acc., e)s patri/da gai=an Il.18.101; pro\s dw=ma 14.335; e)f' h(me/tera Od.15.88; also by u(po/ c. acc., u(po\ zo/fon Il.23.51; by e)pi/ c. dat., 22.392: c. acc. only, 7.335.—Ep. Verb, rare in Trag. (v. supr.): once in early Prose, dub. l. in X.Cyr.4.1.11: in late Prose, Dam.Pr.81.—The Act. forms ne/ousa h.Cer.395, Dor. 3pl. fut. nhsou=nti Sophr.101, are corrupt. (From nes-omai, cf. no/stos, Skt.
násate 'take as companion'.)

neo-ma/laktos [ma^], on,
fresh-kneaded, Sch.Theoc.4.34.

neo/-mhni selh/nh|, th=|, at the
new moon, v.l. in Arat.471.
neo-mhni/a, h(, v. noumhni/a.

neo-morfotu/pwtos [u^], on,
in a newfangled shape, Man.4.305.

neo/-mustos, on,
newly initiated, Orph.H.43.10.

neo/-numfos, on,
newly married, Sostrat. ap. Stob.4.20.70, Supp.Epigr.3.216 (ii/i B.C.), IG12(5).472 (Oliaros, i A.D.), Plu.2.310e, f.l. for neo/yhfos in Suet. Ner.39.

neo/-cantos, on, (cai/nw)
newly carded, Hp.Superf.8.

neo/-cestos, on,
newly polished or
carved, te/xnh Tryph.255.

neo-pa^gh/s, e/s, (ph/gnumi)
newly fixed: lately become solid, i)lu/s Plu.2.602d; sa/rc Gal.18(1).363, Aët.9.36; turo/s Gal.6.768; su/stasis Sor.1.46.
newly built, tei=xos J.BJ3.7.20.
neo-pa^qh/s, e/s, = neopenqh/s 1, A.Eu.514 (lyr.).

neo-pe/nhs, htos, o(, h(,
lately become poor, Com.Adesp.1087 (v.l. neo-peinh/s, glossed o( newsti\ peinw=n).

neo-penqh/s, e/s,
in new sorrow, fresh-mourning, neopenqe/a qumo\n e)/xousai Od.11.39. Pass.,
lately mourned, neopenqh\s w)/|xet' e)s *(/aida IG12(7).447.6 (Amorgos), cf. 14.1663.

neo-pe/peiros, on,
just ripe, Phot.

neo/-peptos, on, (pe/ssw)
newly baked,
a)/rtoi Aret.CA2.3.

neo-peuqh/s, e/s,
late-learnt, prob. for neopaqh=, Hsch., for neopefqh=, Phot.
neo-phqh/s: ai)xma/lwtos, Hsch. (-qei/s cod.).

neo-plasth/s, e/s,
newly formed, sa/rc Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.20.

neo-plekh/s, e/s,
new-plaited, ka/laqos Nic.Al.96:—also neo/-plektos, on, spuri/des Id.Fr.74.21.

neo-ploutopo/nhros, on,
wicked from new-gotten wealth, Cratin.208.

neo/-ploutos, on,
newly become rich, opp. a)rxaio/ploutos (q.v.): hence,
vainglorious, upstart, D.17.23, cf. Arg.D.17, Arist.Rh.1387a23; oi)ke/ths n. Luc.Hist.Conscr.20; a)peleu/qeros n. Plu.2.634c; n. dei=pna Id.Luc.40: hence, by a comic metaph., n. tru/c, of a low
upstart, Ar.V.1309.
neo-plu^nh/s, e/s, = sq., Poll.1.25.

neo/-plu^tos, on,
newly washen, neo/pluta ei(/mat' e)/xontes Od.6.64, cf. Hdt.2.37, Mus.Belg.16.71 (Athens, ii A.D.), v.l. in Anacr.21.6.

neo/-pneustos, on, (pne/w)
newly revived, Nonn.D.25.550.

neo/-podes, oi(,
young offshoots of vines, Gp.4.3.6.

neo-poie/w,
renovate, make young again, Herm. ap. Stob.1.41.8, Arg.E.Med. = nea/w, Poll.1.221. (new/s) = newpoie/w (q.v.).
neo-poi/hs, = newpoi/hs (q.v.).

neo-poi/htos, on,
newly made, renewed, Id.9.18.
neo-poi/ki^los, on, gloss on neosi/galos, Sch.Pi.O.3.8:—also neo-poi/kiltos, on, ibid.

neo-poio/s, o(,
one who ploughs up fallow land, Poll. 1.221.

neo/-pokos, on,
newly shorn, mallo/s S.OC475.

neo/-polis, ews, h(,
new city, of Abdera, Pi.Pae.2.28.

neo-poli/ths [i_], ou, o(,
newly enfranchised citizen, Arist.Ath.21.4, D.S.14.7, Ath.4.138a, App.BC 1.49:—fem. neo-poli=tis, idos, as Adj., n. po/leis ib.76. *neopoli/ths, v. *nea/polis.

neo-po/tistos, on,
newly watered, Hsch.s.v. neoarde/a.

neo/-potos, on, (pi/nw)
having lately drunk, Hp.Acut. 65.
neo-pra_ge/w, = kainotome/w, Hdn.Epim.63.

neo-preph/s, e/s, (pre/pw)
befitting the young, youthful, lo/gos Pl.Lg.892d.
like a youth, extravagant, n. kai\ peri/ergos, opp. eu)telh\s kai\ a)felh/s, Plu.TG2, cf. 2.334c (Comp.).

neo/-pristos, on, (pri/w)
fresh-sawn, e)le/fas Od.8.404.

*neopto/lemos, o(, surname of Pyrrhus, son of Achilles,
New-warrior, because he
came late to Troy, Il.19.327, Od.11.506: [scanned as quadrisyll. *neo<*>pt-, S.Ph.4,241, E.Andr.14, Tr.1126]:—Adj. *neoptole/meios, on, ti/sis Paus.4.17.4.

neo/-ptolis, ews, h(, poet. for neo/polis, po/lis n.
new-founded city, A. Eu.687.

neo-ptorqh/s, e/s,
with new branches, Hdn.Gr.1.79:—also neo/-ptorqos, on, as etym.

neo-pu^ri/htos, on,
just come out of a vapour-bath, Hp.Superf.29, Nat.Mul.6.

ne/orgos, on, (o)rga/w)
freshened, invigorated, gh= Thphr.CP3.13.3 (Sup.).

neo-rra^gh/s, e/s, (r(h/gnumi)
newly rent or
burst, Aret.SD2.9.

neo/-rrantos, on, (r(ai/nw)
newly sprinkled, n. ci/fos a
fresh-reeking sword, S.Aj.30, 828; da/krua n.
newly shed, Aristid. Or.24 (44). 44.

neo-rra^fh/s, e/s, (r(a/ptw)
newly sewn, Longus 4.14.

neo/-rru^tos, on, (r(e/w)
fresh-flowing, phgai\ ga/laktos S.El.894; da/krua *numfa=n Tim.Fr.7; ka/llea khrou= AP9.363.15 (Mel.); ai(=ma Nonn.D.43.134.

neo/-rru_tos, on, (e)ru/w A)
newly drawn, ci/fos A.Ag.1351.

neo-rru/fhtos [u^], on,
having lately taken liquid nourishment, Hp.Acut.65.

ne/ortos, on, (o)/rnumi)
newly arisen, ti/ d' e)sti/n, w)= pai= *lai/+ou, n. au)=; S. OC1507; of persons,
new, a( n. a(/de nu/mfa Id.Tr.894 (lyr.); also,
youthful (expld. by e)/fhbos, Phot.), ta\n n. *(ermio/nan S.Fr.872 (lyr., neorgo/n or -ourgo/n codd. Plu.).

ne/os, ne/a, Ion. ne/h, ne/on; Ion. nei=os (q.v.): [fem. ne/as as monosyll., A.Th.327 (lyr.); contr. fem. nh= Xenoph.42 (= Ar.Fr.9), Eugaeon (?) 1]:
young, youthful (of children, youths, and of men at least as old as 30, v. X.Mem.1.2.35), n. pa/i+s Od.4.665; kou=roi n. Il.13.95; n. a)nh/r 23.589: alone, ne/oi
youths, 1.463, Hes.Sc.281, etc.: later mostly with Art., oi( ne/oi Ar.Nu.1059, etc.: prov., o( n. e)/stai n. 'boys will be boys', Lib.Ep.910.3; oi( n., corporately organized, SIG831.8 (Pergam., ii A.D.), etc.; opp. e)/fhboi, pai=des, ib.589.38 (Magn.Mae., ii B.C.): opp. ge/rwn, h)me\n ne/oi h)de\ ge/rontes Il.2.789, etc.; h)\ n. h)e\ palaio/s 14.108, cf. Od.1.395, etc.; opp. gerai/teros, 3.24; opp. progene/steros, 2.29; opp. geraio/s, X.Lac.1.7; eu)qu\s e)k ne/ou e)qi/zein from
youth upwards, Pl.Grg.510d, etc.; e)k ne/wn pai/dwn Id.Lg.887d; e)k ne/wn e)qi/zesqai Arist.EN1103b24; e)k ne/as (sc. yuxh=s) Pl.R.409a; to\ n., = neo/ths,
youth (in the abstract), S.OC1229 (lyr.), E.Ion545: also in concrete sense, to\ n. a(/pan all
young creatures, Pl.Lg.653d; ou) du/natai to\ n. h(suxa/zein Arist.Pol.1340b29; skirthtiko\n to\ n. Corn. ND20; also, of
minors, ne/ou o)/ntos e)/ti Th.1.107; cf. new/teros. rarely of animals and plants, o)/rphkes, e)/rnos, Il.21.38, Od.6.163; oi( n. tw=n nebrw=n X.Cyn.9.8.
suited to a youth, youthful, a)/eqloi Pi.O.2.43; n. qra/sos A.Pers.744 (troch.); n. fronti/s
youthful spirits, E.Med.48; ne/ais tai=s dianoi/ais xrwme/nous Lys.24.16; of persons, a)/frwn ne/os te E.IA489, cf. Pl.R.378a; n. te kai\ o)cu/s Id.Grg.463e (but diafe/rei ou)de\n n. th\n h(liki/an h)\ to\ h)=qos nearo/s Arist.EN1095a6).
new, fresh, n. qa/lamos Il.17.36; n. a)/lgos 6.462; ne/w| . . ko/llopi Od.21.407 (this sense elsewh. in Hom. only in Adv. ne/on, v. infr.); li/non Alc.15 (dub.); po/noi . . ne/oi palaioi=si summigei=s kakoi=s A.Th.740 (lyr.), etc.; oi)=nos n. Ar.Pax916; e)n toi=s mousikoi=s ta\ n. [me/lh] eu)dokimei= X.Cyr.1.6.38; h( n. (sc. selh/nh) the
new moon, esp. in phrase e(/nh kai\ ne/a, v. e(/nos 2; but mhno\s th=| n. (sc. h(me/ra|)
on the first day of the month, Pl.Lg.849b; n. h)=mar A.R.4.1479: in this sense rarely of persons, o( n. tago\s maka/rwn A.Pr.96 (anap.), cf. Ar. Pl.960; oi( n. qeoi/ A.Eu.721; cf. new/teros. of events, etc.,
new, with collat. notion of
unexpected, strange, untoward, evil, ti/ n.; Id.Ag.85 (anap.); prosdokw= ti ga\r n. E.Supp.99; mw=n ti bouleu/h| n.; S.Ph.1229, cf. 554, E.Hipp.794, Ba.362. Th.5.50. etc.: a)prosdokh/tous kai\ n. lo/gous A.Supp.712; kaina\ n. t' a)/xh Id.Pers.665 (lyr.): this sense is more common in Comp., v. new/teros. neut. ne/on as Adv. of Time,
lately, just now, opp. both to distant past and present, pai=da n. gegaw=ta Od.19.400, cf. Il.3.394; n. kratei=n A.Pr. 35,955, etc.: also used Adverbially with the Art., kai\ to\ pa/lai (v.l. palaio/n) kai\ to\ n. Hdt.9.26: in Prose newsti/ (q.v.): rarely Comp. Adv. newte/rws, Pl.Lg.907c: Sup. new/tata
most recently, Th.1.7; also e)k ne/as, Ion. au)=tis e)k ne/hs,
anew, afresh, Hdt.1.60, 5.116. . the degrees of Comp. are new/teros, new/tatos, v. new/teros: neai/teros is corrupt for neai/retos in A.Fr.330. (ne/vos (in nevo/statos, q.v.), cf. Skt.
návas, Lat.
novus, etc.)
neo/s (sc. gh=), v. neio/s.
neo/s, Ion. gen. of nau=s.

neo-si/ga^los [i_], on, (sigalo/eis)
new and sparkling, with all the gloss on, metaph., tro/pos Pi.O.3.4.

neo-ska^fh/s, e/s,
newly dug, Lyc.1097, Sch.E.Ph.1664.

neo-sku/leutos [u_], on,
newly taken as booty, e)/ntea AP7.430 (Diosc.).

neo/-smhktos, on, (smh/xw)
newly cleaned, qw/rhkes Il.13.342; ma/xaira Euph.132; ka/lamos AP6.227 (Crin.); xalko/s Plu. Aem.32.

neo-spa^dh/s, e/s, （spa/w） = neospa/s, n. ci/fos
newly drawn from a wound, bloody, A.Eu.42.

neo-spa/raktos [a^], on,
newly torn, Sch.Ar.Eq.344.

neo-spa/s, a/dos, o(, h(,
newly torn away, fresh-plucked, qalloi/ S.Ant.1201, cf. Fr.502.

neo/-speistos, on,
newly poured as an offering, f.l. in Nonn.D.19.177.

neo/-sporos, on,
newly sown, ku=ma A.Eu.659.

neoss-ei/a, h(, only in Att. form neottei/a,
nest-building, Arist.HA 560b23. = e)kle/pisis, Suid.
neo/ss-eusis, Att. neo/tt-, ews, h(, = foreg.1, Arist.HA559a3 (pl.).

neoss-eu/w, Att. neott-, Ion. and Hellenistic nosseu/w,
hatch, e)neo/tteusen ge/nos Ar.Av.699.
build a nest, Arist.HA559a4, etc.; melittw=n e)n tw=| sth/qei tou= le/ontos nenosseuko/twn J.AJ5.8.6: metaph., [sofi/a] qeme/lion ai)w=nos e)no/sseuse LXX Si.1.15:—Pass., o(/sa h)=n nenosseume/na o)rni/qwn ge/nea as many as
had their nests, Hdt.1.159.

neoss-ia/, Ion. neoss-ih/, Att. neottia/, later nossia/, Ion. neoss-ih/, h(,
nest of young birds, Id.3.111, Ar.Av.642, Pl.R.548a, Thphr.CP 4.5.7 (in the form nossiw=n); neottia\s poiei=sqai, neottia\n poiei=n, Arist. HA613b6, 618a8.
brood of young birds, Lycurg.132, Dsc.Eup. 1.21, Ev.Luc.13.34; n. xelido/nwn Men.Pk.278: metaph., n. te/knwn Com.Adesp.873 (= Trag.Adesp.189).
lair, e)f' h(=s a)lw/phc nossih\n pepoi/htai Herod.7.72.
beehive, LXX 4 Ma.14.19.

neoss-i/on, Att. neott- (later nossi/on Lyr.in Philol.80.336), to/, Dim. of neosso/s,
nestling, chick, Arist.HA536a30: metaph., tou= patro\s n. 'chip of the old block', Ar.Av.767, cf. Thphr.Char.2.6.
yolk of an egg, Men.42 (prob.), Diph.121, Hsch.

neoss-i/s, Att. neott-, later nossi/s, i/dos, h(, = foreg.1, Arist.HA559b23; *pafi/hs nossi/s, of a
girl, AP9.567 (Antip.): freq. as pr. n. in Com. nossi/des, ai(, name of a kind of
shoe, Herod.7.57.

neosso-ko/mos, Att. neott-, on,
rearing chickens, kalih/ AP7.210 (Antip.).
neosso-poie/w, later nosso-, = neosseu/w, LXXIs.13.22:—also in Med., Aesop.5: metaph., tau=ta (sc. plou=tos kai\ polute/leia) e)n toi=s bi/ois -poiei=tai Longin.44.7.

neosso-poii/a, Att. neott-, h(,
hatching, Dsc.2.56.

neosso-pw=lis, idos, h(,
seller of young birds, Herod.6.99 (prob. nosso-).

neosso/s, Att. neott-, o(, (ne/os)
young bird, nestling, chick, Il.2.311, 9.323, S.Ant.425, Ar.Av.835, Ev.Luc.2.24, etc.; a)pth=nes n. Plu.2.48a.
any young animal, as a young crocodile, Hdt.2.68; of young children, A.Ch.256, 501, E.Alc.403 (lyr.), al., Pl.Lg.776a: fem., h)=n neotto\s kai\ ne/a (sc. Lais) Epicr.3.15: in pl.,
young bees, X. Oec.7.34, Arist.HA624a22; *)/arews n., of the cock, Ar.Av.835 (also ironically, of a person, Pl.Com.104): collective, i(/ppou n. the horse's
brood, A.Ag.825.
yolk of an egg, Arist.HA565a3, Orac. ap. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.344; cf. neotti/on.—The disyll. form nosso/s is cited in AB109 from A.Fr.113 and occurs in S.Oxy.2081 (
b) Fr.3: this and cogn. forms (commonly found in later Gr.) are condemned as a)do/kima by Phryn.182.

neosso-trofei=on, Att. neott-, to/,
chicken-coop, Colum.8.15.

neosso-trofe/w, Att. neott-, later noss-,
rear young birds, AP9.346 (Leon. Alex.): —Pass.,
to be reared as in the nest, of a child, Ar.Nu. 999, cf. Ph.2.200.

neosso-trofi/a, Att. neott-,
rearing of young birds, M.Ant.9.9 (pl.), Gp.14.7.14, Al.Jb.39.16.
neo/-ssu^tos, on, = ne/ortos, Hsch.; i)xw/r Nonn.D.29.268; o)/gkos a)ni/hs ib.4.10.

neo-sta^qh/s, e/s, (i(/sthmi)
newly settled, dh=mos Plu.2.321d.
neo-sta/luc, u^gos, o(, h(, = neoda/krutos, Hsch.
neo-sta^si/h, dub. l. in A.R.3.76 (leg. e)neo-), cf. Hsch.

neo/-statos, Cypr. nevo/statos, = new/tatos,
latest, last, ta=n e)pagomena=n n. Inscr.Cypr.134 H.

neo/-steptos, on,
fresh-crowned, Opp.H.1.198.
neo-stefh/s, e/s, = foreg., BMus.Inscr.1143 (ii/iii A.D.). = neo/kratos, Hsch.; cf. e)pistefh/s.

neo-stra/teutos [a^], on,
recruit, App.BC2.74.

neo/-stra^tos, on, = foreg., tei/rwn (Lat.
tiro) PMon.2.2 (vi A.D.).

neo/-strofos, on,
newly twisted, neurh/ Il.15.469.
neo-su/llektos, on, = sq., D.H.8.13, 11.23, J.BJ1.17.1, Plu.Caes.25.

neo-su/llogos, on,
newly collected, i.e.
incurred, e)/ranoi Hyp.Ath.11;
newly levied, strato/peda Plb.3.70.10, cf. Polyaen.3.11.8.

neo-su/sta^tos, on,
recently formed, i.e.
recent, of disease, Critoap.Gal.12.830;
sudden, kata/rrous Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.17.2.
having newly joined a sect, proselyte, J.BJ2.8.9.

neo-sfa^gh/s, e/s,
fresh-slaughtered, S.Tr.1130, Aj.898, E.Hec.894; neosfagh= pou to/nde prosleu/sswn fo/non S.Aj.546.

neo-sfa/da|stos [sfa^], on,
newly struggling, Id.Fr.349.

neo/-sfaktos, on,
newly shed, n. ai(=ma Arist.HA581b2.

neo-sfa/c, a/gos, o(, h(,
newly slaughtered, Nic.Fr. 68.1.

neo-sxi^dh/s, e/s,
just split or
cloven, o)/ros Nonn.D.45.307.

neo-ta^fh/s, e/s, of a
newly-built tomb, Sch.Lyc.1097 (ed. Bachm.).

neo-telh/s, e/s,
newly initiated, Pl.Phdr.250e (glossed newsti\ tetelesme/nos Tim.Lex.,
n. teteleiwme/nos Phot., Suid.), Luc.DMeretr.11.2; yuxh/ Him.Or.14.12; h)=qos Id.Ed.10.6.

neo-terph/s, e/s,
new and charming, Opp.H. 3.352, etc.: neut. as Adv.,
with new delight, Id.C.2.584.

neo/-teuktos, on,
newly wrought, kassi/teros Il.21.592; ei)kw/n Epigr.Gr.311 (Smyrna).
neo-teuxh/s, e/s, = foreg., di/froi Il.5.194; mou=sa Tim.Pers.216; kissu/bion Theoc.1.28.

neo/ths, Dor. ne/o-tas, htos, h(, (ne/os)
youth, e)k neo/thtos . . e)s gh=ras Il. 14.86, cf. Ev.Marc.10.20, etc.; a)te/mbontai neo/thtos Il.23.445; e)rath\n ga\r a)pwle/samen neo/thta, i.e. we died young, Simon.89, cf. E.HF637 (lyr.), Fr.149; e)n neo/tati, e)pi\ neo/thtos, in one's
youth, Sapph.Supp. 12.3, Ar.V.1199, cf. Ach.214: in pl., ai( n. a)/frones AP9.359 (Posidipp. or Pl.Com. or Crates); ai( n. r(wmale/ai ib.360 (Metrod.).
youthful spirit, impetuosity, Hdt.7.13: in bad sense,
youthful folly, insolence, a)kolasi/a| kai\ n. Pl.Ap.26e; n. kai\ a)/noia And.2.7. collective, = neolai/a,
body of youth, esp. of military or athletic age, Pi.I.8(7).75, Hdt.4.3, 9.12, Th.2.8, 20, etc. in Crete, neo/tas, a(, acc. neo/ta, gen. neo/tas,
board of officials representing the ne/oi (cf. ne/os 1.1), GDI5012.6, SIG525.9 (Gortyn, iii B.C.).

neoth/sios, on,
youthful, w(/rh Ps.-Phoc.213; ski/rthma Antipho Soph.49.

neo/-tiktos, on,
newly brought forth, A.Fr.451H.

neo/-tmhtos, Dor. neo/-tma_tos, on,
newly cut off, divided, Pl.Ti.80d, Theoc.7.134, A.R. 3.857, Dsc.2.70.

neo/-tokos, on,
new-born: metaph.,
fresh, recent, pa/qos Aret.CD1.5. parox. neoto/kos, on, Act.,
having just brought forth, E.Ba.701, Aret.CA2.3; lu/kaina neoto/kos spargw=sa tou\s mastou/s D.H.1.79, Plu.2.320d.

neo/-tomos, on,
fresh-cut, o)/nuxos a)/loki neoto/mw| A.Ch.25 (lyr.); n. plh/gmata
newly inflicted, S. Ant.1283.
freshly cut off, e(/lic E.Ba.1170 (lyr.).

neo-trefh/s, e/s,
newly reared, ko/roi Id.Heracl.92 (lyr.), cf. Nonn.D.10.178.

neo/-trhtos, on, = neo/trwtos,
fresh, trau/mata interpol. in Dsc. 1.106.

neo-tri^bh/s, e/s,
freshly ground, puroi=o a)/xqos Ps.-Phoc. 167.
freshly extracted, e)/laion Sor.1.46, al.
neo/-trofos, on, = neotrefh/s, A.Ag.724 (lyr.), Cratin.326.

neo/-trwtos, on, (titrw/skw)
lately wounded or
hurt, Hp.Fract.28; n. e(/lkh, ta\ n. tw=n e(lkw=n,
fresh sores, Id.Liqu.4, Dsc.4.114 (v.l.), cf. Gal.10.257.
neottei/a, etc., v. neoss-.

neo/tu_ros, o(,
new cheese, Alex.Trall.Febr.4.

ne-ourge/w,
invent new things, f.l. in Alciphr.3.51.
ne-ourgh/s, e/s, = sq., Plu.Aem.5, Alciphr.3.57, Jul.Or.2.71c.

ne-ourgo/s (A), o/n,
newmade, new, i(ma/tion Pl.R.495e; foiniki/des Plu.Aem.18.

ne-ourgo/s (B), o(, (nau=s)
shipbuilder, Poll.1.84.

ne-ou/ta^tos, on, (ou)ta/w)
lately wounded, a)/llon . . neou/taton, a)/llon a)/outon Il.18.536, cf. 13.539, Hes. Sc.253.
ne-ou/thtos, on, = foreg., Nonn.D.17.351, al.

neo-u/+fantos [u^], on,
newly woven, Eust.1572.4.

neo-fa/nths, ou, o(,
newly initiated, mu/sths Orph.H.4.9.

neo/-fa^tos, on,
lately slain, Hsch.

neo-feggh/s, e/s,
shining anew, mh/nh, ai)/glh, Man.2.489, Nonn. D.22.350.

neo/-fqartos, on,
newly ruined or
killed, Hsch. s.v. neo/fqitos.
neo-fqi/menos [i^], h, on, = foreg., Nonn.D.25.274, al.

neo/-fqi^tos, on, = foreg., Trag.Adesp.240.
newly violated, Hsch.

neo/-foitos, on,
having just arrived, newcomer, Coluth.390. Pass.,
newly trodden, h)e/ra AP7.699.

neo/-fonos, on,
lately killed: n. ai(=ma
freshshed, E.El.1172.

neo/-frwn, onos, o(, h(, (frh/n)
childish in spirit, dub.l. in Panyas.12.11 (leg. e)neo/-): freq. as pr. n.

neo-fu^h/s, e/s,
new-grown, shooting up anew, Poll.1.231.

neo-fu/ra_tos [u_], on,
newly kneaded, Sch.Theoc.4.34.

neo-fu^tei=on, to/,
young plantation, nursery-ground, Gloss.

neo/-fu^tos, on,
newly planted, Ar.Fr.828; a)mpelw/n PCair.Zen. 236.4 (iii B.C.); kth=ma POxy.909.16 (iii A.D.): neut. pl. neo/futa, ta/,
young plants, LXX Ps.143 (144).12, cf.PRyl.138.9 (i A.D.; new/- Pap.), etc. metaph.,
new convert, neophyte, 1 Ep.Ti.3.6.

neo-xa/raktos [xa^], on,
newly imprinted, i)/xnos S.Aj.6.
neoxm-e/w, = neoxmo/w, in Pass., Procop.Arc.30 codd., Suid. s.v. neoxmo/s.
neoxm-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(, = neo/xmwsis, Hsch.
neoxm-i/zw, = neoxmo/w, Id. (Pass.).

neoxm-o/s, o/n, = ne/os,
new, always of things (exc. S.Ant.156 (anap.)), me/los n. a)/rxe Alcm.1; neoxmoi=s de\ dh\ no/mois *zeu\s . . kratu/nei A.Pr.150 (lyr.); kako/n Id.Pers.693, E.Hipp.866 (lyr.); ti/ froimia/zh| n.; Id.IT1162, cf. Tr.260 (lyr.); mu=qoi ib.231 (anap.): rare in Com. (only in lyr.), n. a)/qurma Cratin.145; te/ras Ar.Ra.1372, Th.701: also in Ion. (never in Att.) Prose,
fresh, n. poie/ein to\ fa/rmakon Hp.Mul.2.133. Adv. -mw=s ib.1.16.
drastic, n. ti poie/ein, i.e. mutiny, Hdt. 9.99, 104; ou)deni\ n. a)resko/menos D.C.38.3. [neo^xm-, A.Pers.l.c., E.Tr. 231, Ba.216, etc.]

neoxm-o/w,
make innovations, esp. political, mostly with neut. Pron. or Adj., mhde\n a)/llo n. kata/ tinas Hdt.4.201, cf. 5.19; polla\ e)neo/xmwse
caused many
changes, Th.1.12, cf. D.H.1.89, 5.74.
inaugurate, a(/per au)to\s neoxmoi= Arist.Mu.401a13. Medic.,
produce a complication, Lycusap.Orib.8.26.2.

neo/xm-wsis, ews, h(,
innovation, Hsch.: in pl.,
strange phenomena, Arist.Mu.397a20.
renovation, duna/mios Aret.CA2.3;
renewal, e)piplasma/twn ib.1.10.
neo/-xrhstos, on, dub. in Diotog. ap. Stob.4.1.96 (leg. neo/qrepta).

neo/-xristos, on,
newly plastered, D.S.38.4, App.BC1.74.

neo-xru/seos [u^], on,
new and golden, Philod.Scarph.123.

neo/-xu^tos, on, (xe/w)
flowing in new fashion, n. me/lea v.l. for neo/luta (q.v.) in Lyr.Adesp. 112 ( = Trag.Adesp.136).

neo/-yhfos, on,
calculated in a fresh way, prob. for neo/numfon in Suet.Ner.39.

neo/w, (ne/os)
renovate, change, ne/wson ai)=non A.Supp.534 (lyr.):— Med., ta/fous e)new/sato
had them
restored, IG14.1721:—Pass., Hsch. = nea/w, Poll.1.221: c. acc. cogn., new/sate e(autoi=s new/mata LXX Je.4.3.
restore a MS. reading in a corrupt passage, Demetr.Lac.Herc.1012.26.

ne/petos, o(, = kalami/nqh, Lat. word in Gal.14.43; cf. ne/pita: h( kalami/nqh, Hsch. (Lat.
nepeta.）

ne/pous, podos, o(, once in Hom. in pl., ne/podes kalh=s *(alosu/dnhs, of seals, prob.
children of H., Od.4.404, cf. Eust.1502.36: so in later Poets, a)qa/natoi de\ kaleu=ntai e(oi\ ne/podes Theoc.17.25; gorgofo/noi ne/podes Cleon Sic. ap. EM389.28; o( *kei=os *(ulli/xou ne/pous Call.Fr.77, cf. A.R.4.1745: also expld. from ne- (for nh- privat.), pou/s,
the footless ones, Apion ap.Apollon.Lex., and from ne/w (A), = nhci/-podes,
web-footed, ibid., Et.Gud.405.49: hence in later Poets, of
fish, qalassai/wn mundo/teroi nepo/dwn Call.Fr.260, cf. Nic.Al.468, 485, AP 6.11 (Satyr.), 11.60 (Paul. Sil.); e(/kasta/ te fu=la nepou/dwn is f.l. in h.Ap.78.
ne/rqe, ne/rqen, v. e)/nerqe.

ne/rtatos, h, on, = e)ne/rtatos,
lowest, Hsch.

nerte/rios, a, on,
underground, Orph.A.1372, AP9.459, etc.; oi( n. ib.7.601 (Jul. Aeg.).

nertero-dro/mos, o(,
courier of the dead, Luc.Peregr.41.

nertero/-morfos, on,
shaped like the dead, Man.4.555.

ne/rteros, a, on, also os, on E.Ph.1020 (lyr.):— = e)ne/rteros,
lower, nether, Comp. without Posit. in use (cf. ne/rqe, e)/nerqe), nerte/ra| prosh/menos kw/ph| A.Ag.1617; ta\ d' u(pe/rtera ne/rtera qh/sei Ar.Lys. 772. mostly as Posit.,
belonging to the lower world, h( n. qeo/s S.OC1548; n. qeoi/ A.Pers.622, S.Ant.602 (lyr.), etc.; ne/rteroi alone,
the dead, A.Pers.619, etc.; n. pla/kes, xqw/n, dw/mata, the world
below, S.OC1576 (lyr.), E.Alc.47 (s.v.l.), 1073; n. kw/pa, of Charon's boat, ib.459 (lyr.).
ne/rtos, o(, a bird, Ar.Av.303; expld. by i(e/rac, Hsch.

*nerw/neia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival of Nero, D.C.61.21, al.:—Adj. *nerwniano/s, h/, o/n, Plu.Galb.17.
ne/rwpa: lampro/n, Hsch. (i.e. nw/ropa).

nestori/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
cup, Ath.11.487f.

*ne/stwr, oros, o(,
Nestor, Il.1.247, etc.:—Adj. *nesto/reos, h, on, 2.54, al.; *nesto/reios, a, on, a(/rma Pi.P.6.32; me/los E.Fr.899; sku/fos Luc.Herm.12.

ne/twpon, to/,
oil of bitter almonds, Hp.Mul.1.37, Epid.5.66, al. (me/twpon is v.l. in Loc.Hom.12, al.):—also netw/pion, Hsch. (cf. metw/pion 11); cf. ni/wpon.

neu=ma, atos, to/, (neu/w)
nod, sign, Th.1.134; neu/matos e(/neka xalepai/nein for
a mere nod, X.An.5.8.20; n. xeiro/s Onos.26.1.
expression of will, command, monoyh/foisi neu/masi A.Supp.373 (lyr.); a)po\ neu/matos prosta/ttein tini/ Plb.21.38.4;
approval, sanction, a)eto\s fe/rwn e)k *dio\s tai=s eu)xai=s n. Philostr.Her.12a.1, cf. IG3.636;
control, u(pota/ttein *palaisti/nhn tw=| n. tino/s Chor.p.28B.
quarter of the heavens, D.P.517. generally,
direction, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.4.39, PMag.Par.1.178.
neu=mai, v. ne/omai.
neuma/tion, to/, Dim. of neu=ma 1.1, Arr.Epict.4.13.22.
neu/menos, v. ne/omai.

neura/, Ion. nertero-rh/, h(, Ep. gen. sg. neurh=fi( n) Il.8.309, 15.313, 21.113:—
string or
cord of sinew, in Ep. usu.
bowstring, n. e)u+strefh/s, neo/strofos, Il.15.463,469; baru/fqoggos Pi.I.6(5).34, cf. S.Ph.1005, E.Ba.784, X.An.4.2.28, etc.: made from neu=ron, Arist.HA540a19; mu/es e)boh/qhsan diatrago/ntes ta\s n. Id.Rh.1401b16.
harpstring, Poll.4.62.
strand of a torsion-engine, IG22.554.15.
withe, LXX Jd.16.7. wrongly taken by some, = neu=ron, Il.8.328. (Cogn. with neu=ron.）
neura/s, a/dos, h(, Ion. name for poti/rrion, Dsc.3.15, Plin.HN27.122. = doru/knion, ib.21.179.
neur-eih/, h(, poet. for neura/, Theoc.25.213.

neur-e/ndetos, on,
strung, kiqa/rh Man.5.163.

neur-epe/nta^tos, on,
stretched on the bowstring, prob. in Tim.Pers.31.
neur-h/, neur-h=fi, neur-h=fin, v. neura/.

neur-iko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from contraction of the tendons, n. kai\ a)rqritikoi/ Antyll. ap.Orib.9.11.2, cf. Gal.8.420. of the disease itself, n. dia/qesis OGI331.11 (Pergam., ii B.C.). Adv. -kw=s
like a tendon, Ruf. Syn.Puls.7.

neu/r-i^nos, h, on,
made of sinew, xordh/ Arist.GA787b17; lu/ra n. tri/xordos D.S.1.16; kra/nh n. Str.3.3.6.
made or
consisting of fibres, Pl.Plt.279e.
neur-i/on, to/, Dim. of neu=ron, Hp.Mochl. 1, Gal.2.400. Dim. of neura/, AP11.352.11 (Agath.).

entryFree.sense: sinew-like stone, Orph.L.748 codd. (fort. leg. nebr-).

div0.entryFree:
neuro-ba/ths [a^], ou, o(,
rope-dancer, Rhetor.in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).213, Et.Gud.345.52: in Lat. form, Vopisc.Carin.19, Firm.Math.8.17.4.

neuro-eidh/s, e/s,
like sinews: to\ n., = leimw/nion, Dsc.4.16, Plin.HN 20.72.

neuro/-qlastos, on,
bruised in the sinews, Gal.13.576, Orib.Fr. 88.

neuro/-kaulos, on,
with fibrous stem, Thphr.HP7.2.8.
neuro-koi/lios, on, dub. sens. in Hp.Loc.Hom.5 (fort. eu)rukoi/lioi).

neuro-kope/w,
hamstring, hough, LXX Ge.49.6, PCair.Zen.462.4 (iii B.C.), Plb.31.2.11, Str.16.4.10:—Pass., D.S.3.26.

neuro-la/los [a^], on,
with sounding strings, xordh/ AP9.410 (Tull. Sab.).
neuro-mh=trai, ai(, = yo/ai, Clearch.72, Ruf.Onom.189, 192.

neu=ron, to/,
sinew, tendon, once in Hom., in pl., of the
tendons at the feet, peri\ d' e)/gxeos ai)xmh=| neu=ra diesxi/sqh Il.16.316, cf. Hp.Art. 11, etc.; ta\ n. oi(=a e)pitei/nesqai kai\ a)ni/esqai Pl.Phd.98c; n. e)c i)nw=n [gi/gnetai] Id.Ti.82c; sa/rkes kai\ n. ibid.; su/gkeitai/ mou to\ sw=ma e)c o)stw=n kai\ n. Id.Phd.98c, cf. Arist.HA515a27, al.: used adjectivally, ib.540a18 (s.v.l.). n. e)/naimon
vein, Hp.Liqu.2, cf. Ruf. Onom.208. metaph., in pl.,
nerves, sinews, ta\ n. th=s tragw|di/as, of the lyric odes, Ar.Ra.862; u(pote/tmhtai ta\ n. tw=n pragma/twn Aeschin.3.166; e(/ws e)kte/mh| w(/sper n. e)k th=s yuxh=s Pl.R.411b; e)kt. ta\ n. [oi)/nou] Plu.2.692c; also po/lis h(/tis mh\ neu=r' e)pi\ tou\s a)dikou=ntas
e)/xei D.19.283: less freq. in sg., to\ n. u(poko/ptontes th=s duna/mews J.BJ 5.1.4; xrh/mata n. pole/mou App.BC4.99.
cord made of sinew, e. g. bowstring, Il.4.122; string fastening the head of the arrow to the shaft, ib.151; also de/rmata surra/ptein neu/rw| boo/s Hes.Op.544;
cord of a sling, X.An.3.4.17, Q.S.11.112;
bowstring, Ach.Tat.3.8. = neura/ 3, Plb.4.56.3, App.Mith.107.
string of a lyre, AP9.584.9, Luc.DMar.1.4. in pl.,
fibres of plants, Pl.Plt. 280c.
nerves, as organs of sensation, first in Erasistr. ap. Gal.5.602; n. praktika/, ai)sqhtika/, etc., Ruf.Onom.211; n. kinhtika/, proairetika/, Gal.2.613, 739; n. a)koustiko/n Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.71, cf. Gal.2.831, Plot.4.3.23.
penis, Pl.Com.173.19, Gal.8.442. (Cf. Skt.
snā´van-, Avest.
snāvar[schwa], 'sinew', 'bond'.)

neuro/-nosos, on,
diseased in the sinews, Man.4.501.

neuro/-pa^xus, u,
with a thick sinewy coat, of a vein, Hp.Oss.15.

neuro-plekh/s, e/s,
plaited with sinews, AP6.107 (Phil.).

neuro-poihtiko/s, h/, o/n,
making sinews, Gal.Nat.Fac.1.6.

neuro-ra^fe/w or neuro-rra^fe/w,
stitch or
mend shoes, Pl.Euthd.294b, X.Cyr.8.2.5.

neuro-ra^fi/a or neuro-rra^fi/a, h(,
cobblery, Gal.Thras.5.

neuro-ra^fiko/s or neuro-rra^fiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for shoemending, cobbling, Poll.7.154.

neuro-rra/fos [a^], o(, (neu=ron 11, r(a/ptw)
one who stitches with sinews, mender of shoes, cobbler, Ar.Eq.739, Pl.R.421a, etc.
one who makes strings for the lyre, Lycurg. Fr.100.

neuro-spa^dh/s, e/s, (neu=ron 11, spa/w)
drawn by the string, n. a)/traktos the arrow
drawn and just ready to fly, S.Ph.290.
neuro/-spasma, atos, to/, = neuro/spaston, in pl., EM454.17, Phot. s.v. qrau/mata.

neurospast-e/w,
put in motion by strings, of puppets, D.S.34.34, M.Ant.7.3 (Pass.): esp. metaph.,
draw as by a string, Phld.Hom. p.62 O.; h( fantasi/a su/rei h(ma=s kai\ n. pro\s au(th/n Porph. ap. Stob.2.8.40, cf. Ph.1.28; kaq' o(rmh\n -spastei=sqai M.Ant.6.16. Pass.,
to be caught by drawing a string, of birds, Ath.9.391a.

neurospa/st-hs, ou, o(,
puppet-show man, IG11(2).133.80 (Delos, ii B.C.), Arist.Mu.398b16, Ath.1.19e.

neurospast-i/a, h(,
motion by means of strings, metaph., M.Ant.6.28, 7.29.

neurospast-iko/s, h/, o/n,
connected with puppet-shows: h( -kh\ te/xnh Eust.457.38: also metaph., Alex.Aphr.de An.105.33.

neuro/spast-os, on, (spa/w)
drawn by strings, a)ga/lmata n. puppets
moved by strings, Hdt.2.48; ta\ neuro/spasta
puppets, X.Smp.4.55, Luc.Syr.D.16, etc.
neuro-sta/tai, oi(, dub. sens., Poll.7.154.

neuro-stro/fos, o(,
tightener of the strings of a musical instrument, Porph.Gaur.12.1.

neuro-tenh/s, e/s,
stretched by sinews, pagi\s n. a snare
of gut, AP6.109 (Antip.).

neuro-tome/w,
cut the sinews, Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.9 (Pass.).

neuro-to/mos, on,
cutting sinews, Man.5.221.

neuro/-tonon, to/,
strand of gut in a torsion-engine, f.l. in Hero Bel.83.4.

neuro/-trwtos, on,
wounded in the sinews or
tendons, Dsc.1.58, Androm. ap. Gal.13.419, Gal.13.563, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.50.

neuro-xa^rh/s, e/s,
delighting in the bowstring or
in the lyre, epith. of Apollo, AP9.525.14 (prob. for nebroxarh=).

neuro-xondrw/dhs, es,
neuro-cartilaginous, sw=ma Gal.UP 6.19, cf. 2.619.

neur-o/w,
strain the sinews, nerve, pa/qos kai\ tou\s a)sqenesta/tous n. Ph. 2.48:—Pass., sw=ma neo/thti kai\ a)kmh=| neurou/menon Alciphr.3.49. in Pass.,
to be supplied with nerves, innervated, para/ . . Gal.8.236; a)po\ . . , e)k . . , Id.UP9.15, 16.5. neneu/rwtai, sens. obsc. (cf. neu=ron v), but metaph., n. h(/de cumfora/ Ar.Lys.1078.

neur-w/dhs, es, = neuroeidh/s,
sinewy, Hp.VM22 (Comp.); te/nontes Id.Art.30; kefalh/ Pl.Ti.75b; fle/y Arist.HA497a14, al.; me/rh Thphr.Lass.3 (Sup.); to/poi D.S. 2.56; o)xetoi/ Aret.SD2.3;
muscular, strong, Dicaearch. Hist.Fr.10 M.; to\ n. the
sinewy parts, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.27.3, Gal.1.320, Orib. 5.29.7. to\ n. the
nervous system, Gal.19.538.

neu=sis (A), ews, h(, (neu/w)
inclination, tendency of physical forces to or from a centre, Ti.Locr.100d. neu/seis, ai(, title of work by Apollonius of Perga, problems where a straight line has to be drawn through a point so as to intercept a given length between two lines or curves, Papp.670.4.
downward tendency, gravitation, Plu. 2.1122c, prob. in Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.131.
tendency, inclination, Plot.1.1.12. in Neo-Platonic philosophy,
declension in the scale of Being, esp. of the Soul, n. h( pro\s sw=ma kai\ u(/lhn Id.1.6.5; n. ei)s or pro\s th\n ge/nesin, Hierocl.in CA26p.479M., Porph.Antr.11; h( pro\s to\ xei=ron n. Jul.Or.5.166d.

neu=sis (B), ews, h(, (ne/w A)
swimming, Arist.PA639b2, 694b9, al.

neust-a/zw, (neu/w)
nod, neusta/zwn ko/ruqi briarh=| Il.20.162; o)fru/si neusta/zwn, of one
making signs, Od.12.194; h(=stai neusta/zwn kefalh=| mequ/onti e)oikw/s, of one fainting, 18.240, cf. 154, Theoc.25.260; e)s xqo/na n. BionFr.7.3; of an animal
lowering its horns, Opp.C.2.467.

neust-e/on, (ne/wA)
one must swim, Pl.R.453d.

neust-h/r, h=ros, o(, (ne/w A)
swimmer, sailor, Hsch. (neuth/r cod., fort. <a)r>neuth/r).

neust-iko/s (A), h/, o/n, (ne/w A)
able to swim, zw=|on Pl.Sph.220a; n. me/ros animal family
that swims, ib.221e; neustiko\n mo/non i)xqu/s Arist.HA487b22; ta\ neustika/ ib.489b23.

neust-iko/s (B), h/, o/n, (neu/w)
inclining, declining, to\ peri\ th\n gh=n n. Ph.2.513.
neust-o/s, h/, o/n, (ne/w A) = kolumba/s, Luc. Lex.13.

neu/w, Il.13.133, etc.: fut. neu/sw Od.16.283, etc.: aor. e)/neusa, Ep. neu=sa (v. infr.): pf. ne/neuka E.IA1581, etc. (fut. Med. neu/somai only in compds.):—
incline in any direction:
nod, beckon, as a sign, neu/sw me/n toi e)gw\ kefalh=| Od.16.283; neu=s' *ai)/as *foi/niki Il.9.223, cf. Od.17.330; neu=san e)s a)llh/lous h.Hom.7.9; o(/rkos be/baio/s e)stin a)\n neu/sw mo/non Alex.91, cf. 178.3;
beckon with the hand, decia=| de/ moi e)/neuse Ezek.Exag.73: c. inf.,
beckon to one to do a thing, in token of command, neani/ais e)/neuse parqe/non labei=n E.Hec.545.
nod or
bow in token of assent, e)pi\ glefa/rois n. Pi.I.8(7).50; neu=son, *kroni/wn Id.P.1.71; neu=son, te/knon, pei/sqhti S.Ph.484, cf. Ar.Pax 883: c. acc. et inf.,
grant, assure, promise that . . , neu=se de/ oi( lao\n so/on e)/mmenai Il.8.246: c. inf. fut., Pi.O.7.67: c. inf. aor., AP6.244 (Crin.): c. acc. rei,
grant, promise, neu=se de/ oi( kou/rhn h.Cer.445, cf. 463; neu/sate ta\n a)do/khton xa/rin S.OC248 (lyr.), cf. E.Alc.978 (lyr.). generally,
nod, bend forward, of warriors, Il.13.133; neu=on to\ ai)doi=on Hdt.2.48; lo/fos kaqu/perqen e)/neuen Il.3.337, cf. Alc.15.3, etc.; sta/xues neu/oien e)/raze Hes.Op.473, etc.; n. ka/tw
stoop, E.El.839; n. e)s th\n gh=n Ar.V.1110, cf. Theoc.22.90: c. acc., ou(/tw nu=n mnhsth=res . . neu/oien kefala\s dedmhme/noi Od.18.237; e)s pe/don ka/ra neu=sai fo/bw| S.Ant.270, cf. 441.
incline, slope, n. a)po/ tinos ei)/s ti
incline to wards, Th.4.100; ei)s to\ au)to\ n.
tend to the same point, Pl.Lg.945d; pro\s to\ luph=san, pro\s toi=s r(h/masin, Alex.Aphr. Pr.1.48,78; of countries, etc.,
slope, n. ei)s du/seis, pro\s to\ pe/lagos, Plb.1.42.6, 1.73.5, etc.; of buildings, etc.,
look, face, ei)s no/ton, etc., PLond.3.978 (iv A.D.), etc.; mhdamou= n.
to be in equilibrium, Plb.6.10.7; tai=s prw/|rais e)/cw neu/onta ta\ ska/fh Id.1.26.12: Geom., of straight lines,
verge, tend to a point (i. e. to pass through it when produced), Arist.AP0.76b9, Apollon.Perg.1.2, etc.: metaph.,
to be inclined, a)/llws n. Theoc.7.109; n. ei)s o)rga/n, ei)s e)/leon, APl.4.136 (Antiphil.); e)pi\ xa/rin Phalar.Ep.78; pro\s gaste/ra Ath.14.659a; pro\s qh=lu Trag.Adesp.355. metaph.,
decline, fall away, e)k . . tw=n pote lamprw=n neu/ei bi/otos, neu/ei de\ tu/xa E.Fr.153: in Neo-Platonic philosophy,
decline, sink in the scale of Being, Plot.2.9.4, etc. neu/ei: e)pane/rxetai h)\ ma=llon feu/gei, Hsch. Pass., only pf. part. neneume/nos
inclined, Teucerin Cat.Cod.Astr.7.202. (Cf. Skt.
návate 'turn round', Lat.
nuo.）

nefe/lh, h(, (ne/fos)
cloud, mass of clouds (distd. from o(mi/xlh,
mist or
fog, Arist.Mete.346b33), Il.15.20, Hes.Th.745, etc.; n. kuane/h, porfure/h, Od.12.75, Il.17.551; e)ribro/mou nefe/las strato/s Pi.P.6.11; nefe/lai po/kois e)ri/wn o(moi=ai Thphr.Sign.13.—Mostly poet., but found in X.An.1.8.8, Arist., Thphr. ll. cc., and in late Prose, Plu.2.777e, Philostr.Ep.24. metaph., nefe/lh de/ min a)mfeka/luye kuane/h, of death, Il.20.417; to\n d' a)/xeos nefe/lh e)ka/luye me/laina
a cloud of sorrow, 17.591, cf. S.Ant.528 (anap.); pole/mou n. Simon.89; fo/nou n. Pi.N. 9.38, cf. I.7(6).27; *kentau/rou foni/a| nefe/la|, i.e. with his blood, S. Tr.831 (lyr.); kelainw=pis n., of sleep, Pi.P.1.7. of
clouds in urine, Hp.Prog.12, Gal.6.252. = nefe/lion 11.2, Hp.Prorrh.2.20.
cloud on a mirror, Arist.Insomn.459b30.
fine bird-net, in pl., Ar.Av.194,528 (anap.), Call.Aet.3.1.37, Gal.UP1.2, Ath.1.25d: in sg., AP6.11 (Satyr.), 109 (Antip.), 185 (Zos.). Alchem.,
sublimate, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.50 B.

nefelh-gere/ta^, Ep. for -ths, o(, （a)gei/rw) used by Hom. only in nom. and in gen. nefelhgere/tao,
cloud-gatherer, of Zeus, Il.1.511, al.; acc., a)e/ra nefelhgere/thn Emp.149.
nefelh-gerh/s, e/os, o(, = foreg., Q.S. 4.80.

nefelh-do/n, Adv.
in the manner of clouds, Nonn.D.15.1.

nefel-i/zw,
wrap in clouds, in Pass., Sch.Il.15.153.

nefe/l-ion, to/, Dim. of nefe/lh, Arist.Mete.367b9, Thphr.Sign.11,20. Astron.,
nebula, Ptol.Alm.7.5, al., Vett. Val.110.12. of
clouds in urine, Hp.Coac.571, etc.
cloud-like opacity on the eye, Dsc.2.151, Gal.19.534.
white speck on the nails, Poll.2.146.

nefelo-eidh/s, e/s,
cloud-like, sustrofai/, of nebulae or star-clusters, Gem.3.4, Ptol.Tetr.149; a)sth/r Hipparch.2.5.15; also of urine,
cloudy, Hp.
Acut.(Sp.)17.

nefelo-ke/ntauros, o(,
cloud-centaur, Luc.VH 1.16: partly as
sprung from Ixion and the cloud, partly as a fantastic shape such as the clouds assume.

nefelo-kokku_gi/a, h(, (ko/kkuc)
Cloudcuckoo-town, built by the birds in Ar.Av.819, al., a satire on Athens.

nefelo-kokku_gieu/s, e/ws, o(,
Cloud-cuckoo-town-man, ib.878, 1035.

nefelo-mi^gh/s, e/s,
mingled with cloud, pu=r Placit.3.3.4.

nefelo/-omai, Pass.,
to be clouded over, Eust.127.21.

nefelo-sta/sia [sta^], ta/, (nefe/lh 111, i(/sthmi)
place where nets are set to catch birds, Id.1928.37.

nefelo-fo/ros, on,
bringing clouds, Lyd.Mag.3.32.

nefel-w/dhs, es,
cloudy, bringing clouds, o( no/tos Arist.Pr.942a37; ko/nis Polyaen.4.6.13.
clouded, of the eye, Gal.10.1019.

nefel-wto/s, h/, o/n,
clouded: made of clouds, Luc.VH1.19.
nefo-eidh/s, e/s, = nefeloeidh/s, Epicur.Ep.2p.51U., AP9.396 (Paul. Sil.).

nefo/-omai, Pass.,
to be clouded over, Nic.Dam.68 J., Ph.2.21, Adam.Vent.35, Porph.Antr.27: metaph., nenefwme/na bouleu/ontes Man.4.518.

nefo-poi/htos, on,
made of clouds, Dam.Isid.69.

ne/fos, eos, to/,
cloud, mass of clouds, Il.4.275, al.; smikrou= ne/fous e)kpneu/sas me/gas xeimw/n S.Aj.1148; n. o)/mbrion Ar.Nu.288 (lyr.); n. kai\ o(mi/xlh Pl.Ti.49c; to\n ki/ndunon parelqei=n w(/sper n. D.18.188. metaph. (cf. nefe/lh 1.2), qana/tou de\ me/lan n. a)mfeka/luyen Il.16.350, cf. Od.4.180, B.12.64; la/qas n. Pi.O.7.45; sko/tou n., of blindness, S.OT1314 (lyr.); n. oi)mwgh=s, stenagmw=n, E.Med.107 (anap.), HF 1140; o)fru/wn n.
a cloud upon the brow, Id.Hipp.172 (anap.); u(po\ tou= metw/pou oi(=on n. e)panesthko/s Arist.Phgn.809b22; diaskeda=te to\ proso\n nu=n n. e)pi\ tou= prosw/pou Anaxandr.58. metaph., also,
a cloud of men, etc., n. pezw=n, *trw/wn, Il.4.274, 16.66; yarw=n, koloiw=n, 17.755; n. tosou=ton a)nqrw/pwn Hdt.8.109; penesta/wn n. Timo 39; martu/rwn Ep.Hebr.12.1; pole/moio n.
the cloud of battle,
thick of the fight, Il.17.243, cf.Ar.Pax1090: applied by Pi.N.10.9 to a single hero: used by Prose writers for poet. nefe/lh (q. v.). (Cf. Skt.
nábhas 'fog', 'cloud', Slav.
nebo 'heaven', Lat.
nebula.）

ne/fr-hsis, ews, h(,
pain in the kidneys, dub. in Gloss.

nefr-iai=os, a, on, (nefro/s)
of the kidneys, ste/ar Dsc.2.76; to\ n. (to be read for nefri/dion) Hp.Mul.2.164.
nefr-iko/s, h/, o/n, f.l. for nefritiko/s, Dsc. 1.6.
nefr-i/on, to/, Dim. of nefro/s, POxy.108i9 (ii/iii A.D.). = e)lafo/boskon, Ps.-Dsc.3.69 (nisi leg. ne/breion).

nefr-i/ths [i_], o(,
fem. nefri=tis, h(, = nefriai=os, sfo/ndulos, i.e. the first vertebra of the sacrum, Poll.2.179; no/son nefri=tin Th.7.15; fqi/sis n. Hp.Int.15: also as Subst. nefri=tis (sc. no/sos), h(, Id.Coac.502: in pl., Id.Aph.3.31, Dsc.1.14.

nefr-i_ti^ko/s, h/, o/n,
of the kidneys, nosh/mata Hp.Art.41; ta\ n. Id.Aph.6.6.
affected with nefri=tis, Dsc.1.15, Apollon. ap.Gal.13.326, Gal.Nat.Fac.1.13. of remedies,
suitable for such cases, Alex.Trall.11.2.

nefroeidh/s, e/s,
like a kidney, Arist.HA508a30.

nefr-o/s, o(, in pl.,
kidneys, Diog.Apoll.6, Hp.Aph.4.78, Pl.Ti.91a, etc.: in dual, Ar.Ra.475: rarely in sg., Id.Lys.962, Euphro 1.25: euphem. for o)/rxeis, Philippid.5.4: metaph., LXXPs.15(16).7. (Cf. OHG.
nioro 'kidney', Praenest.
nefrones, Lanuv.
nebrundines 'kidneys', 'testicles'.)
nefr-w/dhs, es, = nefroeidh/s, Arist.PA670b13.
nef-u/drion, to/, Dim. of ne/fos, Olymp.in Mete.215.25.

nef-w/dhs, es, = nefoeidh/s, like a cloud, Str.3.2.7.
cloudy, bringing clouds, o( no/tos Arist.Pr.942a35. of the voice,
husky, Id.Aud.800a14.

ne/f-wsis, ews, h(, (nefo/omai)
overclouding, Ph.1.27, Hld.9.9 codd. (pl.), Al.Jb.3.5.

*nefw/ths, ou, o(, epith. of Zeus in Egypt, prob. =
Nefr-hotep, OGI 676 (ii A.D.).

ne/w (A), nei= Pl.R.453d, ne/omen Pi.Fr.218 codd. Ath.; inf. nei=n Epich.53, Th.7.30; part. ne/wn Od.5.344, Pl.R.529c: impf. e)/neon Ar.Eq.321; Ep. e)/nneon Il.21.11; poet. ne/on Alc.143: fut. neu/somai Hsch., neusou=mai v.l. in X.An.4.3.12: aor. e)/neusa （di-) Pl.Prm.137a, (e)c-) E.Hipp.470, Th.2.90: pf. ne/neuka (dia-) Pl.R.441c:—
swim, xei/ressi ne/wn Od.5.344; i(=ce ne/wn ib.442; ne/ein ou)k e)pista/menoi Hdt. 8.89, cf. 6.44; ou)/te e)pist. nei=n Th.7.30; nei=n ou)k i)/santi Epich. l.c. metaph., of shoes that are too large, e)/neon e)n tai=s e)mba/sin
was floating in my shoes, as if they were boats, Ar.Eq.321; nei=n e)c u(pti/as, v. u(/ptios 11. fin. (Prob. cogn. with na/w, Lat.
nare.）

ne/w (B), fut. nh/sw: aor. 1 e)/nhsa:—Pass., aor. e)nh/qhn: pf. ne/nhsmai （e)pi-) Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.14:—
spin, Hom. only aor. Med., a(/ssa oi( kata\ *klw=qes nh/santo the happenings which they
spun out to him, Od. 7.198; of a spider, nh=| nh/mata Hes.Op.777; sth/mona makro\n e)/nhsa Batr.183; pe/plous te nh=sai S.Fr.439; sth/mona nh/sw Ar.Lys.519; nw=sai malqakwta/thn kro/khn Eup.319; ta\ nhqe/nta Pl.Plt.282e: 3pl. nw=si occurs in Ael.NA7.12 (as if from na/w), cf. Poll.7.32, 10.125, EM344.1; and Hsch. cites nw=nta: nh/qonta; in Eup.l.c. Meineke restores nh=sai for nw=sai. (Cf. Lat.
neo 'spin', OHG.
nāan 'sew', etc.)

ne/w (C), fut. nh/sw Suid.: aor. e)/nhsa (v. infr.):—Med., fut. (in pass. sense) nh/somai Hsch. (v. infr.): aor. e)nhsa/mhn Polyaen.8.65:— Pass., aor. e)nh/sqhn Arr.An.7.3.2, Porph.Abst.2.54, also e)nh/qhn （e)p-) prob. in Hdn.4.2.10: pf. ne/nhmai IG22.1522.23 (iv B.C.), X. (v. infr.), perh. also ne/nhsmai (v. infr.); Ion. 3pl. nene/atai （sun-) Hdt.2.135; 3sg. plpf. e)ne/nhsto Ael.VH5.6: pres. only in compds. e)pi-, perine/w (qq.v.):—
heap, pile up, purh\n nh=sai
pile a funeral pyre, Hdt. 1.50, cf. Ar.Lys.269, Th.2.52, Porph. l.c. (Pass.); nh/santes cu/la E. HF243; a)mforh=s nenhsme/noi Ar.Nu.1203; a)/rtoi nenhme/noi X.An.5.4.27; nw=ntos, glossed swreu/ontos, Phot. in Pass.,
to be stuffed, c. gen., nenhme/nhn xoi=ron pollh=s fori/nhs Herod.4.15; cf. nhso/meqa: koresqhso/meqa, Hsch. (Contr. from nhe/w, q.v.)

ne/w (D), Dor. Adv., in the phrase e)s ne/w, = ei)s ne/wta,
next year, Riv.Fil.56.266 (Cyrene, dub.), v.l. in Theoc.15.143 (cf. Riv.Fil.56.413); ei)s ne/wn dub. in BGU958c13 (iii A.D.).
new/, Att. gen. and later acc. of new/s （nao/s).

newkor-e/w,
to be a newko/ros,
serve, tend, in Pass., *(esti/a . . u(po\ parqe/nwn newkorei=tai Corn.ND28, cf. BMus.Inscr.481*.153 (Ephesus, ii A.D.). ironically,
sweep clean, clean out, plunder a temple, Pl. R.574d.
honour with a temple, to\n au(tw=n su/mmaxon (sc. qeo/n) J.BJ5.9.4. metaph.,
keep clean and pure, newkorei=n e)/rwta
cherish love
in a pure heart (as in a temple), Luc.Am.48.

newkor-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
office of a newko/ros, Ph.1.695, Plu.2.351e, IG14.1026, Man. 4.430 (pl.): written neokorei/a in IGRom.3.584 (Sidyma).

newko/r-ion, to/,
sacristy, IG11(2).144B17 (Delos, iv B.C.), 22.1672.181, al., BCH 35.243 (pl., Delos, ii B.C.), IPE2.342.4 (Phanagoria): Dor. na_korei=on IG42(1).109ii 127 (Epid., iii B.C.).

new/kor-os, o(, Dor. na_oko/ros GDI 2116.14, al. (Delph., ii B.C.), Hsch.: contr. na_ko/ros PMagd.35.7 (iii B.C., prob. Dor.), GDI1912.9, al. (Delph., ii B.C.), 5087 (Crete): as fem., IG42(1).393, al. (Epid., ii A.D.); nauko/ros, h(, Buresch
Aus Lydien p.58: poet. nhoko/ros AP9.22 (Phil.):—
warden of a temple, as a sacred officer, toi=s i(eroi=s n. gi/gnesqai Pl.Lg.759a; i(ere/as te kai\ n. ib.953a; para\ *megabu/cw| tw=| th=s *)arte/midos n. X.An.5.3.6, cf. Inscr.Prien.231 (iv B.C.); bwmoi=o n. AP11.324 (Autom.); n. tou= mega/lou *sara/pidos POxy.100.2 (ii A.D.).
sacristan, Herod.4.41,45, Paus.10.12.5; e)nbo/lion e)/xwn n. in a list of silver articles, IG7.3498.25 (Oropus). title assumed by Asiatic cities in Imperial times, when they had built a temple in honour of their patron-god or the Emperor, as Ephesus, n. *)arte/midos Act.Ap.19.35; also as Adj., tw=| n. *)efesi/wn dh/mw| OGI481.3 (ii A.D.), cf. BMus.Inscr.481*.4 (Ephesus, ii A.D.); di\s n. tw=n *sebastw=n, of Ephesus, OGI496.7 (ii A.D.); of Smyrna, IGRom.4.1419. (Prob. derived from kore/w,
sweep, the orig. sense being prob.
temple-sweeper, cf. E.Ion115, 121, 795 (where the word does not occur), newkore/w 1.2, 11, Ph.2.236, Hsch.; but Suid. expl. it o( to\n new\n kosmw=n . . , a)ll' ou)x o( sai/rwn.）

newlk-e/w,
haul a ship up on land, Thphr.HP5.7.2, Plb.1.29.3; ta\ ska/fh D.S.20.47: abs., Aristonym. ap. Stob.4.33.29:—Pass., nenewlkhme/na [ploi=a] Ath.8.350b, cf. Alciphr.1.1: metaph., of a corpse, to\ -hme/non e)n th=| kli/nh| Phld.Mort.28.

newlk-i/a, h(,
hauling up a ship into
dock, Aen.Tact.17.1, Arist.Ph.253b18, Thphr.HP5.7.2 (pl.), IG22.1028.37 (pl.): metaph., sw=ma w(/sper e)n n. th=| sxolh=| teqerapeume/non Plu.2.136a.

new/lk-ion, to/,
dry dock, in pl., App.BC5.100, Hsch.s.v. new=nas (neo/lkia cod.).

newlk-o/s, o(, (nau=s, e(/lkw)
one who hauls up a ship into dock, Arist.Ph.250a18, SIG1000.22 (Cos, i B.C.), Poll.7.190, 10.148.

ne/wma, atos, to/, (neo/w)
fallow land just broken up, LXX Je.4.3 (pl.).
new/n, w=nos, o(, （nau=s） = new/rion, Hsch. (pl.); Ion., acc. to Phot.

new/nhtos, on,
newly bought, of slaves, Ar.Eq.2, Timocl.7.2, Ph.2.73, cf. Ar.Pl.769; ku/nes Aristo Stoic.1.88; a)gro/s App.BC4.41.

newni/a, h(, a kind of
olive, Hsch.

new-poiei=on, to/,
office of the newpoi=ai, Supp.Epigr.2.568 (Didyma, ii B.C.).
new-poie/w, serve as newpoi/hs, Poll.1.11, Supp.Epigr.1.371 (Samos, ii A.D.):—also neopoie/w, OGI485.8 (Magn. Mae.), Ephes.2 No.47: Dor. na_opoie/w SIG241.6 (Delph., iv B.C.), IG7.3073.6 (Lebad.).

new-poi/hs, ou, o(,
official in charge of the temple-fabric, oi( n. tw=n qew=n SIG46.6 (Halic., v B.C.), cf. 353.1 (Ephesus, iv B.C.), etc.:— also new-po/hs, Inscr.Prien.195.4 (iii/ii B.C.), 174.31 (ii B.C.); neopoi/hs, Supp.Epigr.1.395 (Samos, i A.D.), Ephes.2 No.83: Dor. na_poi/as SIG 1023.33, al. (Cos); na_po/as IGRom.4.1097, 1098, SIG793 (ibid., i A.D.).

new-poii/a, h(,
office of newpoi/hs, Inscr.Prien.174.29 (ii B.C.; -poi/+a): Dor. na_opoii/a SIG241.5 (Delph., iv B.C.).

new-poiiko/s, h/, o/n,
relating to newpoi=ai, in Dor. form na_opoi+ko/s, no/mos IG7.3073.88 (Lebad.).
new-poi/ion, to/, in Dor. form naopoi/ion, = newpoii/a, SIG 479.7 (Delph., iii B.C.).

new-poio/s, o(, = newpoi/hs, IG22.1678
b A14:— Dor. na_opoio/s Arist.Rh.1374b27, SIG236
B, al. (Delph., iv B.C.), IG 7.3073.4,al. (Lebad.); also in Att. Inscrr. from late iv B.C., ib.22.1678
a A16,20. (nau=s)
building ships, Poll.1.84.

newre/w,
to be overseer of a dockyard, Eust.1562.37, Hsch., Phot.

new/rhs, es (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.72), (o)/rnumi)
new, fresh, new/rh bo/struxon tetmhme/non a lock of hair
just cut off, S.El.901; ei)lhfo/tas fo/bon new/rh Id.OC730; n. yo/fos Id.Ichn.154; a)/llo new=res ph=ma Philet.1.

new/r-ion, to/, (newro/s)
dockyard, IG12.57.53, al., Ar.Ach.918, Th.2.93, 3.74, etc.: in pl., E.Hel.1530, Ar.Av.1540, Th.3.92, Lys.12.99, 13.46, Pl.Criti.115c, etc.
newr-iofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, gloss on newro/s, Hsch.
newr-i/s, i/dos, h(, = new/rion, Str.1.3.20 (sed leg. newri/wn).

newr-o/s, o(, (nau=s, ou)=ros)
superintendent of a dockyard, Hsch.: pl., IG12.74.11.
ne/wros, on, = new/rhs, Hdn.Gr.1.200, Hsch., Phot.

ne-w/rofos, on, (o)rofh/)
newly roofed, oi)=kos IG11(2).163 A10, al. (Delos, iii B.C.).

ne-wru^xh/s, e/s, (ne/os, o)ru/ssw)
newly dug, Nic.Th. 940.
new/s, w/, o(, v. nao/s.

new/soikos, o(, (nau=s, oi)=kos)
dock, Ar.Ach.96: mostly in pl.,
shipsheds, slips, in which ships might be built, repaired, or laid up in winter, Hdt.3.45, Cratin.197, And.3.7, Th.7.25,64, Lys.30.22, IG22.505.14: divisim, e)n *peiraiei= new/s ei)sin oi)=koi Paus.1.29.16.
new/ssw, Att. ne/-ttw, (ne/os) = neo/w, newteri/zw, Hdn.Gr.1.447, Hsch.

newsti/, Adv. of ne/os, for ne/ws,
lately, just now, Hdt.1.196, 2.15,49, al., S.El.1049, Th.4.108, Pl.Grg.503c, Antiph.58.4, etc.

ne/wta, Adv.
next year, Semon.1.9; elsewh. only ei)s （e)s） n. X.Cyr. 7.2.13,8.6.15, Thphr.Char.3.4; a)ei\ gewrgo\s ei)s n. plou/sios Philem. 82; ta\ me\n nu=n, ta\ d' ei)s n. Thphr.HP9.11.9; o( ei)s n. karpo/s Id.CP3.16.2; tagou\s tou\s e)n n. prob. in Schwyzer323A12 (Delph., v/iv B.C.); cf. ne/w (D).
new/tatos, h, on, Sup. of ne/os.

newter-i/zw, Att.fut. -iw= Th.4.51: (new/teros 11):—
makeinnovations, peri\ gumnastikh\n kai\ mousikh/n Pl.R.424b; e)n tai=s paidiai=s Id.Lg.798c; of climatic change, n. e)s th\n a)sqe/neian
change [health] into sickness, Th.7.87. freq. with an implication of violence,
use forcible measures, mh\ sfw=n pe/ri n. mhde/n Id.1.58; e)/s tina/s ti n. Id.4.51; e)s ou)de/na ou)de\n e)newte/rizon Id.2.3, cf. X.HG2.1.5, D.23.133; n. peri/ tina Isoc.Ep.7.9:—also in Med.,
take the law into one's own hands, POxy. 237 vi3 (ii A.D.). esp.
attempt political changes, make revolutionary movements, toi=s a)tuxou=si newteri/zein sumfe/rei Antipho 2.4.9; a)po\ mo/nhs n. th=s a)spi/dos Critias 37 D.; pro\s tou\s cumma/xous newteri/zontas Th.1.97, cf. 102; n. e)/rgw| Id.3.66; newteri/zein e)bou/leto e)s to\ plh=qos Lys.20.16; to\ newteri/zon the
revolutionary party, J.BJProoem. 2; newteri/sai th\n politei/an
revolutionize the state, Th.1.115:—Pass., e)newteri/zeto ta\ peri\ th\n o)ligarxi/an Id.8.73, cf. 4.76.

newter-iko/s, h/, o/n,
natural to a youth, youthful, a)gwgh/ Plb.10.21.7; au)qa/deia J.AJ16.11.8; e)piqumi/ai 2 Ep.Ti.2.22; a(marth/mata Vett.Val.118.3. Adv. -kw=s Plu.Dio4.
modern in style, ka/toptron POxy.1449.56 (iii A.D.).

newte/r-i^sis, ews, h(,
revolution, Heph.Astr.1.21.

newte/r-isma, atos, to/,
change, a)e/ros Ph. ap. Eus.PE8.11.

newter-ismo/s, o(,
attempt to change; esp. in bad sense,
innovation, revolutionary movement, Pl.R.422a, 555d, D.17.15, etc.: pl., Pl.Lg.758c; e)/foros e)pi\ tw=n n., title of official at Sparta, BSA27.234 (ii A.D.). generally,
change, as of diet, Sabin. ap. Gal.17(1).562.

newter-isth/s, ou=, o(,
innovator, D.H.5.75, J. Vit.27, Plu.Cim.17.

newter-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
given to innovation, esp. in language, r(h/twr Poll.4.36.

newteropoi-o/s, o/n,
innovating, revolutionary, Th.1.70, Arist.Pol.1266b14; fu/sei *(/ellhnes n. Iamb.Myst.7.5; to\ n. tino/s Ael.VH12.16.

new/teros, a, on, Comp. of ne/os, of persons,
younger, geneh=fi n. Il.
