21.439; w)\n fu/sei n. S.OC1295;
too young, Od.21.132;
a minor, Th. 3.26; oi( n.
men of military age, Id.5.50; to\ presbu/tero/n te kai\ to\ n. ib.64: c. gen., oi( n. tw=n pepragme/nwn those who are
too young to remember the events, D.18.50; oi( n. the
new school, of poets, Cic.Att.7.2.1; of poets later than Homer, Sch.Il.16.574, 24.257. Sup., geneh=| de\ new/tatos e)/skon a(pa/ntwn Il.7.153, etc.; h( n. dhmokrati/a, opp. h( patri/a d., Arist.Pol.1305a29. of events,
newer, more recent, new/teron kako/n Pi.P.4.155;
of recent origin, *dhmo/kritos mousikh/n fhsi n. ei)=nai Phld.Mus.p.108K.: metaph.,
later, worse, n. bou/leuma S.Ph. 560; new/teron prh/ssein contrive
calamity, injury, Hdt.5.106: freq. with ti, h)/n ti katalamba/nh| n. to\n pezo\n [strato/n] Id.8.21; de/doika mh/ ti dra=| n. Ar.Ec.338, cf. Pi.Fr.107.6, Theoc.24.40; mh/ ti n. a)gge/lleis; Pl.Prt.310b; new/tero/n ti poiei=n e)/s tina Th.1.132; kata\ th\n *(ella/da Hdt.8.142; peri\ po/lin *(ella/da Id.5.93; new/tera bouleu/ein peri/ tinos Id.1.210; mhde\n new/teron poiei=n peri\ a)ndrw=n Th.2.6. freq. of rebellion or violent revolution, n. ti poie/ein Hdt.5.35, etc.; n. prh/gmata prh/cein ib.19; newte/rwn pragma/twn e)piqumei=n Isoc.7.59, X.HG5.2.9, etc.

new-teuktika/, ta/,
concerning temple-building, as title of a book, Suid.s.v. *)orfeu/s (neo- codd.).
new-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, Att. for naofu/lac, Gloss.
new/xermos: gh= newsti\ ei)rgasme/nh, Hsch. (Cf. xerma/zw.）

nh-, neg. Prefix used in poet. words, combining with short a, e or
o, as in nhleh/s, nh/riqmos, nh/kestos, nh/nemos, nhpele/w, nh=stis, nwdo/s, nw/dunos, or before consonants, as in nhkerdh/s, nh/kerws, nhpaqh/s, nhpenqh/s, nh/poinos. (Cf. Lat.
ně- h arises from I.-E. contraction and is used by analogy in combination with consonants.)

nh/, Particle of strong affirmation, with acc. of the divinity invoked, once in Trag., n. tw\ *lape/rsa, n. to
 *eu)rw/tan tri/ton, n. tou\s e)n *)/argei kai\ kata\ *spa/rthn qeou/s S.Fr.957; freq. in Com. and Prose, esp. in the phrase nh\ *di/a, Ar.Eq.319, Th.240, etc.; with the Art., n. to
 *di/a Id.Pl.202, Antiph.179.3, etc.; with the names of other gods, usu. c. Art., n. th
 *dh/mhtra Pherecr.24; n. th
 *)aqhna=n Ar.Pax218; n. to
 *)apo/llw Id.Ec.160; n. th
 *)/artemin ib.90; n. to
 *poseidw= Id.Nu.83, Eup.265; n. tw\ qew/ (Demeter and Cora) Ar.Lys.51, Men.Georg.24 (a woman's oath, acc. to Phryn.171; n. tw\ siw/ (of the Dioscuri) used by a Spartan, Plu.2.234f); n. th
 *(/hran Pl.Phdr.230b; n. th
 *(esti/an Antiph.185; n. th
 *)afrodi/thn Ar.Ec.189, Nicostr.Com.35; n. to
 ku/na, v. ku/wn 1 fin.; n. tou\s qeou/s Ar.Pl.74, Pl.R.531a, al.; n. qeou/s Hp. Ep.17; n. to/n alone, Ph.2.271. n. （to
） *di/a is also used, in answering questions, X.Cyr.1.3.6, Pl.Prt.312a, etc.: in a supposed answer from antagonists, folld. by ga/r, D.8.16. in introducing objections or contentions supposed to come from antagonists, folld. by ga/r, Id.19.285; folld. by a)lla/, Id.18.117, 19.272; preceded by a)lla/, X.HG7.3.10, Mem.1.2.9, D.24.125, al. to add force by way of climax, a)/llws te me/ntoi n. *di/a pa/ntws kai\ . . Pl.Ap.35d, cf. X.HG1.7.21. in adjurations, Ar.Av.661, Ra. 164.
nh=, contr. for ne/a, v. ne/os.

nh=a, nh=as, v. nau=s: nh=ade, Adv.
to the ship, Od.13.19; meta\ nh=ade A.R.4.1768.
nha/s, a/dos, h(, a gigantic animal, whose fossil remains were found in Samos, Euph. ap. Ael.NA17.28: prov., mei=zon boa=| tw=n nha/dwn ibid.
nh/atos, v. ne/atos (A).

nhga/teos [a^], h, on, Ep. Adj. of doubtful meaning and derivation, perh.
newly made, xitw/n, krh/demnon, Il.2.43, 14.185; fa=ros h.Ap. 122; kalu/bai A.R.1.775.

nh/gretos, on, (nh-, e)gei/rw)
unwaking, nh/gretos u(/pnos
sound sleep, Od.13.80, h.Ven.177; of death, eu(/domes eu)= ma/la makro\n a)te/rmona n. u(/pnon Mosch.3.104: in late Prose, Aret.SD2.13: neut. as Adv., nh/greton
without waking, n. eu(/dein Od.13.74; n. u(pnou=n, of death, AP 7.305 (Adaeus).

nh/duia, wn, ta/,
bowels, entrails, Il.17.524, A.R.2.113, Nic.Al. 381.
nhdu/mios [u^], h, on, = sq., Opp.H.3.412.

nh/du^mos, on, = h(/dumos (q.v.), from which it arises through false division in the Homeric text, in Hom. always epith. of u(/pnos, Il. 2.2, al., also h.Ven.171. in later Poets, not confined to u(/pnos,
sweet, delightful, dona/kwn *mou=sa n. h.Pan.16; n. *)orfeu/s APl. 4.217; n. u(/dwr Nonn.D.48.602; a)/nqos ib.12.176. (Derived by Aristarch. from nh-, du/nw.）

nhdu/s, u/os, h(,
any of the cavities in the body, Hp.de Arte10: hence,
stomach, Od.9.296, Hes.Th.487, S.OC1263, etc.
belly, paunch, Il.13.290, Hdt.2.47.
bowels, A.Ch.757, Hp.
Aër.19, etc.; e)celei=n th\n nhdu/n Hdt.2.87; as the seat of thirst, te/gcas a)/diyon nhdu/n E.Cyc.574; a)/rdh| te nhdu/n Id.Supp.207.
womb, Il.24.496, Hes.Th.460, A.Eu.665, etc.; also of Zeus when in travail of Athena, Hes.Th.890,899; of Dionysus, E.Ba.527 (lyr.). metaph., n. na/rqhkos Nic.Al.272; le/bhtos Orph.L.276.—Acc. nhdu/a for nhdu/n in Q.S.1.616; dat. pl. nhdu/si Nic.Th.467. [u^ in trisyll. cases, also nhdu^s A.Ch.l.c., Call.Dian.160, nhdu^n E.Andr.356, Cyc. 574: but nhdu_n AP9.519 (Alc.), Nic.Al.416, Orph. l.c.]
nh=es, nh/essi, v. nau=s.

nh-e/w, Dor. na_e/w, older form of ne/w (c),
heap, pile up, e)p' au)tw=n nh/hsan cu/la polla/ Od.19.64; of a funeral pile, menoeike/a nh/eon u(/lhn Il.23.139; peri\ de\ drata\| sw/mata nh/ei ib.169; pu=r t' eu)= nhh=sai Od.15.322; also e)p' a)ph/nhs nh/eon . . a)perei/si' a)/poina
heaped a huge ransom, Il.24.276; nh/eon au)to/qi bwmo/n
piled it
up, A.R.1.403:—in Med., pura\n nah/sat' B.3.33: fut. nhh/setai in pass. sense, Opp.H.2.216.
pile, load, nhh/sas eu)= nh=as Il.9.358:—in Med., nh=a a(/lis xrusou=—nhhsa/sqw
let him pile his ship with gold enough, ib.137, cf. 279. [Sts. corrupted to nhne/w, q.v.]

nh/-hsis, ews, h(,
a heaping, piling up, Sch.A.R.1.403.

nhqi/s, i/dos, h(,
spinster, cj. in Sch.Il.6.491.

nh/qousa, h(, apptly. name of a
plant, PMag.Par.1.2307.

nh/qw,
spin, Cratin.96, Pl.Plt.289c, LXXEx.35.25, AP11.110 (Nicarch.), Corn.ND13, Gal.UP1.3 (but said not to be Att., Poll.7.32, AB109): Ion. impf. nh/qeskes AP14.134. (Formed from ne/w (B), as plh/qw from plh-, pi/mplhmi.）
*nhi+a/s, a/dos, h(, Ion. for *nai+a/s.

nhi+os, h, on, Dor. na/i+os, a, on (as always in Trag., cf. da/i+os, ga/i+os), also os, on A.Pers.279,336: (nau=s):—
of or
for a ship, do/ru n.
ship-timber, Od.9.384, etc.: without do/ru, Il.3.62, 13.391; n. cu/la Hes.Op.808; n. dou=ra A.R.2.79; nh/i+a alone,
oars, Nic.Th.814; a)/ndres na/i+oi A.Supp.719; sto/los na/i+os
the ship's course, ib.2 (anap.); nai/+oisin e)mbolai=s Id.Pers.ll.cc.; ge/nos nai/+as a)rwgo\n te/xnas, i.e. the seamen, S.Aj.357 (lyr.); nai/+a a)ph/nh, na/i+on o)/xhma, i.e. a ship, E.Med. 1122, IT409 (lyr.).
*nhi/+s, i/+dos, h(, Ion. for *nai/+s.

nh=i+s (A), i+dos, o(, h(, acc. nh/i+da Il.7.198, A.R.3.32, but nh=i+n Call. Aet.1.1.33, A.R.3.130: (nh-, i)dei=n, ei)de/nai):—
unknowing of, unpractised in a thing, ou) nh=i+s a)e/qlwn Od.8.179: abs., Il.l.c.; n. e)/ti xruse/as *ku/pridos B.5.174, cf. Call.Aet.3.1.49; nautili/hs . . nh=i+n e)/xeis bi/on ib. 1.1.33, cf.Id.Aet.Oxy.2079.2; n. patro/s father
less, Q.S.5.506: Comp. nhi+de/steros Hsch. (nh-, i)/s)
powerless, feeble, Id., Suid.
nh=i+s (B), i+dos, h(, = nha/s, Heraclid.Pol.30, Phot.

nh/i+stos, h, on, Sup., = nh/atos (v. ne/atos A), in form nh/i+sta: e)/sxata, katw/tata, Hsch.: hence perh. the name of the pu/lai *nh/i+stai at Thebes, pu/laisi *nhi/+sth|si (v.l. nhi/+th|si [-tisi, -taisi]) A.Th.460, cf. Stat. Theb.8.354; *nhi/+tais pu/lais E.Ph.1104 codd. (nh/i+i+, tai=s pu/lais Hsch.: perh. *nhi/+ttais pu/lais with -tt- from -st-).

nhi/+ths [i_], ou, o(,
of or
belonging to a ship, consisting of ships, n. strato/s a fleet, Th.2.24, 4.85; sto/los A.R.4.239, etc.

nh-kerdh/s, e/s,
without gain, unprofitable, nhkerde/a boulh/n Il.17.469; e)/pos nhkerde\s e)/eipes Od.14.509.

nh-ke/rws, wn,
not horned, Ep. nom. pl. nh/keroi, Hes.Op.529.

nh/-kestos, on, (nh-, a)ke/omai)
incurable, neut. as Adv.,
incurably, o(/s ke . . nh/keston a)asqh=| ib. 283.

nh-khdh/s, e/s,
careless, f.l. in Epic. ap. Pl.Smp.197c.

nh-kouste/w, (nh-, a)kou/w)
give no heed to, disobey, c. gen., ou)d' *)enosi/xqwn nhkou/sthse qea=s Il.20.14.

nh/-koustos, on, (nh-, a)kousto/s)
deaf, not hearing, Emp.137.3.
unheard, unknown, Arat.173.

nh/k-ths, ou, o(, (nh/xw)
swimmer, Poll.1.97; e)xqro\n a)ei\ nh/kth|si prob. in Philosteph.Hist.17.

nhk-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to swim, S.E.M.9.171; also n. te/xnh ibid.

nhk-to/s, h/, o/n,
swimming, opp. xersai=os, Arist. Mu.398b31, cf. Plu.2.636e; n. plh=qos i)xqu/wn Vett.Val.344.15, cf.AP 6.4 (Leon.); of a shield, ib.9.115; in air as well as water, Ph.1.14; to\ pthno\n kai\ pezo\n kai\ nhkto/n Gal.18(1).207; but to\ n.
power of swimming, Anacreont.24.5.
nhk-tri/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of nh/kths, n. e)lai/a Poll. 6.45; cf. kolumba/s.
nh/k-twr, oros, o(, = nh/kths, Man.4.397.

nhlegh/s, e/s, = a)nhlegh/s,
reckless, h)=tor Alcm.26 (dub. l.). Adv. -e/ws Hsch.
nhleh/s, e/s, v. nhlh/s; cf. a)nhleh/s.

nhlei=tis, idos, (nh-, a)lei/ths, a)litai/nw) fem. Adj.
guiltless, unoffending, gunai=kas . . , ai(/ te/ s' a)tima/zousi kai\ ai(\ nhlei/tide/s ei)si Od.16.317, 19.498, cf. 22.418. (nhlite/es, nhlhte/es are vv. ll.; Aristarch. interpr. a(martwloi/, poluama/rthtoi, from nh- intens.)

nhleo/-qu_mos, on,
of ruthless spirit, moi=ra IG3.1326, BKT5(1).87; *xa/rwn IG14.1648, cf. 2012 (Sulp. Max.).

nhleo/-poinos, on,
punishing ruthlessly, epith. of the *kh=res, Hes.Th.217.

*nhleu/s, e/ws, o(,
Neleus, father of Nestor, Il.11.683, al.:—Adj. *nhlh/i+os, ui(o/s 2.20:—Patron. *nhlei/+dhs, ou, Ep. a_o, o(, 23.652; Ep. *nhlhi+a/dhs, ew or a_o, 8.100, al.: in fem. *nhlhi/+s, i/+dos, A.R.1.120. *nhleu/s, e/ws, o(, = *nei/lews, founder of Miletus, IG12.94.4 (written *nel-), Call.Dian.226: hence *neilei/+dhs, and *neilhi+a/dhs, ou, Ep. a_o, o(, Alex.Aet.3.26, 1; cf. *neilei=on.

nh/leustos, on, (nh-, leu/ssw)
invisible, Theoc.Syrinx20.

nhlh/s, e/s, Ep. neut. nhlee/s; Ep. also nhleih/s, e/s, Hes.Th.770, h.Ven.245, A.R.4.476: (nh-, e)/leos):—poet. Adj. (in Prose sts. a)nhleh/s, q.v.)
pitiless, ruthless, Il.9.632; nhle/i+ xalkw=| with
ruthless blade, 3.292, al.; nhle/i+ desmw=| 10.443; n. qumo\n e)/xontes a
resolute or
dogged spirit, 19.229; nhle/i+ u(/pnw|
relentless sleep, which has exposed the sleeper to ill, Od.12.372; n. h)=mar, i.e. the day of death, Il.11.484, Od.9.17, etc.; n. h)=tor Il.9.497; nhle/a no/on *fa/larin Pi.P.1.95; nhleei= no/w| Id.Fr.177; n. su\ kai\ qra/sous ple/ws A.Pr.42; n . . . o(/stis i(kth=ras e)kqu/ei E.Cyc.369 (lyr.). Adv. -ew=s A.Pr.242; Ep. -eiw=s A.R. 2.626, IG5(1).733 (Sparta). Pass.,
unpitied, e)/keito nhlee\s . . sw=ma S.Ant.1197; nhle/a de\ ge/neqla . . kei=tai Id.OT180 (lyr.).

nhli/-pezos, on,
barefooted, Hsch.

nhli/-pous [i^], o(, h(, gen. podos,
unshod, barefooted, a)/sitos n. t' a)lwme/nh S.OC349 codd., cf. Max. Tyr. 30.6: nh/li^pos, on, A.R.3.646, Lyc.635, prob. l. for nh/lupos in Lyd. Mag.1.42; cf. a)nh/lipos. (Deriv. by Sch.Theoc.4.56 from nh-, h)=liy
without shoe.）

nh=ma, atos, to/, (ne/w B)
that which is spun, thread, yarn, Od.4.134, E. Or.1433 (lyr.), Pl.Plt.282e: pl., Od.2.98, 19.143;
thread of a spider's
web, Hes.Op.777; of the Fates, *moira/wn nh=m' a)/lluton Phanocl.2, cf. IG14.1188.11; ou)/pw peplh/rwtai to\ n. au)tou= his
destiny, Luc.Philops. 25; nh/mata shrika/ silk
sutures, Gal.10.942.

nhma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
woven, o(/plon, of a band of plaited rope or web-
bing, Ath.Mech.34.7.

nhma^t-w/dhs, es,
fibrous, in filaments, Plu.2.434a.

nhme/rt-eia, h(,
truth; Dor. na_me/rteia, used by S.Tr.173 in trim.

nhmert-h/s, e/s, Dor. na_merth/s (the only form used by Trag., A. Pers.246), (nh-, a(marta/nw)
unerring, infallible, ge/rwn a(/lios n., of Proteus, Od.4.349, etc.; n. te kai\ h)/pios, of Nereus, Hes.Th.235; ei)pei=n n. boulh/n a
sure decree, i.e. one
that will infallibly be put in force, Od.1.86,5.30; nhmerte/a ei)pei=n or muqh/sasqai to speak
sure truths, 3.19, Il.6.376; h)= ma/la tou=to e)/pos n. e)/eipes 3.204; pa/nta namerth= lo/gon A.l.c. (troch.); mu=qos, ba/cis, A.R.4.810, 1184: Sup. -e/statos Lyc.223: more freq. as Adv., nhmerte\s e)ni/spes Od.22.166; tw=n ge no/on n. a)ne/gnw 21.205; nhmerte\s u(po/sxeo Il.1.514: Ion. Adv. nhmerte/ws as trisyll., Od.5.98.

nhmhqh/s, e/s,
thoughtless, Ramsay
Studies in the Eastern Rom.Prov. p.123 (Phrygia).

nhnem-e/w,
to be still, of the bowels, dub. l. in Hp.Mul.2.113 (nhpelei= Gal. adloc.); of the weather, v.l. for a)nhn- in Str.7.3.18.

nhnem-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
stillness in the air, calm, nhnemi/hs
in a calm, Il.5.523; galh/nh e)/pleto nhnemi/h there was a calm,
a ceasing of all winds (the generic and specific words being in appos.), Od.5.392, 12.169; h)=n me\n dh\ n. Hdt.7.218; e)c ai)qri/hs te kai\ n. ib.188; opp. me/ga pneu=ma, Pl. Phd.77e; nhnemi/h|
in calm weather, Arat.1033, A.R.3.970: in pl., nhnemi/ai te kai\ galh=nai Pl.Tht.153c; e)n nhnemi/h|si galh/nhs Timo 64: c.gen., n. a)ne/mwn Epic. ap. Pl.Smp.197c (s.v.l.).

nh/nem-os, on, (nh-, a)/nemos)
without wind, calm, ai)qh/r Il.8.556, Ar.Th.43 (anap.); gala/na A.Ag.740 (lyr.); pe/lagos E.Hel.1456 (lyr.); ai)/qrh Ar.Av.778 (lyr.); nhne/mous e)/sxen ai)qh\r dro/mous Limen.8; e)n nhne/mois in
windless places, Thphr. HP1.8.1: Comp., dia\ to\ -w/teron ei)=nai Arist.Mete.373a24 (s.v.l.). metaph., n. e)/sths' o)/xlon E.Hec.533; n. e)/xein th\n yuxh/n Plu.2.589d.

nhnem-o/w,
make calm, Hsch. (Pass.).

nhne/w (prob. a corruption of nhe/w),
heap, v.l. in Il.23.139: also in compds. e)pi-, para-nhne/w.

nhni/a, h(,
public eulogy on great men, sometimes accompanied by the flute: hence,
lament, dirge, only in Lat.
nenia, a Gr. word acc. to Cic.Legg.2.24.62; cf. sq.
nhni/aton, to/, a Phrygian tune for the flute, Hippon.129.
nh=nis, v. nea=nis.

nhni/tai: ne/oi, Hsch. nhnuri/zonta: qrhnou=nta, lalou=nta, Id. nhci/pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
webfooted, gloss on ne/podes, Id.

nh=cis, ews, h(, (nh/xw)
swimming, Batr.68, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.27: pl., Batr.149, Plu.2.1091c, Sor.1.56.
nho-ba/ths [a^], ou, o(, poet. for nauba/ths, AP7.668 (Leon.).
nho-ko/ros, on, (nho/s) poet. for newko/ros, ib.9.22 (Phil.).
nho-po/los, v. naopo/los.

nho-pore/w, poet. for *naupore/w,
go by sea, AP7.675 (Leon.).

nho/s, o(, Ion. for nao/s,
temple. nho/s, Ion. gen. of nau=s.

nhoso/os, poet. nhosso/os, on,
protecting ships, *)/artemis, *)apo/llwn, A.R.1.570, 2.927.

nho-fqo/ros, on,
destroying ships, Nonn.D.39.122.

nho-fo/ros, on,
bearing ships, nw=ta AP10.16.8 (Theaet.).

nh/oxos, on,
guiding ships, phda/lia AP7.636 (Crin.).
nh-pa^qh/s, e/s, = nhpenqh/s, Opp.C.2.417.
nh/-paustos, on, (nh-, pau/w) = a)/paustos: neut. as Adv., nh/pauston ai)a/zousa Lyc.972.
nhpeda^no/s, h/, o/n, = h)pedano/s, Opp.C.3.409; cf. nh/dumos, h(/dumos.

nh-pekth/s, e/s,
with hair uncombed, dishevelled, Hsch.

nh/-pektos, on,
with uncarded wool, kw/ea nhpe/ktwn o)i/+wn Epic.Alex.Adesp.2.30.

nh-pele/w,
to be powerless, Hp. ap. Gal.19.124: hence restored in Id.Mul.2.113; cf. kakhpele/wn, eu)hpelh/s.

nh-penqh/s, e/s, (pe/nqos)
banishing pain and sorrow, epith. of Apollo, AP9.525.14; fa/rmakon n., an Egyptian drug, Od.4.221, cf. Thphr.HP9.15.1.
free from sorrow: Adv. -e/ws Protag.9.

nh-peuqh/s, e/s,
unsearchable, Orac. ap. Macr.Sat.1.18.20.
nhpi^-a/as, v. nhpie/h.

nhpi^-a/zw,
to be as a babe, childish, Erinn.in PSI9.1090.55 + 15 (p.xii), Hp.Ep.17, 1 Ep.Cor.14.20, Porph.Gaur.12.4.

nhpi^-a^xeu/w,
to be childish, play like a child, Il.22.502:—Med., Rh.Mus.1879.195 (Rome).

nhpi^/-a^xos, on, Ep. Dim. of nh/pios,
childish, infantine, Il.2.338, 6.408, 16.262, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.36.13 (Mesom.(?)); *)/erws Bion Fr.7.2; nhpi/axa frone/wn Opp.H.5.403; of animals, Id.C. 1.444, al.: as Subst. nhpi/axos, o(,
child, IG12(7).445 (Amorgos), Opp. C.3.211.
nhpi^-a/xw [a^], = nhpiaxeu/w, A.R.4.868, Mosch.4.22, Opp.C. 2.343.

nhpi^-a^xw/dhs, es,
childish, Gloss.

nhpi^-e/h, h(, Ep. form for *nhpii/h, (nh/pios)
childhood, childishness, oi)/nou a)poblu/zwn e)n nhpie/h| a)legeinh=| Il.9.491: in pl., ou)de/ ti/ se xrh\ nhpia/as (for *nhpii/as) o)xe/ein Od.1.297; e)pei\ . . poih/sh| a)qu/rmata nhpie/h|sin
in childish fashion, Il.15.363; h(gh/sato nhpie/h|si led them
in his folly, Od.24.469.
nhpi^/-eos, a, on, = nh/pios, xei=ra . . . nhpie/hn Opp.H.3.585.
nhpi^-eu/omai, = nhpiaxeu/w, Sch.D Il.22.503.

nhpi^okto/nos, on,
slaying children, dia/tagma LXXWi.11.7.

nh/pi^os, a (Sor.1.7, al.), Ion. h, on, also os, on Lyc.638:—
infant, child, freq. in Hom., nh/pion, ou)/ pw ei)do/q' o(moii/ou pole/moio Il.9.440; nh/pia te/kna 2.136, etc.; bre/fos e)/t' o)/nta n. E.Ion1399, cf. Andr.755, etc.; nhpi/ous e)/ti Id.Heracl.956; to\ n. Pl.Ax.366d; a(rmo/ttousa toi=s n. [platagh/] Arist.Pol.1340b30; e)k nhpi/ou from
a child, from
infancy, [to\ h(du\] e)k n. h(mi=n sunte/qraptai Id.EN1105a2; e)k nhpi/wn Plb.4.20.8; e)k n. h(liki/as PFlor.36.5 (iv A.D.);
infant in law,
minor, e)f' o(/son o( klhrono/mos n. e)stin Ep.Gal.4.1; of children up to puberty, ai( tw=n n. e)kla/myies Hp.Epid.6.1.4 (cf. Herophil. ap. Gal.17(1).826); but of the foetus in its early stage, Hp.Aph.4.1 (cf. Gal.17(1).653). less freq. of animals, Il.2.311, 11.113; nh/pia alone,
the young of an animal, 17.134. of plants, Thphr.HP8.1.7. metaph., of the understanding,
childish, silly, Od.13.237; me/ga n. Il.16.46, cf. Od.9.44; simply,
without foresight, blind, Il.22.445; a)nh\r n. Heraclit.79, cf. Emp.11.1, Pi.P.3.82, A.Pr.443, Democr.76, etc.; n. o(\s . . gone/wn e)pila/qetai S.El.145 (lyr.); ou)/te pri\n nh/pion, nu=n t' . . me/gan no
child before and now full-grown (i.e. in mind), Id.OT 652 (lyr.); of words, nh/pia ba/zeis Pi.Fr.157; a)ntitei/nein nh/pi' a)nti\ nhpi/wn E.Med.891; mhde\n ei)/ph|s n. Ar.Nu.105. of bodily strength,
like that of a child, bi/h de/ te n. au)tw=n Il.11.561.

nhpi^o/-ths, htos, h(,
childhood, infancy, Arist.Pr.896b6.
childishness, Pl.Lg.808e, J.AJ1.19.3, 2.9.7; n. frenw=n Luc.Halc. 3.

nhpi^o-trofe/w,
nurse, tend children, Sor.1.88.

nhpi^o-frosu/nh, h(,
childishness, thoughtlessness, Eust.1418.60 (pl.).

nhpi^o/-frwn, onos, o(, h(,
of childish mind, silly, Str.1.2.8.

nh/plektos, on,
with unbraided hair, Bion 1.21.

nh/plu^tos, on,
unwashed, cj. in Anacr.21.6.
nh/podes: i)xqu/es, Hsch.; cf. ne/pous.

nhpoinei/, Adv. of sq.,
with impunity, esp. in phrase nhpoinei\ teqna/nai, SIG194.10 (Amphipolis, iv B.C.), Lexap.And.1.95, Lexap.D.23.60, cf. Pl.Lg.874c; n. a)poktei/nein (v.l. nh/poina) X.Hier.3.3.

nh/poinos, on, (nh-, poinh/)
unavenged, without compensation, Hom. (only in Od.), nh/poinoi/ ken o)/loisqe 1.380, 2.145; a)llo/trion bi/oton nh/poinon e)/dousin 1.160; a)ndro\s e(no\s bi/oton nh/poinon o)le/sqai ib.377, cf. 18.280; also nh/poina (as Adv.) a)poktei/nein (v.l. for nhpoinei/) X. Hier.3.3. futw=n na/poinos (nh/- codd.), like a)/moiros,
without share of, unblest with fruitful trees, Pi.P.9.58.
nh/podes: a)nupode/tous, Hsch. (leg. nh<li/>p-).

nh/p-ths, ou, o(, (nh/fw)
sober, discreet, Plb.10.3.1, D.S.30.3, 33.21a, Onos.1.1, Ptol.Tetr.160.

nhp-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
sober, Com.Adesp.1088 (Sup.), Plu.2.709b, Vett.Val.242.18; nhp-kwta/thn: nh/fein poiou=san, Hsch. Adv. nhp-kw=s Vett.Val.179.6, al.
nhpu^qh/s, e/s, = nhpeuqh/s, Hsch.

nh/pustos, on,
not heard, not learnt, Nonn.D.11.199.
nhpu/ta: bohta/: kh/ruc mikro/fwnos, Hsch.; cf. h)pu/ta.

nhpu^ti/-a, h(,
infancy, e)ce/ti nhputi/hs A.R.4.791.

nhpu^ti-eu/omai,
play child's tricks, AP11.140 (Lucill.).

nhpu^/ti-os, o(, Ep. Dim. of nh/pios,
little child, mhke/ti tau=ta legw/meqa nhpu/tioi w(/s Il.13.292; nhpu/tion w(/s 20.200; once in Ar., n. ga/r e)st' e)/ti Nu.868. as Adj.,
childish, e)pe/essi/ ge nhputi/oisin Il.20.211;
foolish, [brotoi/] Orph.L.6.

nhrei/ths or nhri/ths [i_], ou, o(, name for several kinds of
sea-snails, Arist.HA530a12, 535a19, 547b23, PA679b20.

*nhr-eu/s, e/ws, Ion. h=os, o(,
Nereus, h.Ap.319, Hes.Th.240, Alc.Supp. 8.7, etc.
sea, *li/bus, *)/aray N., Nonn.D.25.51, 32.194.

*nh/r-eios, a, on, Adj.
of Nereus, *nh/reia te/kna, i.e. fishes, Euphro 8.2; cf. nhro/s. *nh/reion, to/, = delfi/nion, Ps.-Dsc.3.73:—also *nhreia/dion, ibid.

*nhrhi/+s or *nhrei/+s, i/+dos, h(,
daughter of Nereus, sea-nymph (opp. *nai+a/s,
spring-nymph): mostly in pl. *nhrhi/+des, Il.18.38, Pi.P.11.2; title of play by Anaxandrides, Ath.11.482c; *nhrei/+des Alc.Supp.8.11, Pi.I.（6）5.6, Q.S.2.436, title of play by Aeschylus; Att. *nhrh=|des A.Fr.174, S.OC719 (lyr.), E.Andr.1267, etc.; they were fifty in number, Hes.Th.264, Pi.I.6(5).6; their names are given, Il.18.39sqq., Hes.Th.243 sqq.: rare in sg., gen. *nhrhi/+dos S.Fr.546, Alc. Com.4.

nh/riqmos, on, = a)na/riqmos,
countless, Theoc.25.57, Lyc.415.

nh/rion, to/,
oleander, Nerium Oleander, = r(odo/dendron, Dsc.4.81, dub. in CIG3641b20 (Lampsacus).

nh=ris, ios, h(, = bra/qu, Nic.Th.531. f.l. for puri=tis, Dsc.1.9.
hollow rock, cavern, Hsch. (pl.).
nhri/tai: mega/loi, Hsch. nhri/ths, v. nhrei/ths.
nhri^to/mu_qos, on, = polu/muqos, Id.

nh/ri^tos, on, = nh/riqmos,
countless, immense, n. u(/lh Hes.Op.511: hence as pr. n. of mountain in Ithaca, *nh/riton ei)nosi/fullon Il.2.632, Od.9.22; n. tau/rwn i)/xnia A.R.3.1288.

nhri_totro/fos, on, (nhri/ths)
breeding sea-snails, nh=soi A.Fr.285.
nhri^to/fullos, on, = polu/fullos, Hsch.

nhro/s, a/, o/n, of fish, = nearo/s,
fresh, PCair.Zen.616 (iii B.C.), Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.63; cf. h(mi/nhros. nhro/n, to/, or nhro/s, o(,
water, OGI201.21 (Nubia, vi A.D.), cf. Phryn.29; acc. sg. written to\n niro/n PSI3.165.3 (vi A.D.); cf. Mod.Gr. nero/. f.l. for neiro/s in Lyc.896, glossed ka/qugros, Suid.s.v. nhri/ths (interpol.), but tapeino/s, Hsch.
nh=s, Adv., = e)/nhs (v. e)/nos B), Hsch.: Dor. na=s (prob.), Id.

nhsai=os, a, Ion. h, on,
insular, xw/ra, po/lis, E.Tr.188 (lyr.), Ion 1583; o)/rniqes Arat.982; porqmo/s AP9.242 (Antiphil.).

nhseu/omai,
form alluvial deposits, EM25.48.
*nhsia/deia, ta/, festival at Delos, Inscr.Délos366 A134 (iii B.C.):— sg. *nh/r-eion, to/, name of a fund, ib.290.139 (iii B.C.).

nhsi-a/zw, = nhsi/zw 1, Str.1.3.18, Ph.1.622; a)/kra nhsia/zousa
peninsular, Stad.202.

nhsi-arxe/w,
to be governor of an island or
group of islands, CIG3655.7 (Cyzicus).

nhsi-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
governor of an island or
islands, Antiph.190.14, Plu.2.823d.
nhsi/-arxos, o(, = foreg., IG11(4).559 (Delos, iii B.C.), 1126 (ii B.C.), Inscr.Délos 442B71 (ii B.C.); of Tiberius at Capreae, D.C.58.5.
nhsi-a/s, a/dos, h(, = nhsi/s, in pl., D.P.570 (s.v.l.).
nhsi/gda, a kind of dish, Philem.52.

nhs-i/dion, to/, Dim. of nh=sos,
islet, Th.6.2, Arist.Mir.832a24, Str. 2.5.30.

nhs-i/zw,
to be or
form an island, Plb.3.42.7, 5.46.9.
to be peninsular, Peripl.M.Eux.58.

nhs-i/on, to/, Dim. of nh=sos,
islet, Str.2.5.23, 3.3.1.

nh=sis (A), ews, h(, (ne/w B)
spinning, Pl.R.620e.

nh=sis (B), ews, h(, (ne/w C)
accumulation, Hp.Loc.Hom.20 codd. (fort. i)/nhsis).

nhs-i/s, i=dos, h(, Dim. of nh=sos,
islet, Hdt.8.76, 95, Th.8.14, Plb. 16.2.8, Str.1.3.18, Plu.Oth.10. [i_ Call.Fr.524, Lyc.599, AP6.89 (Maec.), 9.413 (Antiphil.), D.P.479, etc.]

nhs-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, (nh=sos)
of, from, or
belonging to an island, St.Byz.:—Dor. fem. na_si=tis, idos, gh= PEleph.20.48 (iii B.C.); spila/s AP7.2 (Antip. Sid.).

nhsiw/t-hs, Dor. na_siwta_s, ou, o(, fem. -w=tis, idos,
islander, Pi.P. 10.47, Hdt.1.27, 143, Ar.Pax298, Th.5.97, etc. metaph., of a
swimmer, Tim.Pers.44. as Adj.,
insular, lao\s nasiw/tas Pi.P. 9.55; n. bi/os E.Heracl.84; nhsiw/tides po/leis
insular cities, Hdt.7.22; nhsiw=tis pe/tra an
island rock, A.Pers.390; e(sti/a S.Tr.658 (lyr.): also with a neut. Subst., nhsiw/th| meiraki/w| Luc.Dom.3. epith. of Apollo in Locris, BCH46.446; of Dionysus, Ath.Mitt.29.169 (Pergam.).

nhsiwt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
from an island, e)/qnea Hdt.7.80; do/moi E.Andr.1261; o)/noma nhsiwtiko\n *salami=na qe/menon having given it the
island name of Salamis, Id.Hel.149; n. cenu/dria Men.462.3; to\ n.
insular situation, Th.7.57; klhth\r n. a summoner
of the islanders, Ar.Av.1422.

nhso-ba^si/leia [i^], h(,
queen of the islands, of Aphrodite,
Cat.Cod. Astr.1.173.

nhso-eidh/s, e/s,
like an island, Str.3.1.7.

nhso-ma^xi/a, h(,
island-fight, Luc.VH1.42.

nhso/omai, Pass., (nh=sos)
become an island, App.(?) Gall. (postFr. 21).

nhso-poie/w,
insulate, Oenom. ap. Eus.PE5.26:—Pass., Ptol.Geog. 4.7.7.

nhso/-polis, ews, h(,
island-city, Isid.Char.1.

nh=sos, Dor. na=sos, h(,
island, Il.2.721, etc.; e)n ta=| mega/la| *dwri/di na/sw| *pe/lopos, i.e. the Peloponnese, S.OC696; maka/rwn nh=soi, v. ma/kar; ai( n.
the islands of the Archipelago, Ar.Eq.1319, X.HG4.8.1; kai\ pw=s gunh\ . . nh=son a)mfie/nnutai; Anaxil.35 (cf. peri/nhsos): heterocl. gen. pl. nhsa/wn Call.Del.66.
land flooded by the Nile, PHib. 1.90.7 (iii B.C.), etc.; opp. h)/peiros, PGiss.60 (ii A.D.); nh=soi potamofo/rhtoi POxy.1445.13 (ii A.D.); so of
alluvial land in Tab.Heracl. 1.38.

nhsofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
island-guard, D.S.3.39.
nh=ssa, v. nh=tta.

nhssi/on, to/, Dim. of nh=ssa,
PLond.ined.2181 (vi/vii A.D.).

nhssotrofei=on, to/,
place where ducks are kept, Varro RR3.11.1, Colum.8.15.1.

nhst-ei/a, h(,
fast, nhstei=ai kai\ o(rtai/ Hdt.4.186, cf. LXXIs.1.13, Str. 16.2.40, Act.Ap.27.9; nhstei/hn fe/rein Hp.Aph.1.13; nhstei/as o)/zein (cf. nh=stis 1.2) Arist.Pr.908b12; at Athens, name for the third day of the Thesmophoria, Ath.7.307f, Alciphr.3.39, cf. PCair.Zen.350.5 (iii B.C.).
nh/st-eira, h(, fem. of nh/sths 1, as Adj., Nic.Al.130, f.l. in Id.Th.862.

nhst-eu/w,
fast, Ar.Av.1519, Th.949, Ev.Matt.6.16, etc.; nhsteu/santes, opp. e)dhdoko/tes, Arist.PA676a1. c. gen.,
abstain from, kako/thtos Emp.144.

nh/st-hs, ou, o(,
one who is fasting, on an empty stomach, Semon.38, Arist.Fr.232, Matro Conv.10; tau=ta nh/sth| di/dou piei=n POxy.1088.44 (i A.D.), cf. SIG1171.9 (Lebena), PLit.Lond. 171 (iii A.D.). =
staminarius, Gloss.

nhst-iko/s, h/, o/n, (ne/w B)
of or
for spinning: nhstikh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
the art of spinning, Pl. Plt.282a. (nh=stis)
for use on fastdays, ga/ron Aët.16.131 (141).

nh/st-i^mos, on,
of abstinence, e(bdoma/des PFlor.384.55 (i A.D.).

nh=stis, gen. ios or idos, o( and h( (v. infr.); also dat. nh/stei Hp. Acut.60: pl. nh/steis Antiph.138, D.H.Rh.9.16: (nh-, e)/dw):—
not eating, fasting, of persons, a)nw/goimi ptolemi/zein ui(=as *)axaiw=n nh/stias, a)kmh/nous Il.19.207; nh/sties a)/xri . . kne/faos Od.18.370, cf. Diocl.Fr.43, Ev.Matt.15.32, etc.; nh/stisin e)piqe/ntes oi( pole/mioi Onos.12.1: c. gen., nh=stis bora=s E.IT973: metaph., nh=stin a)na\ . . ya/mman over the
hungry sand, A.Pr.573 (lyr.). with an abstract Subst., freq. in A., nh=stin no/son
famine, Ag. 1016 (lyr.); n. limo/s Ch.250; nh/stisin ai)ki/ais the pains
of hunger, Pr.599 (lyr.); nh/stides du/ai Ag.1621; also nh=stis o)smh/ the bad breath
of one fasting, Phryn.PSp.91 B. Act.,
causing hunger, starving, pnoai\ nh/stides A.Ag.193 (lyr.). as Subst., nh=stis, h(, acc. nh=stin Ar.Fr.318.3, 506.4, Eub.110. the
intestinum jejunum, from its always being found empty, Hp.Carn. 19, Ar.Fr.506.4, Eub.63.5 (anap.), cf. Arist.PA675b33. n. kestreu/s, fish so called because its stomach was always found empty, Ar.Fr.156, etc.: hence in Com., of 'empty bellies', e)gw\ de\ kestreu\s nh=stis oi)/kad' a)potre/xw Alex.256, etc., cf. Ath.7.307d. *nh=stis, h(, = u(/dwr, Emp.6.3, cf. Alex.322.

nhsto-posi/a, h(,
drinking on an empty stomach, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.27.12.

nhsto-pote/w,
drink fasting, in Pass., ib.16.

nhsto/s, h/, o/n, (ne/w B),
spun, LXXEx.31.4.
nhsu/drion, to/, Dim. of nh=sos, X.HG6.1.12, Isoc.5.145, etc.
nh/suris, = sfondu/lion, Ps.-Dsc.3.76.
nh/tea: a)nh/nuta, Hsch. nh/th, h(, v. nea/th.

nh/ti_tos, on, (nh-, ti/nw)
unavenged, IG14.1389ii33.

nhtoeidh/s, e/s,
akin to the nh/th, Nic.Harm.11; to/nos -e/steros ib.5.

nhto/s, h/, o/n, (ne/w C)
heaped, piled up, o(/qi nhto\s xruso\s kai\ xalko\s e)/keito Od.2.338.
nhtrekh/s, e/s, = a)trekh/s. Adv. -kw=s, = a)trekw=s, Lyc.1.

nh=tron, to/, (ne/w B)
spindle, Suid.

nh=tta, Ep. and Ion. nh=ssa Hdt.2.77, Arat.918, Boeot. na=ssa Ar. Ach.875, h(:—
duck, Hdt.l.c., Ar.Av.566, etc.; nh=tta a)rgura= IG22. 1436.53. (From
[nmacrnull]-tyă, cf. Skt.
ātis 'water-fowl', Lat.
anas, anat-is, Lith.
ántis 'duck', etc.)

nhtt-a/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of foreg.,
duckling, used as a term of endearment, Ar.Pl.1011, Men.1041.
nhtt-i/on, to/, = foreg., Nicostr. Com.6.

nhtto-fo/nos, o(,
duck-killer, a kind of eagle,
Aquila naevia, Arist. HA618b25.

nhtto-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
duck-watcher, Gloss.
nhu=s, h(, v. nau=s.
nhusipe/rhtos, on, v. nausipe/ratos.

nh/u+tmos, on, (nh-, a)u+tmh/)
breathless, Hes.Th.795.
nhfai/nw, = nh/fw, etym. of nhfanto/s, Eust.1306.51.

nhfa^l-e/os, a, on, = nhfa/lios, Hdn.Gr.2.908, al.; = sw/frwn, Suid., cf. Max.Tyr.9.3, Agath.2.3, Sch.Il.23.398 (Sup.). Adv. -e/ws
sanely, cuntele/sai do/mon Aret.SD1.6.
nhfa^l-eo/ths, htos, h(, = sq., Gloss.

nhfa^l-e/wsis, ews, h(,
sobriety, Et.Gud.409.58.
nhfa^l-ieu/s, e/ws, o(, = nhfa/lios, AP9.525.14.

nhfa^l-ieu/w,
make a libation without wine, Poll.6.26.

nhfa^l-i/zw,
purify by a libation without wine, Hsch. (Pass.).
nhfa^/l-imos, on, = sq., Orac. ap. Phleg.Fr.36.10 J.

nhfa^/l-ios, a, on, also os, on 1 Ep.Ti.3.11, Plu. 2.657c: (nh/fw):—of drink,
unmixed with wine, n. meili/gmata offerings of water, milk, and honey to the Eumenides, A.Eu.107; to the Muses and Nymphs, krath\r nhfa/lios Plu.2.156d; nhfa/liai eu)xwlai/, qusi/ai, A.R.4.712, Polem.Hist.42; n. bwmoi/ IG2.1651 (iv B.C.); nhfa/lia kai\ meli/sponda qu/ein Plu.2.464c, 672b; tw=| *dionu/sw| polla/kis n. qu/omen ib. 132e (prov. of a frugal meal); n. spei/sw *ku/pridi AP5.225 (Paul. Sil.); n. cu/la wood
other than vine twigs, burned in sacrifices, esp. the twigs of the herb qu/mos, Philoch.31, Crates Hist.5; n. po/panon
with no wine in it, IG3.77.18.
sober, n. me/qh Ph.1.16, 2.447; baqu\ h( sigh\ kai\ nhfa/lion, h( de\ me/qh la/lon Plu.2.504a; of persons, 1 Ep.Ti.3.2,11, Ep.Tit.2.2, J.AJ13.12.2. Adv. -i/ws, n. e)/xein Poll.6.26.

nhfa^l-ismo/s, o(, metaph.,
soberness, Suid.
nh/fa^l-os, = nhfa/lios, Orac. ap. Phleg.Fr. 36.10 J.

nhfan-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
sobering, Pl.Phlb.61c. = nhfa/lios, zw=|on, of the bee, Porph.Antr.19.
nhfan-to/s, h/, o/n, = nhfa/lios, Eust.1306.52, misquoting Ath.10.423b.

nh/frwn, onos, o(, h(,
foolish, Claudian.Gig.2.23.

nh/fw, Dor. na/fw (v. infr. II), used by early writers only in pres., mostly in part.: later impf. e)/nhfon Chor. in Rev.Phil.1877.67: aor. e)/nhya IEp.Pet.4.7, Orac. ap. Ael.Fr.103, J.AJ11.3.3, Procl. in Prm. p.741 S., (e)c-) Aret.SD1.5, (a)n-) Nic.Dam.4 J.:—
to be sober, drink no wine, ou)/te ti ga\r n. ou)/te li/hn mequ/w Thgn.478; nh/fein Archil.4, Pl. Smp.213e, al.: part. nh/fwn as Adj., = nhfa/lios, Hdt.1.133, Ar.Lys. 1228; u(mi=n a)nte/kursa . . nh/fwn a)oi/nois S.OC100; u(p' e)xqrou= nh/fontos u(brizo/mhn D.21.74; to\ tou\s mequ/ontas . . . plei/w zhmi/an a)poti/nein tw=n n. Lex Pittaciap. Arist.Pol.1274b20; mequ/onta . . para\ nhfo/ntwn lo/gous paraba/llein Pl.Smp.214c; n. qeo/s, i.e. water, Id.Lg.773d: prov., to\ e)n th=| kardi/a| tou= nh/fontos e)pi\ th=s glw/tths tou= mequ/ontos Plu.2.503f; [*)anacago/ras] oi(=on n. e(fa/nh par' ei)kh=| le/gontas Arist. Metaph.984b17; nh/fwn mequ/onta u(po\ th=s *)afrodi/ths qea=tai X.Smp.8.21; to\ nh=fon u(po\ tou= pa/qous buqi/zetai Alciphr.1.13. metaph.,
to be self-controlled, Pl.Lg.918d;
to be sober and wary, na=fe kai\ me/mnas' a)pistei=n Epich.[250]; grhgorw=men kai\ nh/fwmen 1 Ep.Thess.5.6; nh/yate ei)s proseuxa/s 1 Ep.Pet.l.c.; nh/fwn kai\ pefrontikw/s Plu. 2.800b; n. kai\ frontisth/s Gal.17(1).991; promhqh/s te kai\ n. Hdn.2.15.1; kardi/h| nh/fontos Poet. ap. Longin.34.4; n. logismo/s Epicur.Ep. 3p.64U. n. e)k kakou=
recover oneself from . . , Ach.Tat.1.13; e)gerqe/ntwn kai\ nhya/ntwn a)po\ th=s ptw/sews Procl.l.c.

nh/fwn, onos, o(, h(,
sober: nom. pl. nh/fones (expld. by nh/fontes) Hsch.: dat. nh/fosi Thgn.481, 627.
nhxa^le/os, a, on, = nhkto/s, fu/sis Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.1, cf.12.

nhxei=on, to/,
swimming-place, Gloss.
nh/xi, Adv., (nh/) = nai/xi, Hsch.

nh/xu^tos, on, (nh-, xe/w)
full-flowing, u(/dwr Philet.21, A.R.3.530; a(/lmh Id.4.1367; eu)rw/s Call.Fr.313; i(drw/s Nic.Al.587; a)h/r Q.S.1.417; n. o)/rphc a
juicy sapling, Nic.Th.33. (Prob. formed on the supposition that nh- had an intens. force.)

nh/xw, Dor. na/xw (pros-, q.v.):—
swim, nhxe/menai memaw/s Od.5.375; nh=xe ib.399; nh=xon pa/lin 7.280; nh=xon e)p' a)/kron u(/dwr Hes.Sc. 317; nh/xei Nic.Al.590:—mostly Med. nh/xomai, part. nhxo/menos Od. 7.276, 14.352, Hes.Sc.211; inf. nh/xesqai Democr.172: poet. impf. nh/xonto Titanomach.4 (cj. for -ontes): fut. nh/comai Od.5.364, Timo 32: aor. e)nh/cato Lyc.76; part. nhcame/nh AP9.36 (Secund.): the Med. forms alone used in later Prose, Plb.3.84.9, 5.48.9, Plu.2.1063b, Luc.Dom.1, Ael.NA3.11, and in compds. (fut. nh/cw f.l. in Ael.NA9.25).

nh=yis, ews, h(, (nh/fw)
sobriety, Plb.16.21.4, Str.7.3.11, Ph.1.377, etc.
nhw=n, Ion. gen. pl. of nau=s.
nhwpoiei=on, to/, = newpoiei=on, Milet.7.60.

nibatismo/s, o(,
a Phrygian dance, Ath.14.629d, Hsch.
ni/gla: tro/paia (Pers.), Hsch.
nigla^r-eu/w, = tereti/zw, Eup.110.

ni/gla^r-os, o(,
whistle (the sound), Ar.Ach.554 (pl.): in pl.,
trills, quavers, Pherecr.145.27, prob. in Phryn.Com.69, cf. Hsch., Phot.s.v. niglareu/wn.
ni/des: ai)doi=a h)\ o)rxi/dia paidi/wn, Phot.; Sicel word, acc. to Suid.; nii/des Hsch.

ni/zw, Epich. [273]; imper. ni/ze Il.11.830; inf. ni/zein Od.19.374; part. ni/zwn Il.7.425, E.IT1338: Ep. impf. ni/zon Od.1.112, Il.11.846:— the pres. ni/ptw, analogically formed from ni/yw e)/niya, first in Men. Mon.543, cf. Luc.Epigr.19, Arr.Epict.1.19.5, Ev.Jo.13.5, Plu.Thes. 10, though Hp. uses Med. ni/ptomai Mul.1.57 (but dia-nize/sqw ib.84,
peri-nize/sqw ib.2.158): fut. ni/yw Od.19.376, E.IT255: aor. e)/niya Id.Sthen.Prol.25; Ep. ni/ya Od.19.505:—Med., ni/zomai Hp. (v. supr.): impf. ni/zeto Od.6.224: fut. ni/yomai (v. a)po-, e)k-ni/zw), late nifh/somai LXXLe.15.12: aor. e)niya/mhn; Ep. 3sg. ni/yato Il.16.230: pf. ne/nimmai (v. infr.): aor. Pass. e)ni/fqhn （kat-) Hp.Prorrh.2.23:—
wash the hands or
feet (v. sub fin.), ni/ze d' a)/r' a)=sson i)ou=sa a)/naxq' e(o/n Od.19.392; au)ta\r e)pei\ ni/yen ib.505, cf. 358; tw=| se po/das ni/yw ib.376, cf. Orac. ap. Hdt.6.19; a( de\ xei\r ta\n xei=ra ni/zei Epich. l.c.:—Med., ni/yato d' au)to\s xei=ras Il.16.230, cf. Hes.Op.739; ni/yasqai, abs.,
to wash one's hands, Od.1.138, etc.; xei=ras ni/yasqai a(lo/s [with water]
from the sea, 2.261 (v. infr. 11); ni/yasqai li/mnhs po/da Hes.Fr.122; ou)/rw| niya/menos tou\s o)fqalmou/s Hdt.2.111. generally,
purge, cleanse, ni/yai kaqarmw=| S.OT1228, cf. E.IT1191.
wash off, e)pei/ sfin ku=ma qala/sshs i(drw= . . ni/yen a)po\ xrwto/s Il.10.575; a)p' au)tou= d' ai(=ma kelaino\n ni/z' u(/dati liarw=| 11.830, 846; fo/non e)mh=s e)/niye xeiro/s E.Sthen.l.c.:—Pass., ai(=ma ne/niptai Il.24.419:—Med., e)k potamou= xro/a ni/zeto a(/lmhn
he washed the brine
off his skin [with water] from the river, Od.6.224.—Commonly used of
washing part of the person, while lou/omai is used of
bathing, plu/nw of
washing clothes, etc.; but ni/zw is sts. used of things, spo/ggoisi . . trape/zas ni/zon Od.1.112; [de/pas] e)/niy' u(/datos kalh=|si r(oh=|si Il.16.229; u(/dati ni/zein . . pli/nqon Theoc.16.62.—Att. Prose writers use the word only in compds., v. a)po-, e)napo-, e)k-ni/zw. (Cf. OIr.
nigid, Skt.
nénekti 'wash',
niktá- 'washed', Gr. a)-nipto/-podes, xe/rniba, I.-E.
nig[uglide]-.)

ni_k-a/dion, to/, Dim. of ni/kh,
small figure of Victory (spelt neik-), CIG4558 (Acre), OGI426.5 (Haurân, i A.D.).

ni_/k-a_qron, to/,
thankoffering for victory, IG5 (1).267 (Sparta).

ni_k-ai=os, a, on, (ni/kh)
of or
belonging to victory, qeo/s J.AJ3.2.5; *zeu\s N., =
Juppiter Victor, D.C. 47.40; e)lpi/s Nonn.D.18.169; *pa/llas n., as
the giver of victory, ib. 37.623: nikai/hn, Ion. for ni/khn, Phot., Suid.
ni_k-acw=, Dor. fut. of nika/w.

nika/rion, to/, name of an
eye-salve, Alex.Trall.2.
ni/kastron: nikhth/rion, Phot.; ni/kestron, Hsch.
ni_ka_th/r, v. nikhth/r.

*ni_ka_to/reion, to/,
tomb and temple of Seleucus I, App.Syr.63.

ni_ka/twr [a_], oros, o(, Dor. for nikh/twr,
conqueror, cult-name of Seleucus I and Demetrius, kings of Syria, OGI233, Plu.Arist.6 (pl.), etc.; *se/leukos *zeu\s *nika/twr OGI245.11. in pl. n., oi(,
the evervictorious, epith. of the royal Macedonian bodyguard, Liv.43.19.
nikafori/a, ni_k-fo/ros, Dor. for nikhf-.

ni_ka/w, Ion. nike/w Democr.249, Herod.1.51, also GDI1413.16 (Aetol.), SIG265.4 (Delph., iv B.C.), v.l. in Apoc.2.7; Aeol. ni/khmi Theoc.7.40, AP7.743 (Antip.); also in impf. ni/kh cj. in Pi.N.5.5, cf. Theoc.6.46: Ep. impf. 1pl. nika/skomen Od.11.512: fut. -h/sw, later -h/somai Hierocl.Facet.205; Dor. 2sg. nikach=| v.l. in Theoc.21.32: pf. neni/khka, etc.: (ni/kh): abs.,
conquer, prevail in battle, in the games, or in any contest, Il.3.439, etc.; o( nikh/sas the
conqueror, ib. 138, X.Smp.5.9, etc.; o( nikhqei/s the
conquered, Il.23.656,663; e)ni/khsa kai\ deu/teros kai\ te/tartos e)geno/mhn I
won the first prize [at Olympia], etc., Th.6.16, cf. Isoc.16.33: pres.freq. in sense,
to be (or
be proclaimed) conqueror, Pi.O.9.112, 13.30, cf. X.Cyr.8.2.27, An.2.1.1; nika=n pa=si toi=s kritai=s or e(ni\ krith=| in their opinion, Ar.Av.445, 447; polu\ n.
win a decisive
victory, Th.7.34, etc.; ta\ pa/nta n. X.An. l.c.: freq. c. dat. modi, pugmh=|
in boxing, Il.23.669; naumaxi/h| Hdt.7.10.b'; i(/ppw| Id.6.122; ma/xh| E.Ph.1143, etc.; i(/ppw| h)\ sunwri/di h)\ zeu/gei Pl.Ap.36d; lampa/di And.4.42, etc.: c. acc. cogn. in same sense, pa/nta e)ni/ka he
won all the bouts, Il.4.389, 5.807; ta\ kou=fa, ta\ mei/zonan., E.Alc.1029, 1031; tw=n palaisma/twn e(\n n. Pl.Phdr.256b; a(/rma n. Pi.I.4(3).25; pagkra/tion Th.5.49; naumaxi/an, ma/xas, Id.7.66, Isoc.12.257, etc.: freq. n. *)olu/mpia
to be conqueror in the Olympian games, Th.1.126; tw)lu/mpia Timocl.8.17; ta\ *panaqh/naia Pl.Ion530b; n. *)olumpia/da Hdt.9.33 (also n. *)olumpi/asin Pl.Ap.36d; e)n *puqi/oisi Pi.N.2.9): c. dat. et acc., ta\ *pu/qia tw=| teqri/ppw| n. D.59.33; pollou\s a)gw=nas ou) pagkrati/w| mo/non, ktl., Plu.2.811d; *)olumpi/asi pai=das sta/dion n.
conquer in the boys' race in the stadium at Olympia, D.58.66: c. dupl. acc., *pu/qia n. a)/ndras Diog.Cyn. ap. D.L.6.33: also in Att. Inscrr. c. gen., *lewnti\s a)ndrw=n e)ni/ka IG2.1291, al.: generally c. acc. cogn., ni/khn n.
win a victory, E.Supp.1060, Pl.R.465d, etc. (cf. infr. 11); also n. tri/poda
win it, Simon.147.
prevail, be superior, mu/qoisin, e)/gxei+, Il.18.252; do/loisi Od.3.121; ka/llei e)ni/ka (sc. krhth/r) Il.23.742; pa=san a)reth\n nenikhkw/s Pl.Lg.964c: c. part., eu)ergetw=n n. X.Ages.9.7. of opinions, etc., boulh\ kakh\ ni/khsen the evil counsel
prevailed, Od. 10.46; ta\ xerei/ona nika=| Il.1.576, Od.18.404; e)ni/ka h( gnw/mh Hdt.5.36, cf. Th.2.12, etc.; h( nikw=sa boulh/ E.Med.912; e)k th=s nikw/shs [gnw/mhs] according to
the prevailing opinion, vote of the majority, X.An.6.1.18, 6.2.12; tau=t' e)ni/ka S.Ant.274; nika=| pa/saisi tai=s yh/fois o( no/mos
is carried, Pl.Lg.801a; su\n ya/fw| ta=| nikeou/sa| SIG265.4 (Delph., iv B.C.): freq. of orators, nika=| . . o( kako\s e)n plh/qei le/gwn E.Or.944; n. gnw/mh|si Hdt.3.82 (so gnw/mh|, v.l. gnw/mhn, Id.1.61, cf.Ar.V.594): freq. impers., e)ni/ka (sc. h( gnw/mh)
it was resolved, c. inf., e)ni/ka mh\ e)klipei=n th\n po/lin
it was carried not . . , Hdt.6.101; te/los ge me/ntoi deu=r' e)ni/khsen molei=n S.Ant.233, etc.; e)ni/khse . . loimo\n ei)rh=sqai
it was the prevailing opinion that . . , Th.2.54; e)n dhmokrati/a| nika=| zh=n
it is preferable . . , Pl.Plt.303b. c. inf.,
succeed in . . , e)ni/khse skorpi/sai Psalm.Solom.4.13. as law-term, n. th\n di/khn
win one's cause, E.El.955, cf. Ar.V.581; simply nika=n GDI5011.11 (Gortyn), Arist.Ath.42.1, Rh.Al.1433a6, PHal.1.58 (iii B.C.), etc.; nikh/seis e)n tw=| kri/nesqai/ se Ep.Rom.3.4:—Pass., c. gen., ai)/ ka nikaqh=| tw=n e)nexu/rwn Schwyzer 177.9 (Crete, v B.C.); v. infr. 11. c. acc.,
conquer, vanquish, *(/ektora Il.7.192, etc.: freq. c. dat. modi, ma/xh| n. *)axaiou/s 16.79; a)gorh=| n. ui(=as *)axaiw=n 2.370; po/dessi de\ pa/ntas e)ni/ka 20.410; ka/llei e)ni/kwn fu=la gunaikw=n 9.130; pa/nta n. a)/ndra . . kakoi=sin
surpass him in miseries, E.Hec.659; n. tina\ e)/n tini Pl.Smp.213e, etc.; mh\ fu=nai to\n a(/panta nika=| lo/gon
excels the whole account, S.OC1224 (lyr.); ni/ka e)n tw=| a)gaqw=| to\ kako/n Ep.Rom.12.21: c. acc. cogn., ma/xhn n. tina/ Isoc. 8.58, Aeschin.3.181, etc.:—Pass., e)/stin a(\ tw=n a)/qlwn di\s e(/kastos e)nikh/qh X.HG4.5.2: c. part., n. a)leco/meno/s tina Id.An.1.9.11, etc. as law-term (cf. 1.5), ni/khs th/n min e)gw\ ni/khsa Od.11.545:—Pass., h(= de/ ka nikaqh=| Leg.Gort.1.23, al.; also of objects in dispute, damages, etc.,
recover, ib.1.28, al.:—Pass.,
to be assigned, adjudicated, ib.1.55. generally,
overpower, esp. of passions, etc., no/on ni/khse neoi/h Il.23.604; mh\ fo/bos se\ nika/tw fre/nas A.Eu.88, cf. 133; [fu/sis] nika=| tw=| h(/ssoni to\ mei=zon th=s e)lpi/dos Democr.176; barei=an h(donh\n nika=te/ me grievous is the pleasure ye
win prevailing over me, S.OC1204: c. inf., mhd' h( bi/a se . . nikhsa/tw toso/nde misei=n let not violence
prevail on thee to . . , Id.Aj.1334: with gen. of comparison, nika=| ga\r a(reth/ me th=s e)/xqras polu/
weighs with me
more than enmity, from the compar. force in nika=|, ib.1357 codd. Pass.,
to be vanquished, Hom. only in part. nikhqei/s (v. supr. 1.1); nika=sqai u(/pnw|, ke/rdesin, A.Ag.291, 342; h(donh=| S.El.1272; sumfora=| E.Med.1195; also u(po\ tou= kakou= Th.2.51; pro\s i(me/rou S.Fr.932.4, etc.: sts. c. gen., i(me/rou nikw/menos A.Supp.1005; au)th=s <te> th=s di/khs . . au)tou= te tou= a)lhqou=s nika=sqai Antipho 5.87: freq. of persons, nika=sqai/ tinos, with gen. of comparison,
to be inferior, yield to, S.Aj.1353, E.Med.315, Cyc.454; cei/nwn neni/kantai qu/rai the doors
give way to the guests, Pi.N.9.2; h)\n tou=to nikhqh=|s e)mou= Ar.Nu.1087.

ni/k-h [i_], h(,
victory, n. fai/netai *menela/ou
victory clearly belongs to M., Il.3.457, cf. Alc.80, etc.; ma/xhs n. Il.7.26, 8.171; n. pole/mou Pl.Lg. 641a, cf. c; h( e)n tw=| pole/mw| n. ib.647b: freq. of
victory in the games, *)isqmi/a n. Pi.I.2.13; n. pagkrati/ou or a)po\ p., ib.7(6).22, 6(5).60: c. gen. objecti, n. a)ntipa/lwn
victory over . . , Ar.Eq.521; h( tw=n h(donw=n n. Pl.Lg. 840c: c. gen. rei, tw=n polemikw=n n. X.Mem.3.4.5; n. dou=nai/ tini Il.16.845, etc.; n. kai\ kra/tos S.El.85; ni/khn nika=n tina, v. nika/w 1.1, 11.1b. later, generally,
mastery, ascendancy, etc., in all relations, ni/khn diasw/|zesqai to keep the
fruits of victory, X.Cyr.4.2.26, cf. 4.1.15.
success in a lawsuit, Od.11.544; in the concrete,
damages, etc.,
recovered, Leg.Gort.9.31. pr. n.,
Nike, the goddess of victory, Hes.Th.384, cf. Pi.I.2.26, etc.; *ni/kh *)aqa/na *polia/s S.Ph.134, cf. E. Ion457 (lyr.), 1529. Astrol., name of sixth klh=ros, Paul.Al.K.3, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.160.

nik-h/eis, Dor. nik-a/eis [a_], essa, en,
conquering, AP 7.428.5 (Mel.).

ni/k-hma, atos, to/, Dor. ni/k-a_ma IPE12.352.26 (Chersonesus), BCH27.219 (Crete):—
prize of victory, victory, Delph.3(1).483, Plb.1.87.10, 16.14.5, D.S.4.33, D.H.3.27, Plu.Lyc.22.

nik-hte/on,
one must conquer, E.Ba.953.

nik-hth/r, in Dor. form nik-a_th/r, h=ros, o(,
winner, ta=s a)ge/las SIG527.152 (Dreros, iii B.C.): pl., nikath=res: oi( a)kmaio/tatoi e)n tai=s ta/cesin, Hsch.

nik-hth/rios, on,
belonging to a conqueror or
to victory, do/ca n. the glory
of victory, Antiph.263; n. fi/lhma a kiss
as the conqueror's reward, X.Smp.6.1; a)=qla n. Pl.Lg.832e. as Subst. nikhth/rion (sc. a)=qlon), to/,
prize of victory, *zeu=, so\n to\ n. Ar. Eq.1253; to\n bou=n e)/labe to\ n. X.Cyr.8.3.33, cf. HG6.2.28; n. a(mi/llhs Inscr.Délos464.10 (ii B.C.): mostly in pl., tw=| kallikottabou=nti nikhth/ria ti/qhmi S.Fr.537; n. labw/n E.Alc.1028; ta\ n. oi)/sesqai, fe/resqai, komi/zesqai, to win the
prize, Pl.Euthd.305d, Phdr.245b, R.612d; ta\ n. tou= kiqarw|dou= IG22.1388.37. nikhth/ria (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival of victory, n. e(stia=n to celebrate
this festival by a banquet, X.Cyr.8.4.1, Plu.Phoc.20; poiei=n D.C.67.9. also in pl.,
decisive proof, Hp. Septim.4.

nik-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
likely to conquer, conducing to victory, X.Mem.3.4.11; u(po/qesis Plb.24.9.4 (Comp.); o(/plon n. OGI90.39 (Rosetta, ii B.C.); to\ -w/taton the
most likely way to conquer, Plu.
Comp. Phil.Flam.2. Adv. -kw=s Eust.1006.28. Subst. nikhtiko/n, to/,
charm for victory, esp. in horse-racing, PMag.Lond.121.390, POxy. 1478.1 (iii/iv A.D.); n. dikasthri/wn PMag.Osl.1.35: pl.,
PMag.Leid. W.8.29.

nik-h/tria, h(, fem. of *nikhth/r,
conqueress, Gloss.

nik-h/twr, oros,
victorious: to\ tw=n N. strat o/pedon, =
Legio Victrix, D.C.55.23.

ni_khfor-e/w,
carry off as a prize, da/krua n.
win naught but tears, E. Ba.1147.

ni_khfor-i/a, Dor. nika_f-, h(,
victory, freq. in Pi., both sg. and pl., P.1.59, O.10(11).59 (pl.). *nikhfo/ria, Dor. *nika_f-, ta/,
festival of Athena *nikhfo/ros, SIG629.24 (Pergam., ii B.C.).

ni_kh/for-os, Dor. nika_f-, on, (fe/rw)
bringing victory, di/kh A.Ch.148. (fe/romai)
bearing off the prize, victorious, Pi.O.1.116; n. a)glai/+a the glory
of victory, ib.13.14; pra=gma n. A.Eu.477; kra/tos S.Tr.186; di/kh E.Ph.781; a)/gra Id.Ba.1200; qeo\s or qeoi\ n., applied to the Ptolemies, OGI89.3 (iii B.C.), PTeb.43.28 (ii B.C.); epith. of Athena, Eros, etc., SIG629.6 (Pergam., ii B.C.), IG11(4).1304 (Delos, ii B.C.), etc.: c. gen., X.Mem.3.4.5.

ni_ki/dion, to/,
small figure of victory, Annuario6/7.405 (Artemis Pergaea).

ni_ko/-boulos, on,
prevailing in the council, Ar.Eq.615.
ni_ko-la/ea, ta/, festival at Delos, Inscr.Délos320B63 (iii B.C.).

ni_ko/-la_os, o(, a kind of
date named after Nicolaus of Damascus, Plu.2.723d, Ath.14.652a, PMag.Par.1.3202, PMag.Berol.1.244.

ni_ko-ma/xa_s [ma^], a, o(,
conqueror in the fight, S.Fr.887 (lyr.).

ni_ko-poio/s, o/n,
causing victory, Aq.Ps.4.1, al.

ni=kos, eos, to/, later form for ni/kh, LXX 1 Es.3.9, BGU1002.14 (i B.C.), IG12 (5).764.2 (Andros, prob. i A.D.; written nei=kos), Ev.Matt.12.20, Vett.Val.358.5, Orph.A.587, APl.5.381, read by Aristarch. in Il.12.276; ei)s ni=kos
for ever, LXX 2 Ki.2.26, al.

ni_kote/leia, h(,
celebration of victory, Stud.Pal.1.76.648 (pl., i A.D.).
niku/rtas, = doule/kdoulos, Hsch. (cf. Hippon.49.5).

ni/mma, atos, to/,
water for washing, ni/mmata e)pe/xein Dromo 2, censured by Phryn.170. ni/mmata prosw/pou
cosmetics, Crito ap. Gal.12.448; but ni/mma prosw/pou
washing of the face, Orib.Fr.82.
nimmo/s, o(, = h( ka/qarsis, Zonar.

ni^n, Dor. enclit. acc. of 3 pers. Pron., like Ep. and Ion. min, for au)to/n, au)th/n,
him, her (but never used reflexively), h.Ven.280, Alcm. 23.44, Thgn.364, Epich.21, Sophr.35, etc.; also in Dor. Inscrr., IG42 (1).121.12, al. (Epid., iv B.C.), Abh.Berl.Akad.1925(5).21 (Cyrene, iv B.C.); au)to/n nin IG42(1).122.47 (Epid.): seldom for au)to/,
it, as in Pi. P.4.242, A.Ch.542, S.Tr.145: less freq. in pl., for au)tou/s, B.8.15, Pi.Fr.7, S.OT868 (lyr.), E.Supp.1140 (lyr.); for au)ta/s, S.OC43, 1123, Ant.577; nin au)ta/s E.Ba.32; for au)ta/, S.El.436, 624. for dat. au)tw=|, Pi.P.4.36, N.1.66 (nisi leg. i(n, i.e. vin).

ni/nnh, h(, perh.
grandmother or
mother-in-law, Demitsas *maked. No.416 (Thessalonica, ii A.D.); also ni/nh ib.No.415 (ibid.); cf. ne/nnos.

ninni/on,
pupus, Gloss.

ni/nnos, o(,
nag, Hsch.; Lat. Dim.
ninnium, Plaut.Poen.371.
ni/non, to/, = e(le/nion, Paul.Aeg.6.88.

nipth/r, h=ros, o(, (ni/zw)
washing-vessel, basin, Ev.Jo.13.5.

ni/ptron, to/, (ni/zw)
water for washing, Poll.10.78: mostly in pl., A.Fr.225, E.Ion1174, Hel.1384, AP12.68 (Mel.); pai=des n. e)/dosan kata\ xeirw=n Philox.2.39. *ni/ptra, ta/, the
Bath Scene, title of play by Sophocles on the recognition of Odysseus by his nurse; also applied to Od.19, Arist.Po.1460a26, and to the
Bath Scene in that book, ib.1454b30.
ni/ptw, v. ni/zw.
ni/rnos: fqei/r (Achaean), h)\
ni/rmos, Hsch. ni/ron: me/ga, Id. niro/s, v. nhro/s 11.

ni/ssomai or ni/somai [i_], Il.23.76, ni/ssei (v.l. ni/sh|) E.Cyc.43 (lyr.), ni/setai Pi.O.3.34, nisso/meqa Od.10.42, ni/sesqe E.Ph.1234, ni/sontai Hes.Op.237, E.Hel.1483 (lyr.); part. niso/menos Il.13.186, 15.577, Od. 4.701, 5.19: impf. ni/sseto A.R.2.824, ni/sonto Il.12.119, 18.566: later pres. subj. ni/shtai Man.3.412: aor. kat-eni/sato Hermesian.7.65:—
go, come, ll.cc.: with Preps. of motion, e)k pedi/ou Il.12.119; e)p' a)nqrw/pous Pi.O.3.10; e)s e(orta/n ib.34; poti\ *)isqmo/n Id.N.5.37; po/lemo/nde, oi)/kade, Il.15.577, Od.4.701; e)pi\ nhw=n n.
go by sea, Hes.l.c.; ou)rano/qen n.
coming down from heaven, AP6.265 (Noss.): c. acc. loci, xqo/na n. E.Ph.1234; n. skope/lous Id.Cyc.l.c.; of birds, Id.Hel.1483 (lyr.); of fishes, Sophr.101 (v. infr.): mainly Ep. and Lyr., used by E., once in trim. (Ph.l.c.).—Freq. spelt nei/ss-, nei/s- in codd., neis- also in Papyri of Call.Fr.1.45 P., Theoc.7.25, but ni/somai Hdn.Gr.2.554, niso/menos IG12(1).202 (Astypalaea, iv/iii B.C.), 12(8).441.2 (Thasos, ii/i B.C.), e)pi-ni/setai Pae.Delph.6; imper. ni/seo Epigr.in Rev.Phil.19.178 (i A.D.); and the Act. form nisou=nti (nhsou=nti codd.) Sophr.l.c.:—later Gramm. (EM606.12, Eust.1288.56) wrongly dist. ni/ssomai pres., ni/somai fut. (Perh. redupl.
ni-ns-omai from ne/（s）omai.）

ni/tr-asma, atos, to/,
soap, Sor.1.82.

nitr-e/laion, to/,
emulsion of soda and oil, Zos.Alch.p.147B., Olymp.Alch.p.91 B.

nitr-i/a, h(,
soda-pit, PPetr.3p.60 (iii B.C.), Str.17.1.23.

nitr-ikh/, h(, tax
on soda, PPetr.3p.294 (iii B.C.), Ostr.Bodl.i 36 (iii B.C.), PTeb.40.5 (ii B.C.), etc.: also -ka/, ta/, PPetr.3p.302 (iii B.C.).

nitr-i=tis, idos, h(,
producing ni/tron, li/mnh Str.11.14.8.
nitr-iw/ths nomo/s, name of a district in Egypt where ni/tron was found, Id.17.1.23.

ni/tr-on, to/, in Hdt. and Att. li/tron (q.v.),
sodium carbonate, Sapph.165, Hp.
Aër.7, Arist. Mete.383b12, IG9(1).691 (Corc., iii B.C.), PCair.Zen.304.7 (iii B.C.), PTeb.182 (ii B.C.), Gal.13.265; n. e)ruqro/n Hp.Nat.Mul.32, cf. Mul. 1.98; n. qala/ssion, i.e. from the Egyptian lakes, Hippiatr.130; as an a)/rtuma, Antiph.142.2; mixed with oil as a soap, Alciphr.3.61, Lib.Decl.26.19. (Cf. Egypt.
ntirj 'natron'.)

nitro-phgiko/s, h/, o/n,
made of congealed ni/tron, Alex.Trall. 12.

nitro-poio/s, o/n,
producing ni/tron, gh= Sch.Ar.Ra.725.

nitr-o/w,
cleanse with ni/tron, Sor.1.83 (Pass.).

nitr-w/dhs, es (Att. litrw/dhs Pl.Ti.65e),
like ni/tron, du/namis Arist.Pr.936a2;
impregnated with n., ta\ n. Thphr.CP2.5.1, Od.65.
alkaline, of mineral springs, Gal.11.387. epith. of Nymphs, *nu/mfais nitrw/desi IG14.892.

nitr-wdi/a, h(,
alkalinity, Ruf. ap. Aët.3.165.

ni/tr-wma, atos, to/,
lye, PHolm.3.22, Hsch.s.v. xale/rupon.
scurf, dandruff, Gloss.

entryFree.sense: snow, acc. from nom. ni/y, which is not found (cf. li/ba, li/pa), Hes.Op.535.

div0.entryFree:
ni^f-argh/s, e/s,
snow-white, Orph.A.669 (sed leg. nif<et>arge/sin): ni/fargos, Hsch.

ni^f-a/s, a/dos, h(,
snowflake, Hom. (only in Il.), mostly in pl., w(/s te nifa/des xio/nos pi/ptwsi qameiai\ h)/mati xeimeri/w| Il. 12.278; bre/xe . . xruse/ais nifa/dessi, a legendary statement of the wealth of Rhodes, Pi.O.7.34; e)/pea nifa/dessin e)oiko/ta xeimeri/h|sin Il. 3.222, cf. Luc.Dem.Enc.5: sg. in collect. sense,
snowstorm, nifa\s h)e\ xa/laza Il.15.170; [pa/gos] bre/xeto polla=| nifa/di was wrapt as in deep
snow, Pi.O.10(11).51. generally,
shower, petrw=n A.Fr.199.7, cf. Th.212 (lyr.), E.Andr.1129; traxei=a n. pole/moio
storm or
sleet of war, Pi.I.4(3).17; o)mbri/a n., of rain, Lyc.876; plhgw=n nifa/des Lib.Ep.112.6. as fem. Adj., = nifo/essa, pe/tra S.OC1060 (lyr.).

ni^f-eto/s, o(,
falling snow, snowstorm, o)/mbron . . h)e\ xa/lazan h)\ nifeto/n Il.10.7; ou) nifeto/s, ou)/t' a)\r xeimw\n polu\s ou)/te pot' o)/mbros Od. 4.566, cf. Pi.Fr.107.11, Hdt.4.50, 8.98, Arist.Mete.349a9, etc.: pl., OGI199.7 (Adule).
rain, Nonn.D.6.267, 8.260. metaph., n. lhmma/twn Lib.Or.57.48.

ni^f-etw/dhs, es,
snowy, [a)/nemos] Arist. Mete.364b21; h(me/ra, nu/c, Plb.3.72.3, Plu.Crass.10; a)e/res Str.4.5.2.
ni^fo-blh/s, h=tos, o(, h(, = nifo/bolos, *)/alpeis AP9.561 (Phil.).
ni^fo/-blhtos, on, = foreg., w(/rh Opp.C.1.429; a)/kra ib.3.314.

ni^fo-boli/a, h(,
snowstorm, Eust.905.3.

ni^fo/-bolos, on,
snowclad, deira/si n. *parnasou= E.Ph.206 (lyr.); n. pedi/a Ar.Av.952; n. a)nabolai/, a burlesque on the bombast of dithyrambic poets, ib.1385; pe/trai *(elikwni/des Limen.3; o)/rea Simm.26.19; o)/rh Plu.Sert.17.

ni^fo/-eis, essa, en,
snowy, snowclad, *krh/ths o)/rea nifo/enta Od.19.338; kat' *ou)lu/mpou n. Il.18.616; n. *)olu/mpou Hes.Th.117; w)/ranos n. Alc.17; n. *ai)/tna Pi.P.1.20; *parnaso/s S.OT 473 (lyr.); sko/pelos Ar.Nu.273.
snow-white, *(ele/nh (v.l. selh/nh) Ion Trag.46.

ni^fo/-ktu^pos, on,
rattling with snow or
sleet, Castorio 2.

ni^fo-sti^bh/s, e/s,
piled with snow, nifostibei=s xeimw=nes S.Aj.670.
ni/fw, v. nei/fw.

ni/yis, ews, h(, (ni/zw)
washing, podw=n Plu.Pomp.73.
ni/yw, ni/yai, ni/yasqai, v. ni/zw.

ni/wpon, to/, = ne/twpon,
oil of bitter almonds, Hp. ap. Erot.
no/a: phgh/ (Lacon.), Hsch. (Cf. ne/w A.) no/a, v. nou=s.

no/ar, to/, (noe/w)
phantasm, spectre, Theognost.Can.80.
noare/ws, v. noh/rhs.
noa^ro/s, dub. sens. in Comp. noarw/teron e)/xrao nu/mfhn Diosc. in PLit.Lond.100c15.
nobakki/zein: to\ o)rxou/menon toi=s daktu/lois e)piyofei=n: seismo\s *nio/bh, Phot. (cf. Nauck TGFp.51).

no-ero/s, a/, o/n,
intellectual, yuxai\ a)naqumiw/menai noerai\ a)ei\ gi/nontai Heraclit.12, cf. Pl.Alc.1.133c (v.l., Comp.); zw=|on e)/myuxon n. te kai\ logiko/n, of the ko/smos, Zeno Stoic.1.32, cf. Ti.Locr.99e; ai)sqhtikw/teron kai\-w/teron to\ lepto/teron [ai(=ma] Arist.PA648a3; n. to/pos Id.Pr. 954a35; pneu=ma n. Placit.1.7.19; noerai\ fre/nes Nic.Al.543; [qeo\n] noerw/teron h)e\ no/hma Timo 60; opp. a)su/netos, S.E.M.7.325, cf. Onos. 1.7; epith. of Apollo, AP9.525.14: Sup., Plot.6.6.8. Adv. -rw=s
in the spiritual sense or
world, i)/qi ei)s *xa/rran n. Ph.1.629, cf. Iamb.Myst. 1.21, Procl.Inst.139; f.l. for noerw=| in Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.44.

no-e/w, Aeol. no/hmi (q.v.): Ep. aor. 1 no/hsa Il.8.91; Ion. e)/nwsa （e)n-) Hdt. 1.86: pf. neno/hka, Ion. ne/nwka （e)n-) Id.3.6; imper. neno/hqi Hilgard
Excerpta e libris Herodiani 30:—Med., Ep. aor. noh/sato Il.10.501; part. nohsa/menos Alc.Supp.7.6, nwsa/menos Thgn.1298, Theoc.25.263, Call.Fr.345, etc.:—Pass. (mostly in med. sense), fut. nohqh/somai S.E.P.2.175, Gal.UP17.1: aor. e)noh/qhn Pl.Lg.692c; also Ion. (e)p-) Hdt.3.122, 6.115: pf. neno/hmai, Ion. ne/nwmai Anacr.10, Hdt.9.53, S.Fr.182, Aëthlius 4: 3sg. plpf. e)ne/nwto (in med. sense) Hdt.1.77. Hdn.Gr.2.253 cites nou=ntai from Democr. (v. infr.) and pf. Pass. ne/notai. —The compds. with a)po/, dia/, e)n, e)pi/, meta/, pro/ are used chiefly in Med.:—
perceive by the eyes, observe (oi( a)rxai=oi to\ n. swmatiko\n . . u(polamba/nousin Arist. de An.427a26), Il.3.396; o)cu\ n. ib.374, Hes. Th.838, etc.; o)fqalmoi=sin, e)n o)fqalmoi=si n., Il.15.422, 24.294.
perceive by the mind, apprehend, to\n de\ i)dw\n e)no/hse 11.599; ou) . . i)/don ou)d' e)no/hsa Od.13.318, cf. Il.10.550, 24.337, etc.; h( d' ou)/t' a)qrh=sai du/nat' a)nti/h ou)/te noh=sai Od.19.478; h)\ la/qet' h)\ ou)k e)no/hsen or did not
take notice, Il.9.537, cf. 5.665; noe/eis de\ kai\ au)to/s thou thyself
art aware of it, Od.21.257; qumw=| noe/w kai\ oi)=da e(/kasta 18.228; n. th=| kardi/a| LXX Is.44.18; pro\ o(\ tou= e)no/hsen one
perceives before the other, Il.10.224: abs., [qeo\s] ou)=los o(ra=|, ou)=los de\ noei=, ou)=los de\ t' a)kou/ei Xenoph.24; tau)to\n d' e)sti\ noei=n te kai\ ou(/neke/n e)sti no/hma Parm.8.34: freq. in Philos., of
thought, ma/lista e)/oiken i)/dion [yuxh=s] to\ n. Arist.de An. 403a8; e)/oike dh\ to\ zh=n ei)=nai kuri/ws to\ ai)sqa/nesqai h)\ n. Id.EN1170a19, cf. 1166a22; kalw=s n. kai\ le/gein kai\ pra/ttein X.Cyn.1.18: also with part. added, w(s e)no/hsen e)/m' h(/menon Od.10.375; of a future event, noe/w kako\n u)/mmin e)rxo/menon 20.367: c. inf., ou)k e)no/hsa a)/yorron katabh=nai 11.62; pi/stei noou=men kathrti/sqai tou\s ai)w=nas Ep.Hebr.11.3: folld. by w(s . . , Od.22.32, cf. Pl.Epin.977c; no/ei q' h(=| dh=lon e(/kaston Emp.4.13:—Med., nwsa/menos Thgn.1298; noou/menos S.OT1487:—Pass.,
to be apprehended by thought, ta\s i)de/as noei=sqai me\n o(ra=sqai d' ou)/ Pl.R. 507b; ta\ noou/mena, opp. ta\ ai)sqhta/, ib.508c; ta\ a)o/rata toi=s poih/masi noou/mena Ep.Rom.1.20.
think, consider, reflect, fresi\ n. "e)/nq' ei)/hn h)\ e)/nqa" Il.15.81; meta\ fresi\ sh=|si no/hson *ai)nei/an, h)/ ke/n min e)ru/sseai h)= ken e)a/sh|s 20.311; ou)d' e)no/hse kata\ fre/na kai\ kata\ qumo\n w(s . . ib. 264; e)p' a)mfo/tera n.
look to both sides, Hdt.8.22: c. acc. cogn., a)/lla noe/ein
to be other wise
minded, Id.7.168; also ei)pe\ d' h(=| noei=s S.Tr.1135, cf. El.1435: part. noe/wn, e/ousa,
wary, discreet, Il.1.577; th\n me/n ken e)paine/sseie noh/sas Hes.Op.12, cf. Od.15.170; ta\ noe/wn le/gei what he says
advisedly, Hdt.8.102; now=n kai\ fronw=n
sane and in his right mind, in wills, Test.Epict.1.1, PPetr.3p.4 (iii B.C.), etc.:— in Med., freni\ qei=a nou=ntai Democr.129; u(yhla\ nenwme/nos Anacr. 10.
consider, deem, presume to be so and so, w(s mhke/t' o)/nta kei=non . . no/ei S.Ph.415; to/de ga\r now= kra/tiston ib.1176; dei= n. sunexh= ta\ e)/noptra Arist.Mete.373a19: c. inf., dei= noh=sai to\ me\n u(gro\n ei)=nai ib. 340b24, etc.; cf. nohte/on.
think out, devise, conceive t<*>to/ <*> e)nai/simon ou)k e)no/hse Od.2.122; e)/nq' au)=t' a)/ll' e)no/hse qea/ ib.382; a)/lla me\n au)to\s e)ni\ fresi\ sh=|si noh/seis, a)/lla de\ kai\ dai/mwn u(poqh/set<*> 3.26; ou) ga/r tis no/on a)/llos a)mei/nona tou=de noh/sei Il.9.104: freq. with neut. pl. Adj., pepnume/na pa/nta noh=sai Od.18.230; a)/ndrwn plei=sta nohsa/menos
most cunning of men, of Sisyphus, Alc.Supp.7.6; o)rqa\ n. Hdt. 8.3:—Pass., e)nqu/mhma nenohme/non ou)k a)to/pws D.H.Th.37.
purpose, intend, e)sqla/ tini Hes.Op.286; kako/n tini Hdt.3.81, cf. X.Hier. 1.15. c. inf.,
to be minded, intend, ou<*>d' e)no/hse e)ceru/sai do/ru
bethought himself, Il.5.665; noe/w fresi\ timh/susqai 22.235; noe/w de\ kai\ au)to\s *(/ektora/ toi lu=sai 24.560; h)= ga\r noei=s qa/ptein sfe; S.Ant.44, cf. 770, El.389, etc.:—Med., once in Hom., ma/stiga . . noh/sato xersi)n e(le/sqai he
thought with himself to take the scourge, Il.10.501; e)ne/-
nwto strateu/ein he
was minded to march, Hdt.1.77, cf. 7.206, 9.53. of words,
bear a certain sense, mean, puqoi/meq' a)\n to\n xrhsmo\n o(/ ti noei= Ar.Pl.55, cf. Nu.1186, Pl.Cra.407e; [ei)] tou=to . . noei= au)tw=| if this
means for him that . . , Id.R.335e; also e)pidei=cai e)qe/lw to\ nuni/ moi sumbebhko\s ti/ pote noei= Id.Ap.40a; to\ noou/menon the
sense, meaning, Phld.Po.Herc.991.4, al.—Not in Th. or Oratt.

no/-hma, atos, to/, Ion. nw=ma Emp.110.10 (but no/hma 105.3): (noe/w):—
that which is perceived, perception, thought, tw=n ne/es w)kei=ai, w(s ei) ptero\n h)e\ no/hma Od.7.36 (cf. o)cu/teron noh/matos Lib.Or.59.148; a(/ma noh/mati 'in the twinkling of an eye', Epicur.Ep.1p.11U.: hence h( a(/ma n. peri/odos
lightning survey, ib.p.32 U., cf. Phld.Mort.37, Plu.Alex.35); n. freno/s Ar.Nu.704 (lyr.).
thought, purpose, idea, design, toiou=ton e)ni\ sth/qessi no/hma Od.13.330; *zeu\s . . e)ni\ fresi\n w(=de no/hma poi/hs' 14.273; noh/mata . . e)ktele/ei Il.10.104, cf. Alc.77, Pi.P.6.29; sofw/tata noh/mata Id.O.7.72; ou)k oi)=d' o)/tti qe/w: di/xa moi ta\ n. Sapph.36; e)kto\s tw=n e)wqo/twn n. sth=sai/ tina Hdt.3.80; to\ me\n n. th=s qeou=, to\ de\ kle/mm' e)mo/n Ar. Eq.1203, cf. Nu.743. in Philos.,
thought, concept, opp. sensation, sense-presentation, Parm.8.34, etc.; fu/sei dih/|rhtai ta/ te n. kai\ ta\ ai)sqh/mata Arist.Fr.87; su/nqesi/s tis nohma/twn Id.de An.430a28;
discursive thinking, as the function of dia/noia, Herm. ap. Stob.2.8.31. Rhet.,
thought as expressed in literary form, D.H. Amm.2.24, Longin.12.1.
understanding, mind, pare/plagcen de\ no/hma Od.20.346, cf. Il.19.218, Thgn.435, Emp.110.10; ai(=ma ga\r a)nqrw/pois perika/rdio/n e)sti n. Id.105.3; qeo\s . . ou)/ ti de/mas qnhtoi=sin o(moi/ios ou)de\ n. Xenoph.23.2.

no-hma^ti/zw,
form concepts, Eust.1545.7.

no-hma^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
rational, later form for nohtiko/s, Hsch. s.v. dra/sths; lo/gos Herm. ap. Stob.2.8.31; ou)si/a cj.ibid.; qeoi/ Id. ap. Stob. 1.41.11 (s.v.l.).
no-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of no/hma 1.4, Arr.Epict.3.23.31.
no/-hmi, Aeol. for noe/w, Jo.Gramm.Comp.3.40.

no-h/mwn, on, gen. onos,
thoughtful, intelligent, e)pei\ ou)/ ti noh/mones ou)de\ di/kaioi Od.2.282, 3.133, cf. Eus.Mynd.20; of philosophers, Luc.Philops.34; noh/mona te/ktona xalkou= Epigr.Gr.907.5 (Sinope).
in one's right mind, opp. parafrone/wn, Hdt.3.34.

no-h/rhs, es,
skilful, e)/rgon Herod.7.3. Adv. Dor. noa_re/ws, = nounexo/ntws, Hsch.

no/-hsis, Ion. nw=sis Timo 44.2: ews, h(:—
intelligence, understanding, opp. ai)/sqhsis, Diog.Apoll.3,al., Pl.Ti.28a, etc.; noh/sei kai\ ou)k o)/mmasi Id.R.529b; superior to dia/noia, ib.511d; including e)pisth/mh and dia/noia, ib.534a; o( nou=s ei(=s kai\ sunexh\s w(/sper h( n. Arist.de An.407a7; n. noh/sews Id.Metaph.1074b34: pl.,
processes of thought, Id.de An.407a24, Pr.917a39, Timol.c. concrete,
idea, concept, h( koinh\ tou= qeou= n. Epicur. Ep.3p.59U.

nohta/rxhs, ou, o(,
ruler of the world of Intelligence, Iamb.Myst.8.2.

no-hte/on,
one must conceive, qeo\n de\ poi=on, ei)pe/ moi, n.; E.Fr.1129, cf. Gal.6.405.

no-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
intellectual, opp. ai)sqhtiko/s, to\ n. Arist.de An.402b16; ta\ n. mo/ria Id.EN1139b12; h( n. yuxh/, opp. h( ai)sqhtikh/, Id.GA736b14, de An.429a28. Adv. no-kw=s Porph.Gaur.17.6.

no-hto/s, h/, o/n, hyperdor. noa_to/s Ti.Locr.95a:—
falling within the province of nou=s,
mental, opp. fato/s, o(rato/s, Parm.8.8, Pl.R.509d, al.; n. kai\ a)sw/mata ei)/dh Id.Sph.246b; n. zw=|a Id.Ti.30c; n. ko/smos Ph.1.5, etc.; opp. ai)sqhto/s, Arist.EN1174b34, Phld.Piet.81, Plu.2.1114d, D.L.3.10. Adv. -tw=s, opp. ai)sqhtw=s, Plot.4.8.6, cf. Ph.1.467, Iamb.Myst.8.6. = nohtiko/s, Orac. ap. Lyd.Mens.1.11. Adv. -tw=s
carefully, LXXPr.23.1.

noqa_genh/s, e/s, Dor. and poet. for *noqhgenh/s,
baseborn, E.Ion592, Andr.912,942.

noq-ei/a, h(,
birth out of wedlock or
by a marriage with an inferior, Plu.Them.1, Aem.8, Comp.Ages.Pomp.1.
spuriousness, tine\s noqei/an tou= prw/tou bibli/ou kateyhfi/santo Olymp.in Mete.4.16.

noq-ei=os, a, on,
of or
belonging to a no/qos: ta\ n. (sc. xrh/mata)
inheritance of a no/qos, Lys.Fr.140S., cf. Ar.Av.1656 (ap.Sch.).

no/q-eusis, ews, h(,
adulteration, interpol. in Suid. s.v. noqeu/ein.

noq-euth/s, ou=, o(,
one who adulterates, Ptol.Tetr.159.

noq-eu/w,
corrupt, gunai=ka Zeno Stoic.1.58; sunoikou=san a)/llw| J.AJ4.8.23; ga/mon tino/s Ph.2.48; e(/teros e(/teron noqeu/wn o)duna=| LXX Wi.14.24: metaph., n. th\n e)pisth/mhn lo/gois kekallwpisme/nois Vett.Val.238.22.
adulterate, Max.Tyr.37.4:— Pass., nenoqeume/nos th=| u(/lh| dia\ to\ swmatiko/n Plu.2.373b; noqeuqh=nai Luc.Deor.Conc.7. Medic., [pureto\s] o(/stis a)\n [to\ ei)=dos] noqeu/sh|
departs from the normal type, Gal.7.339; of persons, n. ta\ tou= me/trou tw=n gumnasi/wn gnwri/smata Id.6.130, cf. 10.601 (Pass.).
consider spurious, to\ "*)/ilion ai)pu/" n. *)ari/starxos St.Byz.s.v. *)/ilion:— Pass., D.L.2.124, Marcellin.Vit. Thuc.43, etc.

noq-ismoi/, oi(,
illecebrae, Gloss.

noqo-ge/nnhtos, on,
of spurious origin, Hsch.

noqo-kallosu/nh, h(,
counterfeit charms, AP11.370 (Maced.).

no/q-os, h, on, also os, on (Call.Fr.279),
bastard, baseborn, i.e. born of a slave or concubine, freq. in Il. (never in Od.), n. ui(o/s Il.2.727, etc.; pai=des n. Hdt.8.103, Pl.Ap.27d; opp. gnh/sios, Il.11.102, Ar. Av.1650; o(/d', ei) n. tis, gnhsi/ois i)/son sqe/nei S.Fr.87; no/qoi kai\ ou)x ui(oi/ e)ste Ep.Hebr.12.8: fem., kou/rh no/qh Il.13.173. at Athens,
child of a citizen father and an alien mother, D.23.213, etc.; no/qos pro\s mhtro/s Plu.Them.1. pl., in Egypt, a class of
temple-attendants, Wilcken Chr.66 (iii B.C.). of animals,
cross-bred, pro/bata PHib.1.32.15 (iii B.C.). generally,
spurious, counterfeit, supposititious, of persons and things, logismw=| tini n. Pl.Ti.52b, cf. Dam. Pr.26; n. paidei/a| Pl.Lg.741a; n. h(donai/ Id.R.587c; a)oidai/ Call.l.c.; no/qon h(=par o( splh/n Arist.PA669b28; ai( n. pleurai/ the
false ribs, Paus. 1.35.6, Gal.UP4.9, Aret.SA2.6; n. pureto/s Gal.11.30; n. sa/lpigc, of a serpent's hiss, Nonn.D.35.214; n. fe/ggos, of the moon, opp. gnh/sion, of the sun, Ph.1.628; n. i(matismo/s
meretricious, Peripl.M. Rubr.39,49. Adv. -qws
insincerely, disingenuously, LXX 3 Ma.3.17, cf. Hsch. of literary works,
spurious, Porph.Plot.16.

noq-o/w,
counterfeit, in Pass., to\n kolakei/a| -ou/menon e)/painon Ph.1.401.
noi/dion, to/, Dim. of no/os, nou=s, Ar.Eq.100 (pl.); = nohma/tion, Philostr.VS2.10.1 (pl.).
noma/d-hn [a^], Adv., cited as parallel to e)pitroxa/dhn, Sch.Il.3.213.

nomad-i/a, h(, (noma/s)
pasturage, steppe, in pl., Peripl.M.Rubr.20:— Adj. nomad-iai=os, a, on, qre/mmata ibid.

nomad-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a herdsman's life, pastoral, bi/os Arist.Pol.1256b1, Dicaearch. ap. Porph.Abst. 4.2; n. diaskeuh/ Plb.8.29.7; ge/nh Scymn.81; also of flying insects,
roving, wandering, o( bi/os n. Arist.PA682b7. Adv. -kw=s
like nomads, Str.2.1.17; n. kai\ *skuqikw=s Id.11.8.7. as pr. n.,
Numidian, i(ppei=s Plb.1.19.2; a)lektruw/n Luc.Nav.23.

nomad-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
nomad, pastoral, bi/os Suid.

noma^do/stoixos, on,
going in a row from pasture, Hsch., Phot.

nom-a/zw,
graze, Nic.Th.950:—Med., Id.Al.345.

no/m-aios, a, on, (no/mos) Ion. and later Gr. for no/mimos,
customary: no/maia, ta/,
customs, usages, ceinika\ n. Hdt.1.135; *(ellhnika\ n. Id.2.91, al., cf. Max.Tyr.38.3; li/qwn leukw=n nomai/wn Inscr.Délos 290.206 (iii B.C.): sg., Hdt.2.49.
prescribed by law, e)kklhsi/a SIG589.4 (Magn. Mae., ii B.C.), cf. GDI5699 (Samos); n. e)parai/ ib.5653c10 (Chios).
nomale/ws: a)dialei/ptws, Hsch. noma/rion: skeu=os tragiko/n, Id.

nomarx-e/w,
hold office of noma/rxhs, PTeb.72.205 (ii B.C.), PAmh.2.101.1 (iii A.D.).

noma/rx-hs, ou, o(,
governor of a region or
province, Hdt. 4.66, Arr.An.5.8.3, Ind.12.7. esp. in Egypt,
governor of a nomo/s 11.2, Hdt.2.177, Arist.Oec.1352a10, D.S.1.73, Arr.An.3.5.4; later, of a district financial officer, PRev.Laws37.3, al. (iii B.C.), Sammelb.6314, al.(iii B.C.), PSI4.361.21 (iii B.C.), PTeb.108Intr. (i B.C.), PSI8.901.11 (i A.D.), BGU1605 (ii A.D.), etc.; n. tou= *)arsinoi/+tou PPetr.3p.205 (iii B.C.); of an official of the town of Antinoöpolis, POxy.1463.1 (iii A.D.), etc.

nomarx-i/a, h(,
province or
district of a noma/rxhs, PPetr.3p.78, al. (iii B.C.), prob. in D.S.19.85; h( th=s n. tra/peza PTeb.350.4 (i A.D.); o( th=s n. lo/gos Meyer Ostr.42 (iii A.D.).

nomarx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
levied on a nomarxi/a, of taxes, logisth/rion tw=n n. Sammelb.5021; n. lo/gos BGU915.16 (i A.D.).
no/marx-os, o(, = noma/rxhs 11, Arist.Oec. 1353a6.

nom-a/s, a/dos, o(, h(, (nomo/s)
roaming about for pasture: oi( noma/des
pastoral tribes, Choeril.3, Hdt.1.15,125, 4.187,7.85, Arist.Pol.1256a31; strathgo\s noma/dwn OGI616.3 (Arabia); n. *sku/qai Pi.Fr.105, A. Pr.709; *)indai/ Id.Supp.284; of the Cyclopes, E.Cyc.120. metaph., of a prostitute, Ph.2.327. pr. n.,
Numidian, Plb.1.19.3,al.: hence noma/des o)/rneis
guinea-fowl, Ptol.Euerg.2（
a) J.; noma/s alone, Artem. ap. Ath.14.663e; n. li/qos Numidian marble, Luc.Hipp. 6. fem. Adj.
roaming, grazing, i(/ppoi S.Tr.271; e)/lafos Id.Fr.89; e)p' a)ktai=s noma/da . . a(lia/eton E.Fr.636; da/malis n. calf
of the pastures, i.e. fatted, LXX 1 Ki.28.24; n. peristerai/
wild doves, Gal.6.435, cf. 12.302; of Oedipus
exposed, turned adrift on Cithaeron, S.OT1350 (lyr.); of irrigation-channels, krh=nai *khfisou= noma/des r(ee/qrwn Id.OC687 (unless
distributing, cf. ne/mw).
pastoral, bi/os Scymn.832. n. tra/peza
game diet, Him.Or.25.3. noma/sin au)gai=s is dub.l. in Tim.Pers.89.

nom-eisfora/, h(,
proposal of a law, Tz.H.11.129.

no/m-euma, atos, to/,
flock, herd, eu)po/kois nomeu/masin A.Ag.1416.

nom-eu/s, e/ws, Ep. h=os, o(, (ne/mw)
herdsman, ku/nes t' a)/ndres te nomh=es Il.17.65; du/w d' a(/m' e(/ponto nomh=es, opp. the chief herdsman, Od.17.214, cf. 16.3, 17.246: generic term including the special ai)po/los, bouko/los, poimh/n, subw/ths, cf. Pl.Tht. 174d, R.370d; bow=n a)ge/lhs n. X.Mem.1.2.32; n. proba/twn Arist.EN 1161a14.
dealer out, distributor, a)gaqw=n Pl.Lg.931d, cf. Min. 317d, 321b. pl., = e)gkoi/lia,
ribs of a ship, Hdt.1.194, 2.96, cf. Hsch.; also, = sxoi=noi a)rme/nwn, Id.

nom-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
pastoral, n. e)pisth/mh, n. te/xnai, Pl.Plt.267b, 267d; nomeutikh/ alone, Ael.NA9.54.
skilled in grazing, ib.14.16.

nom-eu/w,
put to graze, drive afield, in Act., of the shepherd, kalli/trixa mh=la nomeu/wn Od.9.336; e)no/meue nomo\n ka/ta pi/ona mh=la ib.217; a)ge/lhn n. Pl.Plt.265d:—Pass., metaph., of a)nqrw/pwn a)ge/lai, ib.295e. bousi\ nomou\s n.
eat down the pastures with oxen, Lat.
depascere, h.Merc.492. abs.,
to be a shepherd, tend flocks, Theoc.20.35. later, = nwma/w,
direct, manage, Nonn.D.7.110.

nom-h/, h(, (ne/mw)
pasturage, a)mfi/bion . . e)/dwke n. batra/xoisi *kroni/wn Batr.59; noma\s ne/mein Hdt.1.110; noma\s ne/mesqai ib.78, cf. Pl.Lg.679a, Arist.HA575b4, etc.; poimni/wn nomai/ S.OT761: in concrete sense, nomai\ boskhma/twn
herds, X.An.3.5.2.
food from pasturing, Pl.Criti.111C, etc.; ai(=ma, n. sarkw=n Id.Ti.80e; h( prosh/kousa yuxh=s n. Id.Phdr.248b; n. tw=n melittw=n to\ qu/mon Arist.HA626 b20, cf. PCair.Zen.520.10 (iii B.C.).
feeding, grazing, of herds, nomh\n poiei=sqai, = ne/mesqai, Arist.HA596a14. metaph.,
spreading, n. puro/s Plb.1.48.5, Plu.Alex.35; freq. of sores, etc., n. poiei=sqai
spread, Plb.1.81.6; w(s ga/ggraina, n. e(/cei 2 Ep.Ti.2.17, cf. Asclep. ap. Gal.12.995; i(/statai h( n., of baldness, Id.ib.411; nomai/
spreading ulcers, Hp.Prorrh.2.13, cf. Gal.13.860,al.; n. sarko\s qhriw/deis Plu.2.165e.
division, distribution, Hdt.2.52 (pl.), Pl.Prt.321c, al.; of an inheritance, D.36.12; h( patrw/|a (v.l. patrw/|wn) n. Arist.Pol.1303b34; diefqarkw\s nomh=| xrhma/twn to\n dh=mon by
largess of money, Aeschin. 2.76, cf. IG5(1).1346 (Lacon.): in pl., = Lat.
donativa, Hdn.3.8.9, 5.5.8,6.8.8.
paying out or
distribution in bandaging, Heliod. ap.Orib.48.25.1, Gal.18 (2).741. in Law, = Lat.
possessio, Wilcken Chr.41 iii 20 (iii A.D.); makra=s n. paragrafh/, =
longae posses-
sionis praescriptio, Mitteis Chr.374 i 3 (iii A.D.); n. a)/dikos, =
injusta possessio, PTeb.286.7 (ii A.D.); e)pi\ nomh=s pe/mpein, =
in possessionem mittere, Just.Nov.53.4.1. e)n xeirw=n nomai=s, = e)n xeirw=n no/mw| (cf. no/mos 1.1 e), SIG700.29 (Maced., ii B.C.).
nom-h/mata: dikaiw/mata, Hsch. (leg. no/mima: ta\ dikaiw/mata).

nom-i/a, h(,
lawfulness, opp. a)nomi/a, nonce-word in PMag.Osl.1.141.

nom-i/zw, fut. nomiw= Ar.Av.571, Th.4.87, etc.; Ion. 1pl. nomiou=men Hdt.2.17; later nomi/sw Longus 1.1 codd., Procop.Gaz.Ep.12: aor. e)no/misa, poet. no/misa Pi.I.5(4).2: pf. neno/mika Axionic.6.8:—Pass., fut. nomisqh/somai Pl.Sph.240e, etc.: fut. Med. nomiou=mai in pass. sense, Hp.Morb.Sacr.1: aor. e)nomi/sqhn (v. infr. 1.1, 2): pf. neno/mismai, 3pl. nenomi/datai D.C.51.23; Dor. inf. -i/xqai Sthenid. ap. Stob.4.7.63: plpf. 3sg. e)neno/misto Ar.Nu.962: (no/mos):—
use customarily, practise, e(\n to/de i)/dion nenomi/kasi Hdt.1.173; n. glw=ssan
to have a language
in common use, ib.142; fwnh/n Id.2.42; ou)/te a)spi/da ou)/te do/ru Id.5.97; panh/gurin, plhgh\n e)n th=| o(rth=|, Id.2.63; tau=ta . . *(/ellhnes a)p' *ai)gupti/wn nenomi/kasi
have adopted these
customs from the Egyptians, ib.51, cf. 4.27; i(ppotrofi/as e)n *panella/nwn no/mw| Pi.I.2.38; a)rgurosterh= bi/on A.Ch.1003(989); n. qeio/taton no/mon Gorg.Fr.6D.; n. e)kklhsi/an
have a
regular popular assembly, Arist. Pol.1275b7; a)gora=s kataskeuh\n n. (cj. for o)noma/zousin) ib. 1331a32; draxma\s a(=n *troza/nioi nomi/zonti IG42(1).77.16 (Epid., ii B.C.):—freq. in Pass.,
to be customary, ou)/tw tou=to nomi/sdetai Alc.Supp.24; o(/pou to\ xai/rein mhdamou= nomi/zetai A.Eu.423; swfrosu/nh 'neno/misto
was the fashion, Ar.Nu.962: impers., ei)kh=| nomi/zetai Xenoph.2.13; w(s nomi/zetai as
is the custom, A.Eu.32, E.Alc.99 (lyr.), etc.; oi(=a/per n. A.Ag. 1046; oi(=a toi=s ka/tw nomi/zetai S.El.327, cf. 691; h(=| nomi/zetai Id.OC 1603: part. nomizo/menos
customary, ge/ra ta\ n. Th.1.25; eu)xai\ ai( n. Id.6.32; ei)s to\n n. xro/non IG12.19.15; ta\ n.
customs, usages, Hdt.1.35, 5.42, Ar.Pl.1185; ta\ n. musth/ria Heraclit.14; ta\ i(era\ ta\ n. Antipho 5.82; suntele/sai ta\ n. toi=s qeoi=s IG12.22.4, cf. 54.16; ta\ toi=s qeoi=s n. X.Cyr. 4.5.14; freq. of funeral rites, ta\ n. poiei=n Aeschin.1.13, cf. Isoc.19.33; e)peidh\ ta\ n. au)tw=| fe/roito D.18.243: also aor. part., to/ toi nomisqe\n th=s a)lhqei/as kratei= S.Fr.86; ta\ n. E.Ba.71 (lyr.): pf. part., ta\ nenomisme/na toi=s katoixome/nois PRyl.153.6 (ii A.D.), cf. SIG1109.34 (ii A.D.). of a legislator,
enact, e)no/misen e(ni\ i(mati/w| di' e)/tous proseqi/zesqai X.Lac.2.4, cf. 12.3, Cyr.8.5.3: c.acc., Id.Lac.1.7:—Pass., D.C. 37.20; ta\ nomisqe/nta u(po\ *ma/rkou Id.78.22; cf. nomiste/os 1. c. dat.,
make common use of, use, fwnh=| Hdt.4.117; u(si/ ib.63; nomi/zousi *ai)gu/ptioi ou)d' h(/rwsi ou)de/n, i.e. practise no such worship, Id.2.50; a)gw=si kai\ qusi/ais Th.2.38; eu)sebei/a| Id.3.82; ou)/te tou/tois xrh=tai ou)/q' oi(=s h( a)/llh *(ella\s n. Id.1.77; esp.
use as current coin, e)n *buzanti/ois, o(/pou sidare/oisi nomi/smasin nomi/zousi Pl.Com.96 (dub. l.); e)n *lakedai/moni sidhrw=| staqmw=| nomi/zousi Pl.Erx.400b:—hence in Pass.,
to be struck, a)rgu/rion nenomisme/non e)s *tibe/rion, i.e. with the head of Tiberius, Philostr.VA1.15. c. inf.,
to be accustomed to do, nomi/zousi *dii\ qusi/as e)/rdein Hdt.1.131, cf. 133,202, 3.15, etc.:— Pass., neno/mistai ta\ sxe/tlia e)/rga *lh/mnia kale/esqai Id.6.138; gumnou\s ei)sie/nai nomi/zetai
it is customary for them . . , Ar.Nu.498, cf. 1420, Th. 2.15, X.HG2.4.36.
own, acknowledge, consider as, w(s dou/lous n. tina/s Hdt.2.1; to\n proe/xonta e)/tesi n. w(s pate/ra Pl.Lg.879c: w(s is freq. omitted, o)/mma ga\r do/mwn nomi/zw despo/tou parousi/an A.Pers.169; tou\s kakou\s xrhstou\s n. S.OT610, cf. Ant.183, El.1317; tou\s au)tou\s fi/lous nomiw= kai\ e)xqrou/s IG12.71.20; nomi/sai xrh\ tau=ta musth/ria Ar. Nu.143; qeo\n n. tina/
believe in one as a god, su\ *)/erwta ou) qeo\n nomi/zeis Pl.Smp.202d; qea\n ou) th\n *)anai/deian, a)lla\ th\n *ai)dw= n. X.Smp.8.35; n. tou/tous [qeou/s]
believe in these [as gods], Hdt.4.59; ou(\s h( po/lis n. qeou\s ou) nomi/zwn X.Mem.1.1.1, Ap.10, Pl.Ap.24b; tou\s a)rxai/ous ou) n. Id.Euthphr.3b; but n. qeou\s ei)=nai
believe that there are gods, Id.Ap. 26c, Lg.886a (cf. infr. 4): without ei)=nai, di/khn kai\ qeou\s mo/non n. [a)/nqrwpos] Id.Mx.237d; to\ para/pan qeou\s ou)damw=s n. to be an atheist, Id.Lg.885c, cf. 908c, Ap.18c, Prt.322a; qeou\s n. ou)damou= A.Pers. 497:—Pass.,
to be deemed, reputed, considered, oi(=s to\ pe/lein te kai\ ou)k ei)=nai tau)to\n neno/mistai Parm.6.8; *(/ellhnes h)/rcanto nomisqh=nai Hdt. 2.51; oi( nomizo/menoi me\n ui(ei=s, mh\ o)/ntes de/ . . D.40.47; h( -ome/nh (v.l. o)nomaz-) politei/a Arist.Pol.1293b22.
esteem, hold in honour, xruso\n . . periw/sion a)/llwn Pi.I.5(4).2; ou)/te qeou\s ou)/te a)nqrw/pous n. Lys.12.9:—Pass.,
to be esteemed, Pl.Grg.466b. c. acc. rei,
hold, believe, tau)ta\ peri/ tinos Id.Phdr.258c, etc.; e)poi/ei a)/lla par' a(\ e)no/misen Id.Min.320b; a)koh=| n., opp. pei/ra| ai)sqa/nesqai, Th.4.81. c. acc. et inf.,
deem, hold, believe that . . , po/tera nomi/zeis dustuxei=n e)me/; S.OC 800, cf. OT549, X.HG3.4.11; qeo\n nomi/zousi ei)=nai to\ pu=r Hdt.3.16: c. fut. inf.,
expect that . . , S.OT551: aor. inf. is sts. found in codd. referring to fut., e)no/misan e)piqe/menoi r(a|di/ws krath=sai Th.2.3 (krath/sein in same phrase, Aen.Tact.2.3), cf. Th.3.24, Lys.13.6; in S. Aj.1082 the aor. inf. may be gnomic. c. part., nomi/swmen e)kgenhso/menon Th.7.68; no/mize . . a)/ndra a)gaqo\n a)poktei/nwn X.An.6.6.24; no/mize tau=ta dedogme/na Pl.R.450a, cf. D.14.9 (s.v.l.). with w(s, Th.3.88. Pass., with gen. of the person in possession, tou= qew=n nomi/zetai; whose sanctuary
is it held to be? S.OC38; ou) tou= kratou=ntos h( po/lis n.; Id.Ant.738. abs., nomi/zonta le/gein to speak
with full belief, Pl.Phdr.257d (nisi leg. o)neidi/zonta).
frequent, muxo\n n. A.Ch.801 (lyr., dub. l.).
nom-ika/rios, o(, = nomiko/s 11.2, POxy.1131.3 (v A.D.), etc.

nom-ikei=os, o(, = foreg.,
Cat.Cod. Astr.1.95.

nom-iko/s, h/, o/n,
relating to laws, ai)/tia, title of work by Democritus;
resting on law, h)/qh Pl.Lg.625a;
conventional, n. di/kaion, opp. fusiko/n, Arist.EN1134b20; n. fili/a, opp. h)qikh/, ib. 1162b23. Adv. -kw=s
after the manner of law, i.e.
in a broad, general way, Id.Pol.1341b31.
forensic, ma/xai Ep.Tit.3.9; a)gw=nes, opp. logikoi/, h)qikoi/, Philostr.VS1.22.1;
relating to points
of law (opp. matters of fact), sta/sis, zh/thma, Hermog.Stat.2,3; n. o)no/mata law-terms, Id.Meth.2; ta\ n.
law matters, Phld.Rh.1.37 S., Plu.Cic.26. Adv. -kw=s
by legal process, Id.2.533b.
learned in the law, Alex.39, Pl.Min.317e (Sup.);
doctor of the Jewish law, Ev.Matt.22.35,al.
lawyer, notary, Plu.Cic.26, Gal.Libr.Ord.5, BGU326ii22 (ii A.D.).
legal adviser, assessor of a magistrate, Mitteis Chr.372 iii 18 (ii A.D.), etc.; n. a)/ristos CIG2787 (Aphrodisias), cf. BGU361 iii 2 (ii A.D.), etc.

no/m-imos, h, on, also os, on Isoc.2.22, Arist.Mu.400b24:—
conformable to custom, usage, or
law, n. o(/rkos Lexap.And.1.98; n. e)/rwtes Gorg.Fr.6 D.; e)/rga di/kaia kai\ n. Democr.174;
legitimate, n. pai=des E.Ph.815 (lyr.): hence,
customary, prescriptive, fw=s ib.345 (lyr.), etc.; oi( n. qeoi/ Pl.Lg.954a; h( e)pi/desis h( n. Hp.Art.14; no/mimo/n [e)sti/] tini poiei=n ti X.Cyr.8.8.8; n. tina\ dede/sqai Id.Mem.1.2.49.
observant of law, Choeril.3, Antipho 2.2.12, Archyt. ap. Stob.4.5.61; n. kai\ ko/smioi Pl.Grg.504d; n. po/lis Isoc.l.c. no/mima, ta/,
usages, customs, a)/lla a)/lloisin no/mima, sfete/ran d' ai)nei= di/kan e(/kastos Pi.Fr.215, cf. A.Th.334 (lyr.), Hdt.2.79; n. *dwrika/, *xalkidika/, Th.6.4,5; ta\ koina\ tw=n *(ellh/nwn n. Id.3.59; almost, = no/moi, a)/grapta n. S.Ant.455; n. qew=n E.Supp. 19; ta\ ei)wqo/ta n. Pl.Phdr.265a; a)/grafa n. Id.Lg.793a, D.23.70; ta\ peri\ tou\s qeou\s n., to\ pro\s tou\s polemi/ous n., X.Mem.4.6.4, Cyr.1.6.34; n. barbarika/, title of treatise by Aristotle: rare in sg., to\ pa/ntwn n. Emp.135.1.
legal rights, n. kai\ fila/nqrwpa BGU1074.2 (i A.D.);
process of law, toi=s n. xrh=sqai Mitteis Chr.88 i 12 (ii A.D.); a)/neu nomi/mwn a)pwqei=sqai to be
illegally ejected, PFay.124.18 (ii A.D.); ei)/rgesqai tw=n n., i.e. i(erw=n kai\ a)gora=s, of persons accused of murder, Antipho 6.34, Arist.Ath.57.2.
funeral rites (cf. nomi/zw 1.1), Din.2.8; tima=n tinas e)sqh/masi/ te kai\ toi=s a)/llois n. Th.3.58. Adv. -mws Antipho 5.14; kosmi/ws kai\ n. Pl.Smp.182a; n. a)poqanei=n
in a natural way, Lys.Fr.53.4; oi( n. a)qlou=ntes, pepaideume/noi,
professional athletes, physicians, Gal.6.488, 17(1).26, cf. 8.171: Comp. -w/teron X.Mem.3.5.20: Sup. -w/tata D.C.78.13.

nom-imo/ths, htos, h(,
observance of law, Iamb.VP16.69, 33.229.

no/mios (A), a, on, AP6.73 (Maced.), Man.5.161: (nomeu/s):—
of shepherds, n. qeo/s the
pastoral god, i.e. Pan, h.Pan.5, AP6.96 (Eryc.); of Apollo, as shepherd of Admetus, Call.Ap.47, cf. Theoc.25.21, A.R. 4.1218 (but also,
god of Law (cf. sq.), Rendic.Linc.1925.419 (Cyrene, i B.C., dedic. by nomofu/lakes)); of Aristaeus, Pi.P.9.65; of Hermes, Ar.Th.977 (lyr.), Corn.ND16; of Dionysus, AP9.524.14; of Zeus, Archyt. ap. Stob.4.1.138 (expld. fr. ne/mw); of the Nymphs, Orph.H. 51.12; N. o)/rh, in Arcadia, Paus.8.3.11; n. me/los A.R.1.578; to\ n. Clearch.37; n. forba/s Epic.inBKT5(1).112. no/mion, to/,
pasturedues, PStrassb.21.14 (ii A.D.).
no/mios (B), on, = no/mimos, in neut. pl., IG9(1).334.15 (Locr.); o(/rkos o( no/mios ib.45. v. foreg. 1.

nomi/ouros, o(,
watcher of pastures, Arc.73.1.

no/m-i^sis, ews, h(, (nomi/zw)
belief, opinion, h( a)nqrwpei/a tw=n e)s to\ qei=on no/misis the
established belief about the Deity, Th.5.105; parrhsi/a th=s n. D.C.37.17.

no/m-isma, atos, to/,
anything sanctioned by current or
established usage, custom, *(ellhniko\n n. A.Th.269, cf. E.IT1471;
institution, ou)de\n ga\r a)nqrw/poisin oi(=on a)/rguros kako\n n. e)/blaste S.Ant. 296; qeoi\ h(mi=n n. ou)k e)/sti Ar.Nu.248, with a play on signf. 11 (do not
pass current with us). esp.
