Amips.16（Comp.) ; sto/mata Anaxipp.1.44（Comp.) ; n. kai\ mwroi/ Arist.Pr.954a31 ; h(su/xios kai\ n. Plb.31.23.11 ; nwqrai=s e)lpi/sin Babr.16.7. Adv. a)gennw=s kai\ nwqrw=s Plb.3.90.6. Act.,
making sluggish, no/toi Hp.Aph.3.5, cf. S.E.M.6.48.
nwqr-o/ths, htos, h(, = nwqrei/a, Hp.Prorrh.1.13,70, Arist.Rh.1390b30 ; h( e)k tou= gh/rws n. LXX 3 Ma.4.5 : pl., Gal.8.161.

nwqr-w/dhs, es,
accompanied by torpor, r(i/gea Hp.Coac.14.

nwqw/dhs, es, of persons,
lethargic, Aret.SD2.5.
nw=i+, v. e)gw/ III.

nwi/+teros [i^], a, on,
of or
from us two, Il.15.39, Od.12.185 ; = h(me/teros, Euph.9.9.

nw=kar, a^ros, to/,
lethargy, coma, Nic.Th.189, Hsch. ; expld. by ste/rhsis th=s yuxh=s, Hdn.Gr.2.770. as Adj.,
slothful, sleepy, Suid.
nwka^rw/dhs, es, = foreg. II, Diph.18.7.
nwkeli/s, i/dos, h(, = nwxeli/s, Ps.-Dsc.3.103.

nwleme/s, Adv.
without pause, unceasingly, n. ai)ei/ Il.9.317, 17.385, Od.16.191, etc. ; oi( d' ai)ei\ . . n. e)gxri/mptonto Il.17.413 : without ai)ei/, ma/xhn a)li/aston e)/xousi n. 14.58 ; later,
firmly, n. e)rri/zwqen A.R.2.605 :—also nwleme/ws, po/non t' e)xe/men kai\ o)i+zu\n n. Il.13.3 ; n. e)xe/men
persevere, 5.492 ; but n. ktei/nonto they were murdered
without pause, i.e. one after the other, Od.11.413.—Ep. word, used by Tyrt.5.5, 12.17.

nw=ma, v. no/hma. pl.,
owner's marks, brands, on cattle, Hsch. (fort. gnw/mata). = qre/mmata, Id.

nwm-a/w, Iterat.impf.nw/maske Mosch.4.108 :—Med., v.infr. : (ne/mw A.I.I) :—
deal out, distribute, esp. food and drink at festivals, Il.1.471, Od.3.340, etc. ; n. fia/laisin a)mpe/lou pai=da
pour wine into
the several cups, Pi.N.9.51 ; n. propo/seis Critias 1.7 D. (ne/mw A. III. 2)
direct, guide, of weapons, implements, etc.,
handle, wield, e)n pala/mh|si pelw/rion e)/gxos e)nw/ma Il.5.594 ; oi)=d' e)pi\ decia/, oi)=d' e)p' a)ristera\ nwmh=sai bw=n 7.238 ; skh=ptron d' ou)/t' o)pi/sw ou)/te proprhne\s e)nw/ma 3.218 ; a)/leison . . meta\ xersi\n e)nw/ma Od.22.10 ; a)ei\ ga\r po/da nho\s e)nw/mwn
managed the sheet, 10.32 ; nho\s . . oi)h/i+a nwma=|s 12.218 ; a(ni/a xersi\ n. Pi.I.1.15 ;
drive, n. di/frous Id.P.4.18 ; n. ku/lika Theophil.2.5 :—Med., nwmh/sasqai sa/kos Q.S.3.439. metaph., e)n pru/mnh| po/lews oi)/aka nwmw=n A.Th.3 ; nw/ma dikai/w| phdali/w| strato/n Pi.P.1.86 ; pa=n e)pi\ te/rma n. A.Ag.781 (lyr.) ; nwma=t' w)keano/n, nwma=q' a(/la, de/ndrea/ t' au)/tws Orph.H.38.8, etc. : abs.,
to be the guiding power, S.Fr.941.11. of the limbs of the human body,
ply, gou/nat' e)n. Il.10.358 ; o)/mma Parm.1.35 ; fuga=| po/da n. S.OT468 (lyr.) ; n. o)fru/n
move the brow, A.Ch.288 ; ptero\n ai)qe/ri n. AP9.339 (Arch.) ; ph/da . . pamfue\s nwmw=n de/mas IG42(1).130.19 (Epid.). metaph., of the mind,
turn over, e)ni\ fresi\ ke/rde' e)nw/mas thou didst use
to turn wiles
over in the mind, Od.18.216 ; ke/rdea nwmw=n 20.257 ;
ply nimbly, e)n sth/qessi no/on polukerde/a nwma=n 13.255.
observe, nwmw=ntes . . si=ta a)naireome/nous
observing them in the act of foraging, Hdt.4.128 ; of soothsayers, e)n w)si\ n. kai\ fresi/n . . xrhsthri/ous o)/rniqas A.Th.25 ; w)= pa/nta nwmw=n, *teiresi/a S.OT300, cf. E.Ph.1256 ; to\ nwma=n kai\ to\ skopei=n tau)to/n Pl.Cra.411d ; so prob. in h.Cer.373 a)mfi\ e(/ nwmh/sas
peering round him. Med., = ne/momai,
possess, occupy, xw/ran, nh=son, Supp.Epigr.2.511.56, al. (Crete, ii B. C.).—Poet. word, exc. in Hdt. and Pl.Il.cc. and in signf. III.
nwm-h/simos, on, f.l. for lwbh/simos, Nic.Fr.73.3.

nw/m-hsis, ews, h(,
observation, ske/yin kai\ n. Pl.Cra.411d.
motion, Suid.

nwm-h/twr, oros, o(,
one who distributes, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr.3.30, Man.6.357.
one who guides, moves, etc., Nonn.D.12.20, 48.165.
nw=|n, Att. for nw=i+n, v. e)gw/ III.

nwnu^m-i/a, h(,
namelessness, Hsch., CR10.420 (Phrygia).

nw/nu^m-os, in Ep.also nw/numnos (so in a metrical epitaph, BCH36.230 (Rhodes, iii B. C.)), on, (
n(ě)-, o)/numa, o)/noma)
nameless, inglorious, nwnu/mnous a)pole/sqai a)p' *)/argeos Il.12.70 ; geneh/n ge qeoi\ nw/numnon o)pi/ssw qh=kan Od. 1.222, cf. 14.182, Hes.Op.154, Pi.O.10(11).51, A.Pers.1003 (lyr.), S.El.1084 (lyr.), Lyr.Adesp.123B.
unnamed, i.e.
lacking o)/noma, Democr.26. Act.,
not naming, Call.Aet.Oxy.2080.57 (nisi leg. ou)demih=| . .

nwnumni/ (or nwnu^m-nei/),
without being named) : c. gen., *sapfou=s nw/numos
without naming Sappho, i. e.
without knowledge of her, AP7.17 (Tull. Laur.).

nwpe/omai,
to be downcast, lon Hist. 1, Phot. s.v. nenw/phtai (Hsch. also has e)nw/phtai (sic)).
nwrei=: e)nergei=, Hsch. nw/remnos: me/gas, polu/s, Id. ; but also, katw/tatos, a)sqenh/s, e)/sxatos, platu/s, Id.

nw=roy, opos, o(, h(, Ep. epith. of xalko/s,
flashing, Il.2.578, al. ; later, simply,
bright, n. pe/plw| Nonn.D.32.14.
nwsa/menos, nw/sasqai, v. noe/w.
nw=sis, v. no/hsis.

nwta^gwg-e/w,
carry on the back, Clearch. ap. Ath.6.258b.

nwta^gwg-o/s, o/n,
carrying burdens, of animals, Hippiatr.25.
nwt-ai=os, a, on, poet. = nwtiai=os, Nic.Th.317.

nwt-a/kmwn, onos, o(, h(,
with mailed back, Batr.294.

nwt-a/rhs, es, (ai)/rw)
carrying on the back, Suid.

nwt-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
beast of burden, Poll.2.180, Hsch.
nwt-hgo/s, o/n, （a)/gw） = nwtagwgo/s, i(/ppoi Peripl.M.Rubr.24.

nwt-iai=os, a, on,
spinal, n. a)/rqra the
spinal vertebrae, E.El.841 ; n. muelo/s Hp.Aph. 5.18, Pl.Ti.74a ; o( n., without muelo/s, Hp.Art.45 ; n. a)/kanqa Diog. Apoll.6. lepi\s n.
back-plate, Ph.Bel.63.46.
nwt-ia/s, a/dos, h(, fem. Adj., = foreg., fqi/sis Hp.Morb.2.51.
nwt-i^da^no/s, o(, a kind of galeo/s I, Arist.Fr.310 ; called e)pinwtideu/s by Epaenet. ap. Ath.7.294d.

nwt-i/zw, only in aor. exc. in compd. a)po-,
turn one's back,
oi( de\ . . pro\s fugh\n e)nw/tisan
turned their backs and fled, E.Andr.1141 : c. acc. cogn., pali/ssuton dra/mhma nwti/sai S.OT193 : abs., nwti/sas que/tw IPE2.342 (Phanagoria).
cover the back of, bre/fos E. Ph.654 (lyr.).
skim the surface of, po/nton nwti/sai A.Ag. 286. Med., nwti/sasqai
carry on the back, Hsch.
nw/t-ios, on, collat. form of nwtiai=os, Philox.2.28 (s.v.l.) ; n. spo/nduloi Ti.Locr. 100a.

nw/t-isma, atos, to/, (nwti/zw II)
that which covers the back, e.g. wings, Trag.Adesp.541.

nwto-ba^te/w,
mount the back, sens. obsc., AP12.238 (Pass., Strat.).
walk over the ridge of, tu/mbous ib.7.175 (Antiphil.).

nwto/-graptos, on,
having markings on the back, Arist.Fr.297, Eust.1960.20.

nwto-kope/w,
break an animal's
back, slaughter it, Thd. Ex.13.13, Is.66.3.

nw=ton, to/, or nw=tos, o(, pl. always nw=ta, ta/ in early writers (oi( nw=toi LXX 3 Ki.7.19(33)) : the gender of thesg. is undetermined in Hom. and Hes. ; neut. in Pi.P.1.28, 4.83, E.Cyc.237, 643, Ar.Eq.289, Pax747, Antiph.132.6 (anap.), and always in Att. acc. to Phryn. 257, etc. : acc. nw=ton is masc. in Hp.Prorrh.2.<*>0,40, X.Eq.3.3 (as cited by Hdn.Gr.1.215), Arist.HA512b17, 544a6, Ephor.224J. :—
back, both cf men and animals : sg., of a man, Il.5.147, 13.289, etc. ; of a boar, fri/sseinw=ton ib.473 ; n. . . o)/i+os kai\ pi/onos ai)go/s 9.207 ; of horses, e)pi\ nw=ton e)i+=sai 2.765 ; of an eagle, Pi.P.1.9 : pl. freq. used in Poets in sense of sg., dra/kwn e)pi\ nw=ta dafoino/s Il.2.308, cf. Od.6.225, etc. : sts. in Ep. of the
chine of an animal served as food, nw=ta boo\s . . pi/ona ib.4.65 ; nw/toisin d' *)odush=a dihneke/essi ge/rairen 14.437, cf. Il.7.321 ; of men in battle, ta\ nw=ta e)ntre/yai to turn
the back, i.e. flee, Hdt.7.211 ; nw=ton e)pistre/yai Orac.ib.141 ; sn\ mh\ dw=|s n. mhdeni/ PTeb.21.8 (ii B. C.) ; dote/on ta\ n. Plu.2.787f ; dei=cai nw=ta Id.Marc.12 (this phrase also of the winner in a race, AP9.557 (Antip. Thess.)) ; pi/ptein e)pi\ nw/tw| A. Supp.91(lyr.) ; kata\ nw/tou in
rear, kata\ nw/tou gene/sqai tino/s Hdt.1.9, 10 ; to\ strato/pedon kata\ n. labei=n ib.75 ; kata\ n. bohqei=n Th.1.62, etc. ; kata\ nw=ta Theoc.22.84 ;
back of the finger, Procop. Gaz.Ecphr. 168.11. metaph.,
any wide surface, esp. of the sea, e)p' eu)re/a nw=ta qala/sshs Il.2.159, Od.3.142, cf.
